story:
Hi, I'm Anastasia, the founder of the Berlin Yoga Conference. This conference came about as a beautiful idea I had some years ago, trying to find my own way how to make this world a better place. Yoga has literally changed my life, and I would love to share the gift of yoga with a wider community. I have been working on this project for the past 1,5 years, and my goal with it is to provide an authentic yoga experience (BREATHE), to find and explore ways how to apply the yoga practice into the context of modern life (LEARN) and on to create deep and true connections between people (CONNECT). 

ABOUT THE BERLIN YOGA CONFERENCE:

In this beautiful city of Berlin, the conference will bring together local and international teachers carefully chosen for the quality and contributions of their teachings to their communities. The event is a platform for people like you to meet, interact and share, in a creative and safe learning environment. Additionally, there will be a market-place with the focus on fair, sustainable, ecological products, delicious vegetarian & vegan food, dedicated towards creating a single use-plastic free zone. Aside from yoga, there will be classical and electronic music, art experience rooms, Do-It-Yourself workshops, a very unique fashion show, a mini book fair, and a park together with a sandy beach available for swimming!

WHY WE'RE DIFFERENT:

We believe we combined a set of offerings which makes our conference an interesting event to not be missed:

- focus on authentic yoga experience (yoga: not just fitness) for normal people (like you & me)

- modern yoga approach: with the focus on mindfulness, science, and various moving arts

- targeting city dwellers: inspiring & helping them to integrate yoga into their daily routines

- urban/cosmopolitan setting: our venue is an industrial complex powered by green energy

- unique music program: incorporating classical music into the yoga & meditation practice

- encouraging community & networking: in a friendly, real, normal, and professional way

OUR VENUE:

We have booked the most amazing venue for the conference, the Malzfabrik, a beautifully renovated industrial complex that preserves its Berlin charm and is known as a place for sustainability, music, and art. With big halls for more dynamic and active parts of the programming, and smaller rooms for the quieter, introspective sessions, there will be enough space, inside and outside, for meeting people, having picnics, relaxing, and participating in our conscious market fair. 

HOW MUCH WE HOPE TO RAISE:

We need to raise 18,000€ with this campaign so that we can secure the event 

HOW WILL THE MONEY BE USED:

- Marketing & Promotion (media ADS and social media sponsored posts, posters and putting up the posters around the city, Goodie Bags, branded T-Shirts, branded water bottles, banners)

- Pre-production & Setting up the venue (because so far we just have the bare walls of the venue and still need to build a lot of things inside to create a perfect space for our amazing program: stages, places to sit inside and outside, decoration and designed experience rooms)

- Covering the venue costs (the venue has to be completely paid off before the event actually takes place, to be precise: by 05.05.19)

HOW YOU CAN SUPPORT:

- you can donate and make use of one of the perks

- you can buy tickets for yourself and someone you love

- you can share with about this event or this campaign with friends & family

- you can contact us and offer your help as a volunteer or ambassador

SOME OF THE PERKS:

- a chance to win a Berlin Yoga Conference Day pass

- discounted tickets for different amount

- goodie Bags & gift Boxes

- group & private classes with Anastasia

- an opportunity to have dinner with Anastasia

- special pre-conference VIP event

- a stand or a time slot at the conference

- being named a Junior or a Senior Sponsor with all the promotional benefits of such

OUR BRIEF HISTORY:

September 2017: the birth of the idea, research, temporary website, approaching yoga teachers

Nov - Dec 2017: first blog posts, sponsors, partnerships, and finding the people to work with

January 2018: the managing company AnaShe Yoga UG is founded

May 12 2018: Pop Up#1: Meet the Berlin Yoga Conference! Photos: https://goo.gl/CxbGsh

August 18 2018: Pop Up#2: Berlin Summer Yoga Edition Photos: https://goo.gl/je2TE8

November 11 2018: Pop Up#3: the Winter is Coming! Photos: https://goo.gl/S5RVJr

December 2018: Media outreach, new sponsors, collaborators and partners on board

February 9-10 2019: Pop Up#4: Spring, the New Beginning Photos: https://goo.gl/brCaaJ

Mar - May 2019: Pre-production & Preparation for the Berlin Yoga Conference May 24-26 

March 23 2019: Pre-Conference Influencer Event Photos: https://goo.gl/6u9gar

WE'RE IN THE MEDIA:

Yoga Aktuell, Yoga Journal Germany, Happy Way, Emotion Slow Magazine , Vogue Germany, FOGS Magazine, Yoga International

NON-PROFITS WE SUPPORT:

Give Back Foundation, Purple Dot Yoga, YuMiG, Citizen2Be, Yoga für Alle 

SOME OF THE TEACHERS WE WORK WITH:

Sat Bir Khalsa, Esther Ekhart, Ambra Vallo, Lalit Kumar, Cat Shanti Om, Jang-Ho Kim, Helga Baumgartner, Sonia Taylor Bach, Ranja Weis, Annika Isterling, Katharina Middendorf, Ralf Sturm

SOME OF THE BRANDS WE COLLABORATE WITH:

Lotuscrafts, Nice to meet me, Moonchild Yoga Wear, Coco-mat, Feet-Up, Bausinger,  YogaEasy

SOME OF OUR PARTNER YOGA STUDIO & EVENTS:

BECYCLE, Yoga Sky, Element Yoga, Spirit Yoga, Yoga Tribe, Yoga & More, Yogi Bar, Dharma Yoga, BYC, Yoga Festival Italia, Wanderlust DACH, Bali Spirit Festival, Xperience Festival, etc 

So please help us reach our dream! I’ll be forever grateful for your support.

Hope to see you in May 24-26 at the Berlin Yoga Conference.

Love and much appreciation,

Anastasia

story:
I am Karen Sheldon, a mental health therapist, serving Deaf and Hard of Hearing youth, trauma informed yoga teacher, sign language interpreter, mother, wife, daughter, sister, friend. I am a writer. I am a reader. I am an indoor gardener, a chicken keeper, a singer, a dancer, an advocate, an ally.

I want to invite you into the idea of SHIFT.  For me, the idea of SHIFT has been in the works for a long time.  There is so much I would like to share with you about it but let us start with the basics.

In Name:  Seen and Heard Individual and Family Therapy = SHIFT

SHIFT is both a physical concept and process.

Let us start with physical. SHIFT is a mobile office unit, think refurbished shuttle bus, equipped with all the things to support an individual as they shift.

SHIFT

Verb: move or cause to move from one place to another, especially over a small distance.

Noun; a slight change in position, direction, or tendency.

As for the process, SHIFT is slight changes towards wellness, towards healing, towards personal goal setting and achievement.  

Shift your mind: mental health counseling/life-coaching

Shift your body: yoga, mindfulness, meditation

Shift your environment: household organization, routine development, lifestyle consultation

Research continues to demonstrate the connection between the body, mind, and environment. My approach to therapy includes an integration of these three.  These shifts occur when individuals feel SEEN and HEARD.  When the environment is safe, predictable, and the relationship is a trusting one.  When the process is accessible and culturally appropriate.

Currently, my work involves loading into my family car and trekking all over Northern Minnesota.  I pack in all the playdough, dry erase boards, worksheets, yoga mats, fidgets, sensory items, sand tray, and play therapy items my car will hold.  Off I go.

Before Covid (BC) I would arrive at a school and cross my finger we could set up in a small office or empty classroom.   More often my client and I would end up meeting in an athletic trainers office, the back of the storage closet with gallons of paint, tubs of glue sticks, and crafty pom-poms, at a table in the library for all curious eyes to see, or worst of all—the principles office. 

I thought that was difficult, but therapy now means meeting at school is basically off the table.  Instead, I roll up to the homes of my clients.  The homes where typically families, and extended families are hunkered down together with little to no privacy available.  I meet with my clients in the yard, on a blanket.  At least I did… but now, when the temperatures drop and snow begins to fly the yard isn’t an option.   Telehealth has been a lifesaver (literally) for some in this changing world, but for Deaf or Hard of Hearing client, there are often additional barriers using telehealth- no internet, no device, no privacy, no structure at home, limited language; to name a few.

By contributing to this campaign, you will be key in providing a safe, private, consistent space in which to create a therapeutic container.  You will be foundational in providing a resource to those in rural and urban communities alike.  Your contributions will break down many of the common barriers that exist in the pursuit of mental health and wellness. SHIFT will be able to reach those who might otherwise go without support or without support accessible to their language needs. Your contributions will allow me to take my unique skills and education in sign language, Deaf culture, trauma, trauma- informed yoga, and early childhood intervention further and support wellness across the state.

What I Need & What You Get

The goal for this campaign is $15,000.  Most of that amount would go to the purchase of the vehicle and interior transformation to mobile office.  The remainder of money raised will be used to hire skilled graphic design work for the exterior office impact and general SHIFT brand development.  Remaining funds will be invested into the development of SHIFT in terms of intervention materials, marketing, and ongoing vehicle maintenance.

What’s in it for you?  Well, support of this fundraising campaign comes with the automatic and renewable resource of internal feel goods; knowing you have contributed to a cause that will bring mental health and wellness to people who might otherwise not have access.  Every time you see this sweet ride roll past, or watch the transformation story on your social media feed, you’ll be able to say “I helped make that!”.   

Beyond the warm fuzzies and pride of investing in community wellness, a variety of perks are available with new perks being offered all the time. 

The perks may include swag bundles, art created by local Duluth artists, SHIFT your Mind  sessions., SHIFT your Body yoga sessions, SHIFT your Environment consultations, yoga class passes, a SHIFT yoga retreat, and more!  New perks are being added often! 

My promise is to honor your investment equitably in my appreciation and reciprocation.  Keep checking back for perk updates! 

The Impact

Below are some mental health statistics.   I choose to share these because mental health is a problem everywhere and it cannot remain a secret.   The bolded statistics reflect youth and are bolded for two reason. First, youth are the primary population I work with, so these numbers are personally important. Second, kids with untreated mental health issues become adults with untreated mental health issues.  Those issues impact their ability to be the best versions of themselves, and all the parts of living and leading a life that come after. The italicized statistics are specific to Deaf and Hard of Hearing youth—an even more narrow and underserved population, those I’ve spent nearly 20 years training to serve and support towards mental health and wellness. (I could also, and tend to go on and on and on about Deaf mental health, so I tried to keep it brief-ish).

  • Youth mental health is worsening. 9.7% of youth in the U.S. have severe major depression, compared to 9.2% in last year’s dataset. This rate was highest among youth who identify as more than one race, at 12.4%. (www.mhanational.org)
  • Even before COVID-19, the prevalence of mental illness among adults was increasing. In 2017-2018, 19% of adults experienced a mental illness, an increase of 1.5 million people over last year’s dataset. (www.mhanational.org)
  • Deaf children are more vulnerable than hearing children to neglect and emotional, physical, and sexual abuse. 50% of deaf girls has been sexually abused as compared to 25% of hearing girls. 54% of deaf boys have been sexually abused as compared to 10% of hearing boys. (Schwenke, 2011)
  • Suicidal ideation among adults is increasing. The percentage of adults in the U.S. who are experiencing serious thoughts of suicide increased 0.15% from 2016-2017 to 2017-2018 – an additional 460,000 people from last year’s dataset. (www.mhanational.org)
  • There is still unmet need for mental health treatment among youth and adults. 60% of youth with major depression did not receive any mental health treatment in 2017-2018. Even in states with the greatest access, over 38% are not receiving the mental health services they need. Among youth with severe depression, only 27.3% received consistent treatment. 23.6% of adults with a mental illness reported an unmet need for treatment in 2017-2018. This number has not declined since 2011. (www.mhanational.org)
  • The existence of one – time-sensitive – language acquisition window means a strong possibility of permanent brain changes when spoken language is not fully accessible to the deaf child and sign language exposure is delayed, as is often standard practice. (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/)
  • Young people are struggling most with their mental health.  Not only are the number of youth searching for help with their mental health increasing, but throughout the COVID-19 pandemic youth ages 11-17 have been more likely than any other age group to score for moderate to severe symptoms of anxiety and depression. (www.mhanational.org)
  • Rates of suicidal ideation are highest among youth, especially LGBTQ+ youth. In September 2020, over half of 11-17-year-olds reported having thoughts of suicide or self-harm more than half or nearly every day of the previous two weeks. From January to September 2020, 77,470 youth reported experiencing frequent suicidal ideation, including 27,980 LGBTQ+ youth. (www.mhanational.org)
  • Language deprivation can cause cognitive delays and mental health difficulties across the lifespan. Mental health clinicians often see language deprivation and language dysfluency being a common “symptom” in deaf individuals who seek treatment, and are subsequently admitted to inpatient hospitals (Black & Glickman, 2006). For some of these deaf patients, language deprivation is so severe that it may be its own mental health disorder – a “language deprivation syndrome” (Glickman, 2007, 2009; Gulati, 2003, 2014; W. C. Hall, Levin, & Anderson, in press; Humphries et al., 2016b). (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/)
  • Prevalence of mental health issues appears to be proportionally elevated in the deaf population, along with a lower quality of life (Fellinger et al., 2005; Fellinger, Holzinger, & Pollard, 2012). Higher rates of interpersonal trauma are also a concern as are distinct traumas unique to being a deaf child raised in a hearing world (Anderson & Leigh, 2011; Anderson, Wolf Craig, Hall, & Ziedonis, 2016 Additionally, one study of deaf college students demonstrated higher rates of child maltreatment, lifetime trauma, and post-traumatic stress symptoms compared to their hearing peers (Schenkel et al., 2014). (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/)
  • People screening at risk for mental health conditions are struggling most with loneliness or isolation. From April to September 2020, among people who screened with moderate to severe symptoms of anxiety or depression, 70 percent reported that one of the top three things contributing to their mental health concerns was loneliness or isolation. (www.mhanational.org)

SHIFT will be a unique, one of a kind source for those in need, with the unique bonus of being able to reach those individuals where they are; overcoming many of the current barriers.  The statistics above mentioned language deprivation, an incredibly important topic, I cannot go into detail about here.  If you’d like to have a better understanding I highly recommend this brief video.

Risks & Challenges

With any new venture there are risks, and this is no different.

What if you don’t raise all the money?  

I’ve seen incredible things happen when community pulls together for the greater good and I don’t think this will be any different. However, if not all the money is raised, that which IS raised will still go towards the purchase of a vehicle.  What comes after will simply take more time, creativity, and a bit more DIY.

What about the competition?

In the current landscape, the competition for mental health and wellness occur in mainly two ways: telehealth and brick and mortar buildings.   Neither of those are much competition to services that can arrive at your doorstep, offering face to face connection.

What about Covid?

Covid is one of the primary reasons that NOW seems like the right time for this model.  Mental health risks rise while access declines.  SHIFT will be a controlled environment ensuring those who enter are not demonstrating symptoms. Safety measures such as keeping 6ft and wearing masks will be followed.  The access to intervention items and office space itself can be controlled allowing for proper cleaning between clients.   And best yet, when the weather allows; many of the services can be provided outdoors, soaking up the healing sunshine and fresh air.

These risks do not worry me.  I am a believer in the best outcomes. That we all do better when we all do better.  Adaptability has been a foundational component in my professional life thus far, I do not think SHIFT will be any different.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute in terms of money to this campaign; I understand, and I thank you for your support by reading this far!   Even if you are not able to donate at this time you can still make an impact on this campaign.  Please share this opportunity with your friends, family, and professional networks.  The more people that see and read about SHIFT the more likely rubber will meet the road.

Thank you for reading. 

Thank you for you support.

 

~Karen Sheldon

People screening at risk for mental health conditions are struggling most with loneliness or isolation. From April to September 2020, among people who screened with moderate to severe symptoms of anxiety or depression, 70 percent reported that one of the top three things contributing to their mental health concerns was loneliness or isolation. (www.mhanational.org)
SHIFT will be a unique, one of a kind source for those in need, with the unique bonus of being able to reach those individuals where they are; overcoming many of the current barriers.  The statistics above mentioned language deprivation, an incredibly important topic, I cannot go into detail about here.  If you’d like to have a better understanding I highly recommend this brief video.Risks & ChallengesWith any new venture there are risks, and this is no different.What if you don’t raise all the money?  I’ve seen incredible things happen when community pulls together for the greater good and I don’t think this will be any different. However, if not all the money is raised, that which IS raised will still go towards the purchase of a vehicle.  What comes after will simply take more time, creativity, and a bit more DIY.What about the competition?In the current landscape, the competition for mental health and wellness occur in mainly two ways: telehealth and brick and mortar buildings.   Neither of those are much competition to services that can arrive at your doorstep, offering face to face connection.What about Covid?Covid is one of the primary reasons that NOW seems like the right time for this model.  Mental health risks rise while access declines.  SHIFT will be a controlled environment ensuring those who enter are not demonstrating symptoms. Safety measures such as keeping 6ft and wearing masks will be followed.  The access to intervention items and office space itself can be controlled allowing for proper cleaning between clients.   And best yet, when the weather allows; many of the services can be provided outdoors, soaking up the healing sunshine and fresh air.These risks do not worry me.  I am a believer in the best outcomes. That we all do better when we all do better.  Adaptability has been a foundational component in my professional life thus far, I do not think SHIFT will be any different.Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot contribute in terms of money to this campaign; I understand, and I thank you for your support by reading this far!   Even if you are not able to donate at this time you can still make an impact on this campaign.  Please share this opportunity with your friends, family, and professional networks.  The more people that see and read about SHIFT the more likely rubber will meet the road.Thank you for reading. Thank you for you support. ~Karen Sheldon

story:
Hello!

My name is Alison Sanchez and I created the Female Empowerment Bracelet in 2011 when I recognized the need for an uncomplicated tool to educate young women about the menstrual cycle.  Nearly ten years later and the requirement for such a tool remains high throughout the world but most especially in developing countries such as the Republic of Ghana. 

Menstrual education and health is a main objective of the non-profit organization Empowerment For Sustainable Livelihood in Ghana. 

We have teamed up to create a fundraising campaign for the vulnerable young women in Ghana who must fight period poverty and harmful myths and superstition surrounding menstruation. 

Life in the developing world is hard enough, imagine not understanding how your own body works and what you can do to pursue or impede pregnancy? The girls have many questions about what is going on in their bodies concerning their cycles as a result of inaccurate or incomplete information. Such a tool will enable these girls to make sound decisions regarding their sexual reproductive health.

 

How will this bracelet help?

Menstruation and female reproductive health are issues that are not talked about openly and factually is the culture in Ghana. The bracelets are an excellent way to introduce young women to the concept of menstruation and fertility and with them they will gain a better understanding of the changes that occur in their body throughout their reproductive years.  These simple bracelets can have a lasting and empowering impact on the young women who own and use them. These bracelets are extremely practical tools given the setting these young women live in. The bracelet is a tool for a better future. 

Each $5 donation will go directly into the hands of a girl in Ghana in the form of a bracelet. 

What is the Female Empowerment Bracelet?

The Female Empowerment Bracelet (Feby for short) is a learning tool and calendar for the average woman's menstrual cycle. 

Each bracelet consists of 28 wooden beads of varying colour hand strung on an elastic cord and tied with a knot that acts as a movable marker.

The beads are arranged in a sequence that symbolizes the changes that occur in the body and emotions of a woman as relating to her menstrual cycle.

Each bracelet comes with an informational pamphlet that highlights ways in which a woman can better understand the changing signs and symptoms in her body of menstruation, ovulation and premenstrual syndrome. 

This bracelet has been approved and embraced by medical and educational professionals alongside mothers, daughters and all women. 

The Impact

The menstrual cycle is repetitive and predictable. Knowing what is happening within their own bodies on a day-to-day basis will inform a woman's actions and decisions. These bracelets are an easy, tactile and visual tool which will help in numerous ways including:

Helping young women clearly understand the entire menstrual cycle and their fertility and thus be able to make informed decisions that are in their best interests.

The bracelets are inexpensive, reusable, non-toxic, transferable and are made of renewable material (wood). 

As this bracelet encourages young women to learn about their bodies and cycles,  they most likely will be better able to express their opinions and feelings about their sexuality and health moving forward. 

Having something pretty to keep and wear in and of itself will be a treat for these impoverished women. When you add in the knowledge and empowerment that comes with understanding their bodies, you have something that will impact them positively for a long time to come. 

One need not be literate to understand the concept of colours and sequence.Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't personally contribute funds, you can help by spreading the word about this campaign.  

Please share this campaign through Facebook, Twitter and any other social media platforms. 

Please don't be shy - go ahead and use the Indiegogo share tools and help us empower women in Ghana.

Thank you ever so for taking the time to read this. With your support a brighter future will be possible. 

Peace, love and empowerment to all! 

Looking for more information? Check the project FAQ

story:
My story

My name is Emanuela Fulli, I am Italian and I live in the UK. I am a Coach, Counsellor, Reiki 2 practitioner and I have a Level 2 Nutrition and Health certificate. I love cooking, travelling and learning. I adore nature and I want to live life in a way that totally respects it! 

In 2019 my husband and I bought an abandoned property in Latina, in the Lazio region in Italy (south of Rome). We are planning to create a place that will be in harmony with the countryside. A place that provides a base to inspire people to change their lives for the good of themselves and the good of nature. A place where everyone can experience balance, peace and happiness. A place where we can share our life journey and the path towards happiness.

Our place is designed to: 

- be self-sufficient, we plan to be able to produce everything we need;

- respect the environment (the aim is zero-waste, plastic-free, chemical-free);

- follow permaculture principles;

- welcome guests to stay in B&B, as location for events, workshops and a place to take care of health and wellbeing.

The project is in honour of the next generations and our future in this world. We do not want to 'use' the planet, we want to blend 'the old way' of living together with the modern knowledge and approach. 

We have already achieved a great deal (purchased the country house and bought the land next door) but now we need your help to be able to achieve our goals.

Together with some government help, we will take care of the restoration of the house, which will be our home but also a place to create a community. We need help with the work to be carried on the land that have to do with the permaculture approach.

Our next steps are:

1) buy and install an alarmed fence all around the property, as we have already been victims of fly tipping, vandals and burglars (the place has been abandoned for many years!) which is unfortunately a constant set back.

2) rent a mechanical plough and 'open up' the land to provide oxygen;

3) buy and spread dry agricultural gypsum (CaSO4.2H2O) calcium sulphate hydrate to help the soil to regenerate and become the right environment for food production;

4) trim and maintain existing plants and trees to help them restart producing;

5) buy and plant around 50 types of different trees and plants with different functions providing food, materials, shade etc. (olive trees, vines, cherry, apricot, pear, apple, avocado, kiwi and many more);

6) design and execute a fully functioning food forest;

7) design and build shade house, plant nursery, tool shed, machinery storage, ponds, bio lake, irrigation system, animal pens; 

8) agricultural tools and machinery;

9) everything needed;

10) any other related business.

 

The GREAT NEWS is that... THIS IS NOT A FREE DONATION! :)

You will get something very SPECIAL in return!

Check the perks section and select the item ;)

 

Please help us to create a wonderful place for a new type of community, please help us to create a better world, please help us to show everybody that it is possible to live in harmony with nature, and please help us to make steps towards a considerate approach to our existence!

 

If you cannot contribute, please share our campaign with others.

story:
Hi! 

My name is Haley. I am a mountain mama in Golden, BC. I have been practicing yoga for 10 years and recently became a certified instructor. Our 200 hour program was SO amazing for me in so many ways. I already knew the benefits, and the power that yoga has to create a balanced, and happy life - but going deeper into my practice made me realize just how important a daily practice is. 

When I started my teacher training, I didn't even think that I wanted to teach. I really just wanted to dive further into my practice. However, throughout my training I realized that I needed to share this knowledge! And who better to share it with than our kids?! 

I want to teach children how amazing it feels to FILL our lungs to the fullest - to be KIND to one another and to MOVE our bodies in a gentle, non-competitive way. I decided that an after school program is just what we need! My goal is to help the children in our community get grounded after a long day of school by discussing mindfulness, healthy eating, crafting and YOGA!

 

I am trying to raise money to get this program off the ground! As a stay at home mom, I just simply do not have the resources to buy the equipment I would like to have to run this program. 

The money that I raise will be purchasing new mats & yoga props as well as paying for a security deposit for the building that I hope to run this program out of. It will also help to fund some additional, kid-specific yoga training so that I have as many tools in my belt as possible to make sure that your kids have the best time possible! 

Based on my research I will need $1500 maximum to get started. That means I will have everything I need to comfortable run this program - right down to craft supplies and smoothie ingredients!

I am not the type of person to ask for help financially when it comes to my own dreams & goals - so this is completely out of my comfort zone. But - when I have talked to parents in town about what I plan to offer, everyone seems so excited and agrees that an after school yoga program is something that is missing from what our town has to offer. This campaign is going to help lock down my ideas and get the ball rolling!

I LOVE hanging out with kids - the more the merrier! It seems like there are always at least 5 kids at my house at all times and it fills my bucket to know that children feel happy being in our home. During the winter season, I work at the daycare at our local ski hill. Being able to spend time on the mountain with all of those little ski bums is my favourite part of winter! Aside from yoga, crafting is one of my most favourite past times! This will most definitely be a part of our program!

It is A-OK if we don't reach our entire goal! I will still use whatever funding we manage to receive towards the equipment needed to start up our after school program. The program might just have to launch a little later than I had hoped for - and that is okay! It just needs to happen!

 

Because I am so passionate about the importance of teaching yoga to children, I don't need to make a profit. I just want to be able to own my own equipment, share my love of yoga and offer something special to our wonderful community. 

If you are interested in donating, every $40 that you donate will ensure that your child has a spot in one of our 4-week programs. That breaks down to $10 per session and less than $5 an hour!

If you are unable to contribute financially - that is fine, too! I totally get it! You can help by spreading the word - or maybe you have a great idea that you think would be a beneficial addition to Ahimsa Kids!

Love working with children? Live in Golden? Talk to me to become a guest teacher at our after school program!

story:
Short Summary

We're Lauren & Veronica, besties who love the sun, fitness, and travel! Last year was our first trip to Greece, and we totally fell in love with the beaches, the wine, the winding blue and white towns, and the amazing people we met.

​The only problem was finding a great outdoor workout. Yoga retreats were 2 weeks long. Gyms were inside. And running along rocky cliffs and rural roads sounded... unwise. So we got inspired! And came up with Sweat Vacay. And here we are a year and half of work later, almost ready to launch!


This launch is our first global venture together, and we can't wait to bring group-style fitness to the hottest vacay locales all over the world. We're so excited to be launching in May in Mykonos. Building this company has been the best experience of our lives.
 

What We Need & What You Get

Together we have contributed about 30k to our venture and have take 3 research trips to Greece to secure partners and vendors, and to interview instructors for our Sweat Vacay team. We have locked down and started work with our legal teams in both US & Greece. Lauren is now working full time on Sweat Vacay. And we're proud to say we've established an amazing Greek community that wants us to succeed :D

 

In addition to our formal friends & family investment round*, we are setting a goal to raise $25,000. With your help, we will be able to pay some of our American and Greek legal fees and buy the necessary equipment to get started - like yoga mats and spin bikes.

By contributing to our crowd-sourced raise, you get:
•$25: Sweat Vacay sticker & thank you mention on our website
•$40: Sweat Vacay tee or tank
•$50: one class of your choice
•$75: two classes of your choice
•$75: one class and one Sweat Vacay tee or tank
•$100: Sweat Vacay tee or tank and yoga mat
•$150: two classes and two Sweat Vacay tees or tanks
•$500: two classes, two Sweat Vacay tees or tanks, two beach beds at luxury beach bar + a bottle of local wine
•$500: local Mykonos gift basket including two Sweat Vacay tees or tanks

*If you are interested in becoming an investor, please email us directly at Info@SweatVacay.com
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That's cool. Here are some other ways you can help us out:

  • Share our campaign with friends or post it on your social media page
  • Know any Greek friends we should meet? Any and all advice on culture and business is super helpful

story:
Summary

Together, we can create a new herbal medicine line that brings together all the worlds -- human, plant, stone, fungi, and beyond -- that draws from the wisdom of Clinical Western Herbalism and the ancient traditions of Ayurveda and Traditional Chinese Medicine.

Adaptogens are superfoods, herbs, and mushrooms that help expand your body's capacity to handle mental, physical and emotional stress, creating space and energy for ultimate creativity, productivity, wholeheartedness and vision.

My name is Riyana Rose Sang, and I'm the former program director of the Ohlone School of Herbal Medicine, a long-time witch and yogi, and I'm excited to bring into the world this truly integrated, nourishing medicine line.

My intention was to roll this out in Spring of 2019, self-funded, but over the last two weeks I've received the VERY strong message that the time is NOW to build our capacity, resilience, creativity, and deep connection to the healing power of the plants, the stones, the fungis and the earth herself, 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • This is my first Indiegogo campaign for fundraising for this project, one which I hope will help get our first batch off the ground and into production in time for the holidays! Depending on the response to our first production run, if we decide to scale up, we might do another one later. But my hope is to cover the costs of purchasing all organic and wildcrafted herbs for this medicine line and get us going ASAP!
     
  • For each $30 you donate, you'll receive one of our Adaptogenic Alchemy powder blends... if you have deeper pockets and can donate more, $150 or more-- you'll get the whole set! It's like your very own home apothecary, delivered to your door! 

    Projected retail cost: $40 each or $220 for the set.

    (Or go in on them with a friend! The jars are generous 10oz jars, so you can split them each in half or pick your favs)

    (Did I mention, one of my superpowers is making delicious medicine? These are going to be wonderful in your smoothies, on top of oatmeal or granola, baked into treats, or as luscious creamy beverages mixed into the milk or mylk of your choice).


    The Blends:


    Morning Practice (all chakras):

    Milky Oats, goji berry, maca, agaricon mushroom, ashwaganda, cardamon, cinnamon, clove, pink sea salt, clear quartz essence, morning glory essence.

     

    Alchemical Detox (1&2 & Crown)

    Aligns and integrates the first chakra (detoxification and rooting) with the second chakra (digestion, body intuition) for a clean sweep of all chakras / body systems. Restores and revives energy, especially after periods of intensity.

    Turmeric, roasted dandelion root, roasted chicory root, maitake, ginger, cinnamon, clove, frankincense, black pepper, black sea salt, smoky quartz essence.

    Luscious (2 & 4 chakras)

    Rose Petals, pomegranate, maca, mucuna, shatavari, cordyceps, bee pollen, pink sea salt, moonstone essence.

    Deep Vitality (3rd chakra)

    Mesquite, golden berry, schisandra berry, siberian ginseng, blazei mushroom, pine pollen, pink sea salt, citrine essence, yarrow essence.

     

    Wholehearted (a heart chakra awakening)

    Cacao, reishi mushroom, rose petals & hips, hawthorn berry, damiana, cinnamon, vanilla, pink sea salt, rose quartz essence, white rose essence.

     

    Beauty & Bliss (5 & 7 chakras)

    Chamomile, lucuma, mucuna, ashwaganda, lion’s mane mushroom, tocotrienols, pearl, pink sea salt, california wild rose essence, mimosa essence.

     

    Witch’s Eye (2 & 6 chakras)

    Cacao, chaga mushroom, roasted dandelion root, lavender, poppy seed, black sea salt, opium poppy essence, mugwort essence, hematite essence, amethyst essence.
     

  • Other Ways You Can Help...

If donating just isn't a possibility for you right now, no worries! Perhaps, if you'd like to see this herbal medicine line get out into the world, you'd be willing to share this campaign?

Thank you thank you thank you thank you!

Much love,
Riyana

Together, we can create a new herbal medicine line that brings together all the worlds -- human, plant, stone, fungi, and beyond -- that draws from the wisdom of Clinical Western Herbalism and the ancient traditions of Ayurveda and Traditional Chinese Medicine. 
Adaptogens are superfoods, herbs, and mushrooms that help expand your body's capacity to handle mental, physical and emotional stress, creating space and energy for ultimate creativity, productivity, wholeheartedness and vision.
My name is Riyana Rose Sang, and I'm the former program director of the Ohlone School of Herbal Medicine, a long-time witch and yogi, and I'm excited to bring into the world this truly integrated, nourishing medicine line.My intention was to roll this out in Spring of 2019, self-funded, but over the last two weeks I've received the VERY strong message that the time is NOW to build our capacity, resilience, creativity, and deep connection to the healing power of the plants, the stones, the fungis and the earth herself, 
 
What We Need & What You Get

This is my first Indiegogo campaign for fundraising for this project, one which I hope will help get our first batch off the ground and into production in time for the holidays! Depending on the response to our first production run, if we decide to scale up, we might do another one later. But my hope is to cover the costs of purchasing all organic and wildcrafted herbs for this medicine line and get us going ASAP! 
For each $30 you donate, you'll receive one of our Adaptogenic Alchemy powder blends... if you have deeper pockets and can donate more, $150 or more-- you'll get the whole set! It's like your very own home apothecary, delivered to your door! Projected retail cost: $40 each or $220 for the set.(Or go in on them with a friend! The jars are generous 10oz jars, so you can split them each in half or pick your favs)(Did I mention, one of my superpowers is making delicious medicine? These are going to be wonderful in your smoothies, on top of oatmeal or granola, baked into treats, or as luscious creamy beverages mixed into the milk or mylk of your choice).The Blends:Morning Practice (all chakras):
Milky Oats, goji berry, maca, agaricon mushroom, ashwaganda, cardamon, cinnamon, clove, pink sea salt, clear quartz essence, morning glory essence. Alchemical Detox (1&2 & Crown)
Aligns and integrates the first chakra (detoxification and rooting) with the second chakra (digestion, body intuition) for a clean sweep of all chakras / body systems. Restores and revives energy, especially after periods of intensity.
Turmeric, roasted dandelion root, roasted chicory root, maitake, ginger, cinnamon, clove, frankincense, black pepper, black sea salt, smoky quartz essence.
Luscious (2 & 4 chakras)
Rose Petals, pomegranate, maca, mucuna, shatavari, cordyceps, bee pollen, pink sea salt, moonstone essence.
Deep Vitality (3rd chakra)
Mesquite, golden berry, schisandra berry, siberian ginseng, blazei mushroom, pine pollen, pink sea salt, citrine essence, yarrow essence. Wholehearted (a heart chakra awakening)
Cacao, reishi mushroom, rose petals & hips, hawthorn berry, damiana, cinnamon, vanilla, pink sea salt, rose quartz essence, white rose essence. Beauty & Bliss (5 & 7 chakras)
Chamomile, lucuma, mucuna, ashwaganda, lion’s mane mushroom, tocotrienols, pearl, pink sea salt, california wild rose essence, mimosa essence. Witch’s Eye (2 & 6 chakras)
Cacao, chaga mushroom, roasted dandelion root, lavender, poppy seed, black sea salt, opium poppy essence, mugwort essence, hematite essence, amethyst essence. 

Other Ways You Can Help...


If donating just isn't a possibility for you right now, no worries! Perhaps, if you'd like to see this herbal medicine line get out into the world, you'd be willing to share this campaign?
Thank you thank you thank you thank you!Much love,Riyana

story:
The Lash Styler improves the effects of any mascara and gives you full control of the size and curl of lashes, either real or fake. Plus, the purposeful design of the Lash Styler means, no smeared lids.
 

 


APPLY PRESSURE AND EXTEND YOUR LASHES

 


NO SMUDGED EYE MAKEUP




APPLY MASCARA SEVERAL TIMES
AND RIGHT FROM THE EDGE FOR MORE VOLUME

 


COMB LASHES AGAINST THE LASH STYLER'S CURVE
AND GET THE PERFECT CURL

 


EASILY GET RID OF CLUMPS AND SEPARATE LASHES

 

 



 


As creatures of habit our days are defined by articles of daily use. So isn’t it worth paying attention to the tools we rely on for our daily routines?

We created the Lash Styler because better tools make our lives easier.

We obsess over quality materials and purposeful design so that you end up with something exceptionally useful.


 

Ok, at first sight it might seem expensive, but this is truly the gold standard of any Lash Styler. Made in Switzerland from high-grade stainless steel and eudermic silicone, the original Haackensack Lash Styler is dishwasher-proof and a life-long companion for the price of a single mascara. 


 

For professional make-up artists as well as any beauty perfectionist.

 


 


 

Where do we ship ?

We ship worldwide. VAT and GST are not included. Please see the perk details for the shipping costs that apply to you.

When do we start shipping ?

Pre-orders for all Haackensack Lash Stylers will be delivered in mid-June*. We will keep you updated on our progress and the expected delivery date of your order.

*Actual ship dates may vary. We will notify you of your product ship date.

Why order now ?

By backing now you'll be one of the very first owners of the Haackensack Lash Styler, plus you have exclusive access to prices only available during the Indiegogo campaign.

 



We have been working on perfecting the Lash Styler for over 3 years. What we've achieved so far is outstanding  and the result is an innovative and useful industry device. The product design is ready, testing is complete, and the agreement with manufacturers is done. Now we need funds for large scale manufacturing and to spread the word.



 


 



Guido
Guido is managing partner of Haackensack and championing Swiss precision on the project.
He is responsible for production and client relations.
 

Violetta
Violetta is a professional make-up artist and the innovative brain who came up with the idea of the Lash Styler together with her husband. She is the innovator. Violetta is also available for trainings in multiple languages.
 

Viktor
Viktor is Violetta's husband and a longtime entrepreneur who is responsible for R&D and legal aspects of the business, including patenting.
 

Corina
Corina is an experienced make-up artist and responsible for training and instructions in several languages.

 

Pirmin
Pirmin has been a long-term ally and is responsible for distribution.

story:
Chinese tea is the perfect balance of the extremely complex and the extremely simple. One can dive endlessly into the nuisances of tea making such as terroir, making style, and age of the tree. Just as a wine connoisseur thinks about the age of the grape vine, a tea connoisseur can differentiate the flavor of a hundred years old Pu-Er tree from that of a three hundred years old. The history of Chinese tea is very rich and ancient. Absolutely anyone can enjoy and benefit from drinking it. The practice of drinking tea is a time of tranquility where one can gather their thoughts and relax.

 

Hi, my name is Dylan Conroy and I founded The Sweetest Dew to spread my love for tea culture in the West.

My passion for tea started about five years ago when I started working in a tea shop in SoHo. Since then I have worked in various tea shops, sampled hundreds of varieties of teas, slowly learning and refining my palate. I find the taste of Chinese teas to be the most complex and invigorating and have focused much of my energy there. My focus on Chinese teas has allowed me to attain an insight about their various styles. This study is important to me because it allows me to understand something that is universally significant all over the world, and that is flavor. Understanding how a flavor is produce is an understanding of science and art. It is the study of scientific factors  that  went into the create of this flavor, such as terroir, and also how did the artistic way in which the tea maker manipulate these factors to produce the flavor. To further my education on tea, I will be traveling for an extended period of time in China to learn from the tea farmers and to harvest with them. When I return to the States I wish to share my knowledge and skill with others who can benefit from Chinese tea practice.

 

This Spring, I will visit the most prominent tea provinces in China. I will be traveling to famous tea terroirs in order to learn from the farmers and to buy tea directly from the source. I will travel to the three most famous tea regions: Dong Ting mountain, Feng Huang Shan, and the Wuyi. Wuyi Shan and Feng Huang Shan produce two different types of wulongs that are loved by tea drinkers all over the world. Dong Ting is home to the famous green tea Bi Luo Chun. I have been given the rare opportunity to explore the tea farm in these locations.

I will spend months in each location to fully immerse myself in the regional tea that is grown. I will be working in the tea fields alongside the farmers. I will be documenting my entire trip via video, audio, and notes so that others can experience my journey as I am living them. The funds that I raise in the Indiegogo will support my research time in China. The time I am able to spend there, the more information I am able to gather and publish on The Sweetest Dew.

 

My mission to educate people in Chinese tea has already started. Every month I hold a free public tea session in NYC where I introduce and brew tea for people to sample. I brew in the traditional Chinese style called, Gong Fu Cha—which brings out the best flavors of the leaves. Guests will enjoy the exquisite flavors of high quality tea, as well as the relaxing atmosphere of the tea parlor. With each guided session we try a variety of teas and discuss its properties and characteristics. These discussions allow people to foster a deeper understanding of flavors they might have otherwise missed. First timers will often come to me afterwards, surprised at how much they learned and enjoyed the whole experience. Not only do my sessions inspire people’s love of tea, it also brings them together. I plan on purchasing as much high-quality tea as I can from the farmers so that I can serve them in my guided teasessions. I will be hosting a session via Facebook Live so people outside of NYC can partake in my classes. The teas will also be made available for purchase online.

 

I started a blog called Thesweetestdew.com—an educational blog dedicated to providing information on Chinese tea. I regularly write articles, make videos, and interview people within the tea industry. I will use video, audio, photography, and notes to catch every detail of my experience. Knowing the history of Chinese tea is as important as understanding the flavors. For example, Bi Luo Chun is a green tea that is solely picked from the smallest and youngest buds and leaves. Comprehending the aforementioned methodology of Bi Luo Chun is incredibly helpful when attempting to determine its authenticity. There is a gap of pure information like this in the western tea world. It is important that people have the factual information about tea so they can progress on their own tea journey in the correct way.  

The deliverable of this trip will be a fully formed educational source. When I come back I will upload all the information that I have collected onto The Sweetest Dew to make it accessable for all. This will include things like personal interview with the farmers, videos showing the full tea making process and pictures comparing the different types of tea leaves and plants. A well funded trip means I can extend my travel to other tea locations and build new relationships with farmers there. These farmers I will keep in contact with through out the year so they can answer any questions you have even after my trip is over. You know all my information will be reputable because it is coming right from the source. My trip will also yield access to high quality tea. Teas from these locations are expensive, but since I do not plan on starting a business of selling tea I price these teas at the very lowest possible, just enough to break even. This will allow you the chance at high quality tea at a very low price.

I am raising $5,000, most of which will go toward travel expenses and purchasing of tea. These places are the most renowned areas in the world for tea. I am focusing solely on these locations because of the high level of craftmanship practiced by these farmers. My trip is designed toward education, and these locations are the best place to gain more in-depth knowledge. These teas will be served for free at my tea sessions or sold for a very low price, just high enough to buy more tea the following year. Even more than important than understanding tea on a factual basis, is understanding the taste. I am motivated to bring back as much high quality tea as I can and make it as accessible as possible so that people can understand what it really means to be high quality and will be able to spot a fake when they see it. 

 

Risks & Challenges

A risk whenever you are buying tea is being sold unauthentic tea. It is common that tea sellers will try to tell you the tea they are selling you is something that is it not. For example, within Feng Huang Shan the most pristine peak for growing tea is Wu Dong. Tea sellers will often try to take a tea from another location and sell it as Wu Dong, thus charging a much higher price. I am prepared to handle this issue through working with farmers that I trust, coupled with my refined palate and knowledge of Chinese teas. Some of these farmers I have known for years, and I trust they will not try to trick me. I have also spent time specifically studying the flavors of Wuyi, Feng Huang, and Dong Ting teas, and have come to understand the flavors well enough to spot a fake. I know for example, that the liquid from a Wu Dong wulong has a weight to it that other locations do not have, or sign of a high quality Wuyi is a minerality on the teeth. This knowledge will allow me to buy authentic teas for a price that is reflective of their quality.

Investments into my trip of any size are appreciated. Even if you give $10, you have given me one night of lodging, which in turn could mean one more day in the tea region. Exposure is also important. If you cannot help fund my trip, please share this video so more people see what I am trying to do and begin to understand the complexity of real tea.

In conclusion, I have been lucky enough in the past to have access to good tea and honest information. I would like others to have the same positive experience that I did. This trip is the beginning of my life goal, which is to give interested people access to the knowledge of Chinese teas. By funding this trip, you are sponsoring an educational tea movement that is both authentic and insightful.

story:
The Project & Our intention

Borgo Pantano is a medieval village that is being restored by the Bisazza family. It is a unique archaeological site on the beautiful island of Sicily. Orazio and Silvana Bisazza (Paolo’s parents) have dedicated their life for the last 20 years to restoring the land. This has been no easy job, they have sacrificed a lot, and had to overcome many obstacles along the way. So much has been done but there is so much more to do. Orazio’s mother, Maria Cannuli, lived in this village before it was abandoned completely, and entrusted the villages’ preservation to her son Orazio before she passed. Orazio has always had a strong passion and commitment to Pantano. He is a true visionary and with immense patience and perseverance continues to work towards bringing this magical place back to life.

Their united intention is to share Pantano with those who feel drawn to the place; those who yearn for some inner restoration, expression and contemplation particularly through Meditation and Yoga. A space that is both accessible and inexpensive, where groups and individuals of all ages, from all walks of life and from all lands have the opportunity to experience this unique place.

The history of Pantano

Borgo Pantano is located in the town of Rometta in the province of Messina, Sicily. It is a splendid example of rural archaeology, which rises in the Peloritani mountains about 220 meters above sea level and is spread over an area of ​​about 15 hectares. As you drive down into the village there is a clear view of the surrounding mountains as well as the ocean and Vulcano.  It has been an interesting journey of discovery for Paolo’s parents. They have researched, studied and learned many intriguing historical facts about Pantano, and yet there is still a profound mystical element to the place. The village dates back to 1200 and was most likely founded by a Jewish community that was dedicated to herbal medicine until 1500, when the inquisition in Sicily cancelled (apparently) all traces of Jewish communities. It’s highly possible that the medicinal herbs were grown for a local pharmacy. The building materials, the land, the countless wells spotted around the village all indicate a logical and sustainable irrigation system – all of which are being restored and maintained. Paolo’s parents have spent years cultivating the land, creating paths, roads, re-planting the traditional trees and plants and  preserving the traditional medicinal herbs and ancient flowers. There are groves of olive, lemon, orange, mandarin, pomegranate, almond, walnut and carob trees that bear delicious fruit throughout the year.

  At the heart of the village is the splendid Santa Maria Delle Grazie (Mother Mary) Church which dates back to the early 1400’s. It was thought to have been disguised as a Catholic church after 1500, as the architecture shows strong signs of being a Jewish Synagogue. Regardless of its precise religious origins, this spiritual hub has clearly enriched the energy of the land. There is a distinct sense of peace, silence and serenity that pervades the place and visitor’s hearts. The rare statue of the Mother Mary breastfeeding, not only represents the human and individual but also the symbolic and universal. Mother is an energy, a principle, and embodies the Universal or the Great Divine Mother as the giver of life, of wisdom, the carer, the nurturer, the intuitive and the creative fearless warrior.  

(The historical, cultural and agricultural details would fill books, this summary does not do the extent of research justice, do read more here: progettopantano.it or contact Paolo directly).

The Meditation Space: Domus Domini

In Pantano there are many houses, a few have been partially restored, but are not yet habitable. All the materials used to restore the land and the houses are sustainable and reflect the original historical structure of the place.

The building, Domus Domini was selected for its secluded location in the village and the dimensions of the building are ideal as a workshop space for holistic disciplines. Interestingly, this building was originally a convent managed by the nuns of S. Maria de Messana – so already this place has its own sacredness. This building was later abandoned and was used as part of a stable and a warehouse. The objective is to complete the restoration of this building, and to also create around it facilities for camping accommodation. This will provide the possibility for people to stay and to really connect to the land and the nature it offers, whilst enjoying diverse activities. The name Domus Domini was chosen for the building, it means The House (or dwelling place) of God!

What has been done so far on Domus Domini?

The majority of the work has been done on the building (see pictures), the original structure has been maintained and the traditional materials were used. There are three distinct chambers of the building. Two parts have mostly be completed. The third part, that was an ancient millstone, remains to be completed. Outside there are large rustic benches and wooden tables for dining, made from the typically used wood, Chestnut, a large outside BBQ cooking area and one eco-toilet. Dotted around the village there are two large pine prefabricated buildings, and seven "pagghiari" (typical local stone huts roofed with vegetable branches – which were typically used by farmers as temporary overnight shelters). 

What needs to be done?

For the building: the floor needs to be laid with handcrafted Sicilian flooring, the interiors need to be restored, the electrical system and the water system and the chestnut wooden window fixtures for the doors and windows have to be completed. A cooking space in the Domus Domini must be built and equipped. The area needs to equipped with two more ecological toilets and showers, the area for camping needs to be levelled, hydraulic arrangements and rainwater channelling completed. To provide further accommodation the arrangement of a darkening systems plus folding beds and photovoltaic kits for night lighting of the seven "pagghiari" and two prefabricated pine buildings. Purchase of outdoor night lighting system for the campsite, as well as purchase of tents and related accessories, together with yoga mats and props.

Activities/Workshops  

The intention is to provide a space for activities, seminars and trainings that offer time for solitude, introspection and reflection as well as sharing, creativity, laughter and play. The activities will be open and available to all for daytime, weekend and longer stays. Other teachers or craftsmen are welcome to organise events and trainings. There will be numerous charity and community events, many events will be on a donation basis or those on low-income can be subsidised. There will be tailored classes for children, teenagers, families, women’s and men’s groups, and those enduring and recovering from illnesses; mental, physical and spiritual (which of course are all related!).          

 Here are just a few activities which will take place:

  • Mindfulness & Meditation Courses, Silent Retreats
  • Yoga classes, Courses & Teacher Trainings
  • Music Therapy, Sound Healing, Art Therapy, Eco Therapy & Holistic Healing
  • Musical Concerts,Theatre Workshops, Shows and Story-telling
  • Traditional Cooking, Dance, Photography , Art & Craft Workshops & Classes
  • Trekking & Contemplative Walks
  • Herbal Medicine’s Workshops and Therapy
  • Women's Retreats, Men's Retreats, Children’s Classes  
  • Cultural & Historical activities connected to the identity of Pantano

Other places to visit

We would like to offer an affordable, eco-friendly and organic experience for all ages to enjoy from the local and international communities. There are also many other stunning places to visit and explore during the rest of your stay in Sicily. Pantano is a ten-minute drive from the closest beaches – Spadafora and Venetico, a twenty-minute from the beautiful town of Milazzo and its fabulous beaches which offer easy access to the Aeolian Islands. At the same distance there is Roccavaldina, with its historical churches and pharmacy-museum. Forty minutes by car there is the famous Black Madonna Sanctuary of Tindary. And one-hour to the famous town of Taormina. The closest airport to fly to is Catania which is just over an hour away by car which has bus and train links to Messina.

 Paolo & Amy Bisazza  

Amy Bisazza studied Developmental Psychology at University. She has been teaching Yoga since 2007. She trained with The Yoga Academy, as a British Wheel of Yoga accredited Hatha Yoga teacher, then studied Children’s Yoga, Pregnancy Yoga, Yin Yoga, and Yoga Nidra trainings. She completed the Gong Teacher Training, Kundalini Yoga Teacher Training, Reiki levels. She teaches at some of London’s top Yoga centres and corporately e.g. Triyoga, Evolve, The Shala, Battersea Yoga, Harley Street and privately. She is a dedicated teacher and passionate about bringing the benefits of Yoga to all ages and all abilities, especially beginners. She has witnessed in herself and others how the practice of yoga, meditation and mantra can carry us back into a state of surrender and grace. She is also a poet and musician and creates mantra meditation music with Earth Mantra (www.earthmantra.net).  

After Paolo graduated in Touristic and Environmental Economics in 2007, he felt something fundamental was missing in his life experience. From here he decided to explore the holistic arts. Synchronicity and serendipity played their roles in leading him to become a Mindfulness Meditation teacher and mentor, Reiki Master and Shamanic practitioner. After going through cancer, he was told he might not be able to have children (Leonardo has clearly ruled that out!). This experience shaped him immeasurably as a therapist and a mentor and has helped many others navigate through the same journey. He is passionate about sharing the practical skills and the profound benefits of experiencing true awareness. His many years of practices and explorations have revealed to him that everything is pointing to the same truth: to rediscover our true identity - this is what we are here for! Paolo continues to teach internationally.  

   

Funds will be used for:

€16,000  The final restructuring of the Domus Domini building of about 45 square meters, which includes, restoration of the handcrafted Sicilian flooring, interior’s renovation, upgrade of the electrical and water system (in particular the internal tank of the ancient millstone), construction of wooden doors and window frames in chestnut tree wood.

€4000   Purchase solar showers and an additional ecological toilet with sewage disposal system plus purchase and installation of a kitchen for Domus Domini.  

€3000   Arrangement of darkening systems plus folding beds and photovoltaic kits for night lighting of the seven "pagghiari" and the two prefabricated pine buildings

€2500   Arrangement of the external area for the realization of a big camp: vast weeding work, interventions of arrangement in ground level for implanting camping tents, hydraulic arrangements and rainwater channeling.

€2500  Purchase of 10 four-man tents, 40 sleeping bags and various camping accessories plus yoga mats, meditation cushions, blocks and blankets. 

€800   Purchase, preparation and wiring of outdoor night lighting system of the camp with low energy consumption LED lights

Total = €28,800      (£25,400)

Thank you & beyond!

Everyone who visits Pantano comments on its immense potential, and every year the area is improved and restored a little more. Ultimately we want the houses to be restored so that we can offer hospitality all year round, and so the village can be revived again. This is an ongoing project. Any excess money we raise through this campaign will be used to purchase more solar panels so that the whole village can eventually run off solar power! Then we will work on completing one of the houses. There is one house in the main village that is ready to be converted into a complete hostel, kitchen and living area, and a traditional wood oven ready to be recovered.

This project is open to the local community as well as the international community, and we already have groups and individuals that we plan to collaborate with. If anyone wants to offer workshops and trainings get in touch. Also we appreciate your feedback, comments and ideas! We greatly appreciate your time in reading our proposal, and are TRULY grateful beyond what words can say for any contribution big or small. We invite you to share this story with friends, colleagues and family members, in fact anyone that maybe interested!

You are welcome to come and see this beautiful hidden gem in Sicily for yourselves!  

With our deepest Love & Gratitude,
story_txt:
The Project & Our intentionBorgo Pantano is a medieval village that is being restored by the Bisazza family. It is a unique archaeological site on the beautiful island of Sicily. Orazio and Silvana Bisazza (Paolo’s parents) have dedicated their life for the last 20 years to restoring the land. This has been no easy job, they have sacrificed a lot, and had to overcome many obstacles along the way. So much has been done but there is so much more to do. Orazio’s mother, Maria Cannuli, lived in this village before it was abandoned completely, and entrusted the villages’ preservation to her son Orazio before she passed. Orazio has always had a strong passion and commitment to Pantano. He is a true visionary and with immense patience and perseverance continues to work towards bringing this magical place back to life.Their united intention is to share Pantano with those who feel drawn to the place; those who yearn for some inner restoration, expression and contemplation particularly through Meditation and Yoga. A space that is both accessible and inexpensive, where groups and individuals of all ages, from all walks of life and from all lands have the opportunity to experience this unique place.The history of PantanoBorgo Pantano is located in the town of Rometta in the province of Messina, Sicily. It is a splendid example of rural archaeology, which rises in the Peloritani mountains about 220 meters above sea level and is spread over an area of ​​about 15 hectares. As you drive down into the village there is a clear view of the surrounding mountains as well as the ocean and Vulcano.  It has been an interesting journey of discovery for Paolo’s parents. They have researched, studied and learned many intriguing historical facts about Pantano, and yet there is still a profound mystical element to the place. The village dates back to 1200 and was most likely founded by a Jewish community that was dedicated to herbal medicine until 1500, when the inquisition in Sicily cancelled (apparently) all traces of Jewish communities. It’s highly possible that the medicinal herbs were grown for a local pharmacy. The building materials, the land, the countless wells spotted around the village all indicate a logical and sustainable irrigation system – all of which are being restored and maintained. Paolo’s parents have spent years cultivating the land, creating paths, roads, re-planting the traditional trees and plants and  preserving the traditional medicinal herbs and ancient flowers. There are groves of olive, lemon, orange, mandarin, pomegranate, almond, walnut and carob trees that bear delicious fruit throughout the year.  At the heart of the village is the splendid Santa Maria Delle Grazie (Mother Mary) Church which dates back to the early 1400’s. It was thought to have been disguised as a Catholic church after 1500, as the architecture shows strong signs of being a Jewish Synagogue. Regardless of its precise religious origins, this spiritual hub has clearly enriched the energy of the land. There is a distinct sense of peace, silence and serenity that pervades the place and visitor’s hearts. The rare statue of the Mother Mary breastfeeding, not only represents the human and individual but also the symbolic and universal. Mother is an energy, a principle, and embodies the Universal or the Great Divine Mother as the giver of life, of wisdom, the carer, the nurturer, the intuitive and the creative fearless warrior.  (The historical, cultural and agricultural details would fill books, this summary does not do the extent of research justice, do read more here: progettopantano.it or contact Paolo directly).The Meditation Space: Domus DominiIn Pantano there are many houses, a few have been partially restored, but are not yet habitable. All the materials used to restore the land and the houses are sustainable and reflect the original historical structure of the place.The building, Domus Domini was selected for its secluded location in the village and the dimensions of the building are ideal as a workshop space for holistic disciplines. Interestingly, this building was originally a convent managed by the nuns of S. Maria de Messana – so already this place has its own sacredness. This building was later abandoned and was used as part of a stable and a warehouse. The objective is to complete the restoration of this building, and to also create around it facilities for camping accommodation. This will provide the possibility for people to stay and to really connect to the land and the nature it offers, whilst enjoying diverse activities. The name Domus Domini was chosen for the building, it means The House (or dwelling place) of God!What has been done so far on Domus Domini?The majority of the work has been done on the building (see pictures), the original structure has been maintained and the traditional materials were used. There are three distinct chambers of the building. Two parts have mostly be completed. The third part, that was an ancient millstone, remains to be completed. Outside there are large rustic benches and wooden tables for dining, made from the typically used wood, Chestnut, a large outside BBQ cooking area and one eco-toilet. Dotted around the village there are two large pine prefabricated buildings, and seven "pagghiari" (typical local stone huts roofed with vegetable branches – which were typically used by farmers as temporary overnight shelters). What needs to be done?For the building: the floor needs to be laid with handcrafted Sicilian flooring, the interiors need to be restored, the electrical system and the water system and the chestnut wooden window fixtures for the doors and windows have to be completed. A cooking space in the Domus Domini must be built and equipped. The area needs to equipped with two more ecological toilets and showers, the area for camping needs to be levelled, hydraulic arrangements and rainwater channelling completed. To provide further accommodation the arrangement of a darkening systems plus folding beds and photovoltaic kits for night lighting of the seven "pagghiari" and two prefabricated pine buildings. Purchase of outdoor night lighting system for the campsite, as well as purchase of tents and related accessories, together with yoga mats and props.Activities/Workshops  The intention is to provide a space for activities, seminars and trainings that offer time for solitude, introspection and reflection as well as sharing, creativity, laughter and play. The activities will be open and available to all for daytime, weekend and longer stays. Other teachers or craftsmen are welcome to organise events and trainings. There will be numerous charity and community events, many events will be on a donation basis or those on low-income can be subsidised. There will be tailored classes for children, teenagers, families, women’s and men’s groups, and those enduring and recovering from illnesses; mental, physical and spiritual (which of course are all related!).             Here are just a few activities which will take place:
Mindfulness & Meditation Courses, Silent Retreats
Yoga classes, Courses & Teacher Trainings
Music Therapy, Sound Healing, Art Therapy, Eco Therapy & Holistic Healing
Musical Concerts,Theatre Workshops, Shows and Story-telling
Traditional Cooking, Dance, Photography , Art & Craft Workshops & Classes
Trekking & Contemplative Walks
Herbal Medicine’s Workshops and Therapy
Women's Retreats, Men's Retreats, Children’s Classes  
Cultural & Historical activities connected to the identity of Pantano
Other places to visitWe would like to offer an affordable, eco-friendly and organic experience for all ages to enjoy from the local and international communities. There are also many other stunning places to visit and explore during the rest of your stay in Sicily. Pantano is a ten-minute drive from the closest beaches – Spadafora and Venetico, a twenty-minute from the beautiful town of Milazzo and its fabulous beaches which offer easy access to the Aeolian Islands. At the same distance there is Roccavaldina, with its historical churches and pharmacy-museum. Forty minutes by car there is the famous Black Madonna Sanctuary of Tindary. And one-hour to the famous town of Taormina. The closest airport to fly to is Catania which is just over an hour away by car which has bus and train links to Messina. Paolo & Amy Bisazza   Amy Bisazza studied Developmental Psychology at University. She has been teaching Yoga since 2007. She teaches at some of London’s top Yoga centres and corporately e.g. Triyoga, Evolve, The Shala, Battersea Yoga, Harley Street and privately. She is a dedicated teacher and passionate about bringing the benefits of Yoga to all ages and all abilities, especially beginners. She has witnessed in herself and others how the practice of yoga, meditation and mantra can carry us back into a state of surrender and grace. She is also a poet and musician and creates mantra meditation music with Earth Mantra (www.earthmantra.net).   After Paolo graduated in Touristic and Environmental Economics in 2007, he felt something fundamental was missing in his life experience. From here he decided to explore the holistic arts. Synchronicity and serendipity played their roles in leading him to become a Mindfulness Meditation teacher and mentor, Reiki Master and Shamanic practitioner. After going through cancer, he was told he might not be able to have children (Leonardo has clearly ruled that out!). This experience shaped him immeasurably as a therapist and a mentor and has helped many others navigate through the same journey. He is passionate about sharing the practical skills and the profound benefits of experiencing true awareness. His many years of practices and explorations have revealed to him that everything is pointing to the same truth: to rediscover our true identity - this is what we are here for!
