story:
Our Vision

Expand female start line numbers and keep Alberta women racing: By creating a group specifically for women committed to racing at an elite level, we are able to encourage further registration and expand the field of women racing. Our vision is to drive provincial Road Race start line numbers up enough that women gain their own race category for 1/2/3. More women on the start line means more opportunities for Alberta women to gain the experiences required to keep racing fun, competitive, and lifelong.

Check out our recent blog post for a look at what road cycling currently like for women racing in Alberta.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funds will help the team pay for:

  • Race licenses.
  • Insurance for our riders to keep them safe when they travel out of province.
  • Event permits, so we can legally hold events just for women.
  • Team kit, jerseys are pretty pricy things.
  • Race entry fees

What you get:

  • Family FUNdraiser - Daytime February 20, 2017
    • Full Ride Package Includes:  
      • A limited addition Watt Riot supporter t-shirt
      • 8:45 start: Spin class for you and bike safety course for your kids, hosted by Peloton Cycling Studio and Campione -1010  10 Street SW, Calgary
      • 10:30 start:  Family Run and a talk on women in sport, hosted by Tri It -1703  10 Ave SW
      • Noon start: Yoga and some sweet music, great coffee (pay what you can courtesy of Rosso Coffee Roasters), and some tasty snacks. Hosted at the Sunalta Community Association  -1627 10 Ave SW.

 

  • Ticket options for single events
    • 9:30 start: Spin class for you and bike safety course for your kids, hosted by Peloton Cycling Studio and Campione -1010  10 Street SW, Calgary
    • 10:30 start:  Family Run and a talk on women in sport, hosted by Tri It -1703  10 Ave SW
    • Noon start: Yoga and some sweet music, great coffee (pay what you can curtesy of Rosso Coffee Roasters), and some fantastic local food. Hosted at the Sunalta Community Association  -1627 10 Ave SW.
  • Family FUNdraiser is free for kids under 12

 

  • Non-event items include:
    • High fives
    • Thank yous
    • Supporter Jersey
    • Cycling cap

The Impact

Watt Riot Cycling is the only exclusively women's road racing team in Alberta. We are also a Trade Team, which means when we race out of the province, we will be lining up with women who make a living riding their bikes. We think that's pretty cool, here are some things you may also find cool: 

  • We are encouraging strong women in Alberta to race at a higher level
  • We are making cycling more accessible to new female riders
  • We are creating a sense of belonging for females riding in Alberta
  • We are empowering women to be part of a change to a male dominated sport

Risks & Challenges

Other all female teams who have come before us and have not lasted more than a few years. Typically, this has been because sponsors had different views on the direction the team should go (ie not all female). Here's why we don't feel that will happen:

  • We are not branding to a sponsor, we have created our own brand.
  • We will be doing events with women outside of our own team, the bigger the impact, the better the reason to support what we are doing.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that times are tight. We know that people also plan things well in advance. If you can't make it to our Family FUNdraiser on February 20, 2017, here are a few other things you can do to help us out:

  • Tell your friends, your neighbor, that person who sits in the cubical next to you at work, or that person you see commuting by bike in all weather.
  • Buy a cap, or a support jersey, and rock it like you are part of the team, because you are, and we love you.
  • Come on a group ride with us! We love meeting new people, if we don't know you, we would sure like to. Group rides will be posted on our website once the weather gets a bit nicer.

 

Current Sponsors

story:
PrettySick Supply: Our Introduction

PrettySick Supply: Project Outreach

We're 2 people who also have chronic conditions and disabilities.  SarahCate is a type 2 diabetic with anxiety, and a cancer survivor with chronic pain from treatment.  Kris has a compressed disc, hypertension, depression, and anxiety.  We both know the challenges of finding functional medical and mobility gear that reflects our unique personalities and styles.

The problem isn't the lack personalized equipment-- it's that much of it is modified or created by people who also have chronic conditions or disabilities.  Many of us can't afford to advertise our shops or products and must rely on word of mouth and... well... luck to be discovered by customers.  

As both consumers and creators we realized that more is needed to bridge that gap and make finding products and producers easier for our entire community. So in July of 2017, we created PrettySickSupply.com and became a hub for our community to search, find, and discover creators and shops offering all manner of items invaluable to the chronic illness/disability community.

Between advertising and aggressive sharing, we've managed to get the word out online- when you need new gear and you want it to reflect who you are- PrettySickSupply is the place to go.  But we want to do more than that- we want to connect creators with an even larger audience.  Our goal with this campaign is to take our hub and expand its reach offline as well.

What We Need

  • We're looking to raise $6000 in funding, and that money will be used to pay existing advertising fees ($1500), create a future advertising budget ($1500), And most of the rest will be used for printing, mailing supplies and shipping of the finished rack cards, with a small portion being used to produce the rewards for backers.
  • Speaking of rewards- We have a great batch of rewards for generous backers.  Starting at only $1, you'll get shout outs, link-outs to the site/charity of your choice, great posters, jewelry, magnets and more!
  • If we don't meet the entire goal, we'll use what we do get to pay existing advertising fees, and do a smaller run of printing and mailing for the rack cards from home as opposed to having them run professionally.
  • All of this will allow us to reach directly out to a wider customer base than we can reach simply with Facebook advertising.

The Impact

With so many people of all ages living with chronic illnesses, pain and disabilities, PrettySick Supply is a critical connection in our larger community.  Living with chronic conditions can be dehumanizing in so many ways- and one way to combat those feeling of depersonalization and sameness is to have accessories and equipment that reflect a person's personal style.  

In just 6 months since launching the site, it has received consistent hits in every product category.  We've seen over 15,000 hits since July of 2017- mostly from word of mouth and Facebook advertising.  Imagine the exposure we could give creators with a print campaign as well- in medical offices all over the US.

We've seen more than 4,000 unique visitors from 55 different countries, and while a lot of our resources are US based, we've found shops and creators shipping from and to locations all over the world!  These funds are critical to help us share our site and our mission with even more of our community.

Risks & Challenges

Here's the truth: we've never done fundraising like this before.  But to be fair- we've never launched a major website before, or managed social media accounts for a business.  So far- we're not doing too badly- and a lot of what's stopping us is a lack of financial resources.  

With financing sorted out, our biggest challenge will be gathering the resources and addresses to SEND out all of our mailings.  But if there's one thing we do particularly well, it's research!  95% of the shops and resources we've listed on PrettySick Supply so far were found by one of our creators. 

We'll be asking for input from our chronic illness/disability community for clinics and doctors who would be open to sharing our literature with their patients, and go from there.  And we're confident that once we've introduced ourselves- GPs and Specialists will be thrilled to share with their patients- after all, our own Doctors already are!

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that our target community is not a rich one, and a lot of folks viewing this fundraiser will really want to help- but won't be able to financially.  Believe us, we'd rather not ask for money, but we can't take these next steps without it!  

  • Can't contribute financially?  Share this page; show your friends and family.  Our rewards make GREAT gifts!  Ask your friends or family to donate and tell them the rewards are on your Christmas or Birthday list... it's a great way to get cool stuff and support a great cause.

  • Even with finances, we're still going to need a lot of help from word of mouth and community involvement.  Talk to your Doctor or Specialist about what we're doing- see if they'd be willing to share PSS as a resource for their patients!  If you know about a clinic, hospital, or other medical office that would be willing to add us to their literature rack- let us know!  We'll start compiling a list so that when fundraising is complete- we can get printing and mailing right away!

What You Get

Our rewards span a range from a named thank you on our website, to a package including posters, magnets, link-outs, jewelry and more.

-For rewards levels including a choice of poster- see your options below.  There are 3 types of posters to choose from, with options in each from which you can choose!

  • Spoonies Unite!: A call to action (or lack thereof) for the chronically ill, pained and disabled everywhere.  This tongue in cheek poster is available in 10 color options, select the option that includes your preference, and we'll contact you at dispersal time to verify which color you want shipped.

 

  • Nevertheless: a poster series celebrating the persistence and perseverance of women all over the world. Choose from the horizontal group poster featuring 12 inspiring women from various professions, passions, and walks of life.  Or from one of 4 women featured in this series: Olympic Gold Medal Gymnast Simone Biles, Senator Elizabeth Warren, Astronaut Mae Jemison, or Education activist Malala Yusuf.

 

  • Assorted: 5 Posters featuring different subjects and sentiments.  Choose from:
    -"Live" featuring a willow tree and text from an Andrea Gibson poem, "On my most broken days, when my faith is a willow and the pain has nothing but an ax to give, The only thing I want more than to die, is to LIVE."
    -"Wings" which features earthy tones and the final word spelled out in a red and black butterfly's wings.  The text reads, "When she transformed into a butterfly, the caterpillars spoke not of her beauty, but her weirdness.  They wanted her to change back into what she had always been, But she had WINGS."
    -"Body Revolution", featuring a faceless body on a background of hurtful words used to describe bodies that don't fit the norm.  Inside the form is a litany of positive thoughts and resolutions fighting against the stigma behind it.  The banner reads, "Start a Revolution, Stop Hating Your Body."
    -"Shattered into Dust" which features text from the same Andrea Gibson Poem on a galaxy background.  The text reads, "Remember, the Universe only became the Universe when it shattered into dust.  And that shattering is the only thing you can always trust to tell you the truth."
    -"Milky Way" featuring an illustration of model Winnie Harlow on a galaxy background.  The text reads, "You keep worrying you're taking up too much space.  I wish you'd let yourself be the Milky Way. - Andrea Gibson"

 

-If poster's aren't your thing, we're offering a magnet package featuring one of our poster designs and a bonus chronic pain design too!  Choosing the magnetic reward level you'll receive all the previous thank-yous but instead of a poster, you'll get these 2 fantastic magnets to display or gift:

 

-In addition, there's a reward level that includes a hand-made spoon pendant: bent, adorned and sealed by our very own SarahCate!  Designs vary, and pendants will be sent out on a first come first serve basis!  When fundraising is complete, backers who selected the spoon package will receive an email with images to allow them to choose which pendant they'd prefer.  Those who back at this level first will have first choice, second backer will have second choice and so on.  There are 31 designs to choose from in all!  

On top of that: We'll be designing a special thank you card for packages with shipped rewards, and our 3 highest backers will receive an additional "mystery gift."

 

With your help, we can expand our reach and help so many more patients and creators.  We look forward to being a familiar sight in your clinic or doctor's office sometime next year.  And in the meantime, to our community- we hope you'll keep putting the Pretty in "Pretty Sick."
story_txt:
PrettySick Supply: Our Introduction

PrettySick Supply: Project Outreach
We're 2 people who also have chronic conditions and disabilities.  SarahCate is a type 2 diabetic with anxiety, and a cancer survivor with chronic pain from treatment.  Kris has a compressed disc, hypertension, depression, and anxiety.  We both know the challenges of finding functional medical and mobility gear that reflects our unique personalities and styles.
The problem isn't the lack personalized equipment-- it's that much of it is modified or created by people who also have chronic conditions or disabilities.  Many of us can't afford to advertise our shops or products and must rely on word of mouth and... well... luck to be discovered by customers.  
As both consumers and creators we realized that more is needed to bridge that gap and make finding products and producers easier for our entire community. So in July of 2017, we created PrettySickSupply.com and became a hub for our community to search, find, and discover creators and shops offering all manner of items invaluable to the chronic illness/disability community.
Between advertising and aggressive sharing, we've managed to get the word out online- when you need new gear and you want it to reflect who you are- PrettySickSupply is the place to go.  But we want to do more than that- we want to connect creators with an even larger audience.  Our goal with this campaign is to take our hub and expand its reach offline as well.

What We Need

We're looking to raise $6000 in funding, and that money will be used to pay existing advertising fees ($1500), create a future advertising budget ($1500), And most of the rest will be used for printing, mailing supplies and shipping of the finished rack cards, with a small portion being used to produce the rewards for backers.
Speaking of rewards- We have a great batch of rewards for generous backers.  Starting at only $1, you'll get shout outs, link-outs to the site/charity of your choice, great posters, jewelry, magnets and more!
If we don't meet the entire goal, we'll use what we do get to pay existing advertising fees, and do a smaller run of printing and mailing for the rack cards from home as opposed to having them run professionally.
All of this will allow us to reach directly out to a wider customer base than we can reach simply with Facebook advertising.


The Impact
With so many people of all ages living with chronic illnesses, pain and disabilities, PrettySick Supply is a critical connection in our larger community.  Living with chronic conditions can be dehumanizing in so many ways- and one way to combat those feeling of depersonalization and sameness is to have accessories and equipment that reflect a person's personal style.  
In just 6 months since launching the site, it has received consistent hits in every product category.  We've seen over 15,000 hits since July of 2017- mostly from word of mouth and Facebook advertising.  Imagine the exposure we could give creators with a print campaign as well- in medical offices all over the US.
We've seen more than 4,000 unique visitors from 55 different countries, and while a lot of our resources are US based, we've found shops and creators shipping from and to locations all over the world!  These funds are critical to help us share our site and our mission with even more of our community.

Risks & Challenges
Here's the truth: we've never done fundraising like this before.  But to be fair- we've never launched a major website before, or managed social media accounts for a business.  So far- we're not doing too badly- and a lot of what's stopping us is a lack of financial resources.  
With financing sorted out, our biggest challenge will be gathering the resources and addresses to SEND out all of our mailings.  But if there's one thing we do particularly well, it's research!  95% of the shops and resources we've listed on PrettySick Supply so far were found by one of our creators. 
We'll be asking for input from our chronic illness/disability community for clinics and doctors who would be open to sharing our literature with their patients, and go from there.  And we're confident that once we've introduced ourselves- GPs and Specialists will be thrilled to share with their patients- after all, our own Doctors already are!

Other Ways You Can Help
We know that our target community is not a rich one, and a lot of folks viewing this fundraiser will really want to help- but won't be able to financially.  Believe us, we'd rather not ask for money, but we can't take these next steps without it!  

Can't contribute financially?  Share this page; show your friends and family.  Our rewards make GREAT gifts!  Ask your friends or family to donate and tell them the rewards are on your Christmas or Birthday list... it's a great way to get cool stuff and support a great cause.
Even with finances, we're still going to need a lot of help from word of mouth and community involvement.  Talk to your Doctor or Specialist about what we're doing- see if they'd be willing to share PSS as a resource for their patients!  If you know about a clinic, hospital, or other medical office that would be willing to add us to their literature rack- let us know!  We'll start compiling a list so that when fundraising is complete- we can get printing and mailing right away!

What You Get
Our rewards span a range from a named thank you on our website, to a package including posters, magnets, link-outs, jewelry and more.
-For rewards levels including a choice of poster- see your options below.  There are 3 types of posters to choose from, with options in each from which you can choose!
Spoonies Unite!: A call to action (or lack thereof) for the chronically ill, pained and disabled everywhere.  This tongue in cheek poster is available in 10 color options, select the option that includes your preference, and we'll contact you at dispersal time to verify which color you want shipped.

 
Nevertheless: a poster series celebrating the persistence and perseverance of women all over the world. Choose from the horizontal group poster featuring 12 inspiring women from various professions, passions, and walks of life.  Or from one of 4 women featured in this series: Olympic Gold Medal Gymnast Simone Biles, Senator Elizabeth Warren, Astronaut Mae Jemison, or Education activist Malala Yusuf.

 
Assorted: 5 Posters featuring different subjects and sentiments.  Choose from:-"Live" featuring a willow tree and text from an Andrea Gibson poem, "On my most broken days, when my faith is a willow and the pain has nothing but an ax to give, The only thing I want more than to die, is to LIVE."-"Wings" which features earthy tones and the final word spelled out in a red and black butterfly's wings.  The text reads, "When she transformed into a butterfly, the caterpillars spoke not of her beauty, but her weirdness.  They wanted her to change back into what she had always been, But she had WINGS."-"Body Revolution", featuring a faceless body on a background of hurtful words used to describe bodies that don't fit the norm.  Inside the form is a litany of positive thoughts and resolutions fighting against the stigma behind it.  The banner reads, "Start a Revolution, Stop Hating Your Body."-"Shattered into Dust" which features text from the same Andrea Gibson Poem on a galaxy background.  The text reads, "Remember, the Universe only became the Universe when it shattered into dust.  And that shattering is the only thing you can always trust to tell you the truth."-"Milky Way" featuring an illustration of model Winnie Harlow on a galaxy background.  The text reads, "You keep worrying you're taking up too much space.  I wish you'd let yourself be the Milky Way. - Andrea Gibson"

 
-If poster's aren't your thing, we're offering a magnet package featuring one of our poster designs and a bonus chronic pain design too!  Choosing the magnetic reward level you'll receive all the previous thank-yous but instead of a poster, you'll get these 2 fantastic magnets to display or gift:

 
-In addition, there's a reward level that includes a hand-made spoon pendant: bent, adorned and sealed by our very own SarahCate!  Designs vary, and pendants will be sent out on a first come first serve basis!  When fundraising is complete, backers who selected the spoon package will receive an email with images to allow them to choose which pendant they'd prefer.  Those who back at this level first will have first choice, second backer will have second choice and so on.  There are 31 designs to choose from in all!  

On top of that: We'll be designing a special thank you card for packages with shipped rewards, and our 3 highest backers will receive an additional "mystery gift."
 
With your help, we can expand our reach and help so many more patients and creators.  We look forward to being a familiar sight in your clinic or doctor's office sometime next year.  And in the meantime, to our community- we hope you'll keep putting the Pretty in "Pretty Sick."

story:
Athletes for CARE 

Athletes for CARE (A4C) is a not-for-profit organization dedicated to creating a community where athletes can find support, opportunity and purpose in life after a career in sports.  A4C was founded by a group of professional athletes who are united as one voice to advocate for research, education, and compassion when addressing important health issues facing athletes and the public at large. 

A4C Cannabis Research Goals

Team A4C is committed to expanding research efforts that have a direct impact on the quality of life for athletes, before, during and after competing in sports. One such area includes studying Cannabis As a Treatment Option. 

There are a number of research institutes exploring how cannabinoids in the cannabis plant can treat a variety of neurodegenerative diseases, such as chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) and traumatic brain injury (TBI). Athletes For Care seeks out opportunities for its members to participate in these historic studies to help research institutes collect data that would inform policy consistent with the organization’s objectives.

Athletes For Care has partnered with The Lambert Center for the Study of Medicinal Cannabis and Hemp at Thomas Jefferson University, the nation’s only comprehensive academic resource for medicinal cannabis education, research, and business practice.  The Lambert Center is investigating the potential use of cannabinoid therapy in areas such as concussions, chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), and chronic pain. 

 

May 8, 2017 A4C Partnership with the Lambert Center Announced

 

About this Campaign

April 30 - May 2, 2018 - Pennsylvania Convention Center 

 

Through this campaign, Athletes for CARE has partnered with the Cannabis Learn Conference and Expo to raise awareness and provide funding for cannabis research studies. ​Support this campaign and save $200-$400 off the standard 3-day or 2-day Cannabis Learn Conference Passes, and 50% of your purchase will be generously DONATED to Athletes for CARE by conference hosts, Greenhouse Ventures! 

"I think marijuana and the extreme athlete have had a long passionate love affair now for underlying scientific reasons ... I’ll never stop looking for virgin powder and an exposed and potentially dangerous line on my snowboard and I’ll never stop using cannabis".

- Greta Gaines (A4C Ambassador)

 

Can't Physically Join us in Philly? Still want to Support A4C? 

 Fund Cannabis Research by purchasing a Virtual Pass ($25, $99, or $499) and you can enjoy expert cannabis content (edited) after the conference from the comfort of your own home!

 Athletes for CARE members will be speaking and moderating on multiple different panel discussions throughout the conference on topics such as:

  • The Opioid Epidemic and Cannabis as an Exit Drug
  • Cannabis Use in Professional Sports Leagues 
  • Athletes as Cannabis Influencers in Policy, Media, and Business
  • Marvin Washington on Suing Jeff Sessions and the DEA
  • CBD Policies and the World Anti Doping Agency (WADA)
  • Career Opportunities in the Cannabis and Hemp Industry
  • Investing into and Advising Cannabis and Hemp Companies 

35+ Panel and Keynote Discussions - 75+ Expert Speakers

The Cannabis Learn Conference and Expo - taking place in Philadelphia, PA, is set to be the largest gathering of cannabis researchers, investors, universities, operators, and ancillary business professionals on the east coast.

"I am particularly interested in assisting female leaders further develop in the cannabis industry, increasing diversity throughout organizations, and advancing social impact initiatives."

- Tahira Rehmatullah 

 

Schedule April 30 - May 2 (see full schedule here)

 

    "Industry professionals have been operating in 'information silos' for far too long. The Cannabis Learn Conference & Expo is an opportunity to unite these silos by bringing together key stakeholders to share important and relevant information."

    - Matt Nordgren 

     

    "Veterans and a lot of patients across the country are finding, especially as it relates to chronic pain, that CBD-based products are working very effectively."

    - Nick Etten

     

    "It is important to provide opportunities, platforms and give space and allow those communities that have been most affected by the prohibition to become a part of this new industry. "

    - Nelson Guerrero 

     

    "The quality of life for my autistic son and for our whole family has dramatically changed since we started administering medical cannabis.”

    - Erica Daniels

     

    “I think it is appropriate to regulate and tax marijuana in Pennsylvania because if we do this right we can actually reduce teen access, grow our economy, reduce opioid addiction and bring in critical revenue so that we don’t have to raise taxes,”

    -PA Auditor General Eugene DePasquale 


    CAMPAIGN FUNDING GOAL

    The campaign funding goal is only $50,000, but A4C can potentially earn $100,000+ in donations ($200,000 total funding needed) with your help! Upon surpassing our funding goal, the Athletes for CARE Scientific Advisory Board, chaired by Dr. Sue Sisley, will be primarily responsible for determining which research studies A4C should pursue with the funding. 

    A4C athletes will also sign a team photo for all campaign supporters (digital download) WHEN we break $200,000 on this campaign!  Buy a Conference Pass Perk Today!

     

    HELP US HIT OUR CAMPAIGN STRETCH GOAL of $200,000 & A4C will get a matching $50,000 private donation!

    We have a MATCHING DONATION PROMISE of $50,000 from a PRIVATE DONOR if this campaign surpasses $200,000 in total funding (that would result in $100,000 donated from Greenhouse Ventures plus a separate $50,000 matching donation)!  Help us create a REAL IMPACT by purchasing your pass to the CannabisLearn Conference and Expo TODAY!

    How Else You Can Help (Besides Buying a Conference Pass and Joining us in Philadelphia) 

    • BUY A VIRTUAL PASS! Or buy a physical pass and tell us to "DONATE IT" to someone in need!
    • Share this campaign page on your social media accounts
    • Send this campaign link via text message 
    • Share this campaign page in an email to your friends and family 
    • Send this campaign page to your local newspaper or media contacts 
    • Share this campaign page with health care professionals, cannabis advocates, investors, philanthropists, athletes, coaches, patients, and anyone who supports cannabis research!

story:
According to the American Academy of Pediatrics, as many as 75% of children experience fear and anxiety before surgery, which can affect their surgical outcomes and emotional health. Support resources like the video we are creating are very common throughout the U.S. and Europe, but they are insufficient in Chile. Our children need and deserve the same support.

 

 

What is KoKoi?

 

KoKoi is a 3-year-old non-profit organization located in Chile. Our executive director is Paula Escobar, B.S. degree in Psychology at Florida State University and a M.A. at Drexel University. After being educated in the U.S., She returned to Chile, where she revalidated her degree of Psychology at Universidad de Chile. Then she started helping children in her country who suffer from chronic diseases and must undergo invasive medical procedures.

 

We are passionate professionals and volunteers who believe in using art, play and science as therapeutic tools to empower children and help them build resilience. Today KoKoi is using technology to reach as many children as possible.

 

Campaign

 

Our initial goal is $3,000 USD. That will cover:

  1. Design of characters and scenarios
  2. Creation of the storyboard
  3. Recording of dialogues and sound 
  4. Creation of the animatic (sequence of images and sounds to help us plan the animation)
  5. Making children's health protocols
  6. Translation of protocols from English to Spanish, and environmental and cultural adaptation
  7. Detailed monitoring of surgical child processes
  8. Consultations to nurses in the different hospital settings
  9. Meetings with medical team
  10. Consulting Psychology and Child Life Specialists

 

If we surpass our $3,000 goal, we can do even more:

 

  • If we reach $4,000, we can add 2 minutes to the original video.

 

  • If we reach $5,000, we can start our next project, a video for caretakers to reduce children’s health risks before and after surgery.

 

What you Get

 

We’ve created a series of amazing perks for you:

 

  • $10-$59: Personalized e-card
  • $60-$199: Honor diploma posted on the KoKoi Facebook page
  • $200-$499: Video credits for the first ten donors in this range. You will show up as a partner on the project.
  • $500-$1499: Especial thanks on video credits.
  • $1,500+: Sponsor video credit with custom illustration.

For more information, visit us at https://www.kokoi.cl/

story:
Our Story:

Just a few short months ago, Founder, Giovanni Doemeny overcame testicular cancer. As a celebration of their recent health success, and to raise funding and awareness for testicular cancer and holistic wellness, Giovanni and Melanie decided to bike 636 miles from San Francisco to the Border of Mexico!

Our Mission:

Our mission is to educate, inspire, and empower our community to live our most fulfilling lives, and to challenge conventional perceptions of success.

Our vision is that one day we will be a global leader in holistic wellness, and open wellness centers all over the globe!

Our Goal:

Our goal for the B2B Initiative is to raise $10,000 in funding and to raise awareness for testicular cancer.

  • 10% of funds raised will be donated to testicular cancer awareness non-profits such as the Movember Foundation.
  • The rest will go towards hiring experts to help build our holistic wellness educational curriculum and online courses for Ikigai Global Wellness, LLC.
    • (***Please note: Ikigai Global Wellness, LLC is NOT a 501c3 Tax Deductible Non-Profit Organization***)
  • We hope for a successful first initiative so that we can spearhead many more philanthropic initiatives in the future!
  • By backing us, you will be joining an intimate community of like-minded people dedicated to improving the health and happiness of ourselves and others. Plus we're offering some sweet rewards including stickers, swag, nutritional guides, nutritional consultations, and more!
  • Up until this point, our startup has been 100% self-funded. We are now reaching out to our community to ask for your support in helping build our dream organization!

Your Impact:

We believe that everybody is capable of taking control of their own health and success journey. Our organization will empower you to be the best version of yourself.

All funds (besides the 10% donated to non-profits) will go directly into growing our holistic wellness website. Your contribution will help us develop more robust and comprehensive content. We want to hire the most knowledgeable authorities in holistic wellness in order to develop a powerful community of lifestyle experts, and we want you to be a part of it.

We Need Your Support!

We are excited, and a little nervous to embark on this journey, but we feel an overwhelming sense of support. Our community is currently small, but very strong!

We would be immensely grateful for any funding you can provide, and you can rest assured it will be put to good use for this noble cause.

Please also help us get the word out by sharing with friends and family, and on social media.

You can also join our community by signing up for our email newsletter (on our website), and following us on Facebook and Instagram (@ikigaiglobalwellness).

Together, we can elevate global wellness!

story:
People's Power House

Self-Defense is for everyone!

TL:DR Origin Story

Hey! Thanks for checking out our fundraiser page. A little about us:

  • We are a group of martial arts and wellness student and instructors that are super keen on opening a queer+ body + holsitic martial arts space that is financially accessible to both individuals and orgs
  • We're looking to raise some funds to start off our dream! The more $$$, the bigger the space we can get, and we're looking at this as a 5+ year project, so every penny counts (and every $100 counts too tho)
  • This would be an absolutely amazing resource for the community, and will make self-defense more accessible to folks who have historically been pushed out of athletic spaces, due to class, gender, size, sexuality, and ability.

  • We’ll offer a weekly schedule of classes that includes MMA, Boxing, Self-Defense, and Yoga.  We want this gym to be accessible to everyone regardless of how much money they have, which means we’re looking to lower cost of space access for students and up-and-coming organizations.

If you like us so far, check out our donations tiers. If you're not convinced and need more info, keep reading!

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • We're looking to raise about $20,000 to get this gym started for the first year. This budget would include
    • Rent/Utilities (6 months-12 months)
    • Equipment- pads and bags and mats oh my!
    • Insurance
    • Administrative Fees
    • Promotions- gettin the word out on social media
    • Build-Up- a.k.a making the space shine
    • Amenities/Facilities- cleanin and keepin the space nice, cause we deserve nice things)
  • For your donation WE WILL BE FOREVER IN DEBT. But also you can get one of our fancy custom t-shirts, wraps, gloves, and yoga mats! Plus some zines, stickers, and pins to boot!
  • Want MORE opportunities to donate? We got movie nights, trainings, comedy nights, and plenty of other fun things planned to celebrate the start of PPH. Stay tuned for updates for all the cool events we got coming up, and see the current list of events here.
  • We're gonna try super duper hard to reach this goal, but if we do not, don't worry! This project is a dream of ours, and it will come to life in some form (even if it means starting a bit smaller for a while)

The Impact

  • The people who have the most to gain from self-defense training are often the people who are least likely to get it -- gyms can be intimidating, unfriendly, unsafe, and expensive. PPH will be a friendly, intersectional space where people can come to learn not just how to protect themselves, but to better connect with their bodies and feel more at home in their bodies.
  • PPH is a community project, by the people and for the people. We’re working with folks from Trans Boxing, DanceSafe, Triangles Everywhere, and more! Our core team is Grey, a MMA instructor and Secretary of Pop Gym; Jan, Treasure of Pop Gym; Hamilton, journalist and boxing instructor; Kastalia, a journalist and boxer; and Andrew, Aikido Instructor and owner of Wickwood Aikido. We’ve been working for more than a year to build PPH from the ground up, and now it’s finally time for us to start fundraising
  • We're trying to make sure those who have been historically pushed out of self-defense spaces have a space/place where they feel safe, and learn some skills that can really benefit their lives, and the lives of community members. We plan to build a space in which both students and instructors will benefit and grow from.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest thing going against us is the NYC Real Estate Market (surprise!). We are looking for a space where groups can have a reasonably sized class (including equipment and people moving for about 10 attendees), which is no easy task. We're seeing how much we can make with this fundraiser, as this would greatly influence the size of the space we can get, as well as what amenities we can provide community members.

We believe that our community deserves a nice, clean, space in which they can grow in their knowledge of self-defense and self-care. How big will this space be? All depends on this fundraiser!

Other Ways You Can Help

When we say this is a community project, we mean it! There are so many ways to help, and there will be so many opportunities to help (financially and not) in the future. Right now though, we need:

  • Folks to get the word out about our fundraiser and events!
  • Folks to share the campaign through the IndieGoGo page, so that we may better please the Great Algorithms

We appreciate and/all help in making this dream a reality. Can you help us with that?

That's all for now, stay tuned for updates!
story_txt:
People's Power House
Self-Defense is for everyone!
TL:DR Origin Story
Hey! Thanks for checking out our fundraiser page. A little about us:

We are a group of martial arts and wellness student and instructors that are super keen on opening a queer+ body + holsitic martial arts space that is financially accessible to both individuals and orgs
We're looking to raise some funds to start off our dream! The more $$$, the bigger the space we can get, and we're looking at this as a 5+ year project, so every penny counts (and every $100 counts too tho)
This would be an absolutely amazing resource for the community, and will make self-defense more accessible to folks who have historically been pushed out of athletic spaces, due to class, gender, size, sexuality, and ability.
We’ll offer a weekly schedule of classes that includes MMA, Boxing, Self-Defense, and Yoga.  We want this gym to be accessible to everyone regardless of how much money they have, which means we’re looking to lower cost of space access for students and up-and-coming organizations.

If you like us so far, check out our donations tiers. If you're not convinced and need more info, keep reading!


What We Need & What You Get
Break it down for folks in more detail:

We're looking to raise about $20,000 to get this gym started for the first year. This budget would include
Rent/Utilities (6 months-12 months)
Equipment- pads and bags and mats oh my!
Insurance
Administrative Fees
Promotions- gettin the word out on social media
Build-Up- a.k.a making the space shine
Amenities/Facilities- cleanin and keepin the space nice, cause we deserve nice things)


For your donation WE WILL BE FOREVER IN DEBT. But also you can get one of our fancy custom t-shirts, wraps, gloves, and yoga mats! Plus some zines, stickers, and pins to boot!
Want MORE opportunities to donate? We got movie nights, trainings, comedy nights, and plenty of other fun things planned to celebrate the start of PPH. Stay tuned for updates for all the cool events we got coming up, and see the current list of events here.

We're gonna try super duper hard to reach this goal, but if we do not, don't worry! This project is a dream of ours, and it will come to life in some form (even if it means starting a bit smaller for a while)



The Impact

The people who have the most to gain from self-defense training are often the people who are least likely to get it -- gyms can be intimidating, unfriendly, unsafe, and expensive. PPH will be a friendly, intersectional space where people can come to learn not just how to protect themselves, but to better connect with their bodies and feel more at home in their bodies.
PPH is a community project, by the people and for the people. We’re working with folks from Trans Boxing, DanceSafe, Triangles Everywhere, and more! Our core team is Grey, a MMA instructor and Secretary of Pop Gym; Jan, Treasure of Pop Gym; Hamilton, journalist and boxing instructor; Kastalia, a journalist and boxer; and Andrew, Aikido Instructor and owner of Wickwood Aikido. We’ve been working for more than a year to build PPH from the ground up, and now it’s finally time for us to start fundraising
We're trying to make sure those who have been historically pushed out of self-defense spaces have a space/place where they feel safe, and learn some skills that can really benefit their lives, and the lives of community members. We plan to build a space in which both students and instructors will benefit and grow from.


Risks & Challenges
The biggest thing going against us is the NYC Real Estate Market (surprise!). We are looking for a space where groups can have a reasonably sized class (including equipment and people moving for about 10 attendees), which is no easy task. We're seeing how much we can make with this fundraiser, as this would greatly influence the size of the space we can get, as well as what amenities we can provide community members.
We believe that our community deserves a nice, clean, space in which they can grow in their knowledge of self-defense and self-care. How big will this space be? All depends on this fundraiser!

Other Ways You Can Help
When we say this is a community project, we mean it! There are so many ways to help, and there will be so many opportunities to help (financially and not) in the future. Right now though, we need:

Folks to get the word out about our fundraiser and events!
Folks to share the campaign through the IndieGoGo page, so that we may better please the Great Algorithms

We appreciate and/all help in making this dream a reality. Can you help us with that?
That's all for now, stay tuned for updates!

story:
So why are we doing this?

How did it all start?

Stage 1: We tried a float

Stage 2: We thought it was awesome

Stage 3: We thought it could be even better

Stage 4: We figured out how to make it better

Stage 5: We made it better…you’re welcome :-P

Why is Float the Idea going to become THE spot for the entire Jacksonville community?

We decided that floating should be accessible to everyone. Everyone in our lives, everyone we’ve met can get something meaningful from a float and floating seems so simple. We decided there had to be a way to make it affordable to more people, so we did some research.

A float tank is incredibly simple, yet unbelievably complex. There are so many options and factors to consider, but in the end, they must all have a few key elements that work perfectly. Building a tank that’s comfortable for a variety of individuals of all shapes and sizes, and doesn’t feel stuffy and claustrophobic while being able to block sound and light is not as simple as it may seem from the start. After extensive research and comparison shopping, we found the perfect tanks and manufacturer:

Enter Escape Pod Tanks, and the incredibly awesome, Mr. Jeremy Warner.

Click here to learn more about our tanks.

3-in-1 Infrared Sauna

As we continued floating, we learned more about ways to complement the experience. Sometimes, after an especially good float, I would feel nervous about going back to my normal stressful life. I didn’t want to lose the bliss I had found. I sometimes wanted a little direction after my float to ease me back to reality without losing the sense of peace I just found.

We decided we wanted a way to truly awaken our senses after using the float to bring them to baseline, and we found the Sunlighten mPulse series full spectrum Infrared Sauna (FSIR). The mPulse not only provides healthy radiant IR heat like the sun without the harmful UV, it also comes with options to stimulate your eyes and ears. The SoSound Hearts provide the relaxing vibrations of Acoustic Resonance Therapy (A.R.T.) and the Chromotherapy light allows you to target specific goals for your wellness. You can even customize the sauna session itself with one of the seven built in wellness sessions developed through years of scientific study.

Click here to learn more about the mPulse Sauna

Click here to learn more about A.R.T.

Click here to learn more about Chromotherapy

After your session in our sauna, you’ve awakened touch, sight and sound.

You step out of your private room and come to our tea bar and alkaline atmospheric water generator. Here you can enjoy fresh clean delicious alkaline water and quality teas from around the world.

Awaken taste and smell.

At Float the Idea, we welcome you to our House for a complete experience.

You can study in our library before your float.

You can lounge in our living room to quietly process your experience (decorated with work from local artists using your contributions).

You can create in our playroom after you get the creative juices going during your float.

What We Need

What we need now is very little. We currently have the funds to open our doors. We have secured a building and construction is already under way. Equipment and materials have been purchased even down to much of our décor. We want to upgrade to non-lead based paint though :-P

Contributions from this campaign will go towards nicer décor, more options for tea, nicer linens, art supplies, and activity materials for the playroom. Remaining funds will be left to grow, so we can expand our offerings to take advantage of our backyard (yoga classes, garden, outdoor lounge).

What You Get

Scented Epsom Salt for home

Get Salty! Take home the same high quality US made Epsom Salt from San Francisco Salt Co. we use in our float tanks, carefully prepared in small batches with a choice of 3 scents:

Calming- Lavender/Rosemary

Energizing- Eucalyptus/Mint

Clarifying- Lemon/Tea Tree

Dissolve in your bath, or use as an exfoliant in the shower.

Full Spectrum InfraRed Sauna Wellness Program

Choose from one of seven built in wellness sessions developed through years of scientific study.

Cardio: 45 min (Near, Mid and Far)

Starts at a high intensity to increase heart rate and cardiac output then lowers to sustain heart rate level.  Circulation increases to promote healthy blood pressure.

Detoxification: 37 min (Mid and Far)

Starts at a high intensity to increases the body’s core temperature then reduces to a low, comfortable intensity level.  IR combination improves vascular access flow to reach toxins at the cellular level.

Pain relief: 30 min (Near, Mid and Far)

An IR blend provides natural pain relief by reducing inflammation and swelling while near IR LEDs penetrate the tissue to promote cellular repair at a medium, constant intensity level.

Relaxation: 40 min (Near, Mid and Far)

Far, mid and near infrared rays induce deep relaxation as they relieve muscle tension at a low, comfortable intensity promoting overall stress reduction with regular use.

Weight loss: 30 min (Mid and Far)

Starts at a high intensity to stimulate the cardiovascular system then reduces to a medium level.  As the body works to cool itself, there is an increase in heart rate, cardiac output and metabolic rate similar to exercise.

Anti-aging: 30 min (Near, Mid and Far)

A low, constant intensity level penetrates tissue to help with various skin concerns.  Near IR LEDs improve overall skin tone, elasticity and firmness promoting anti-aging benefits.

90 Minute Float Session

Enter your private room with shower. We provide shampoo, body wash, ear plugs, cotton swabs, petroleum jelly (to cover any small cuts), makeup remover and towels. Take a few minutes to take a cleansing shower before your float session. Then step into one of our Escape Pod Explorer tanks, and enjoy 90 minutes of blissful nothingness. Allow your mind to wander, let the aches and pains melt away. Finish your session with a quick rinse, then come join us for some tea.

90 Minute Float Session and Full Spectrum InfraRed Sauna Wellness Program

Allow us to create a complete program for you: float to rest, then use the sauna to recharge.

3- 90 Minute Floats

One of the things we found most frustrating was paying for things that expire. Stressing about having paid for something I may not have time to do ruins the point of the float experience, so our prepaid packages don’t expire, and you can always share them. We started this place to share the joy of floating with the world. We want you to share that joy with those you care for.

The Risks

WORLD WAR III...

But seriously...there could be delays due to any number of variables, we are dealing with government entities here. We will always work hard to make sure everything we do not only meets, but exceeds current standards so we don't expect any issues.

story:
Depuis que je connais les outils énergétiques de la méthode Access Consciousness, ma vie s'est complètement transformé ! Et dire qu'il y a un an, j'étais « handicapée »physiquement et en arrêt maladie...Autant dire que je n'avais pas trop la patate...Mais j'ai fait le choix d'une autre réalité, j'ai choisi de guérir et de retrouver le pouvoir de création de ma vie !

Aujourd'hui rien ne m'arrête et j'ai envie de parcourir le monde et de propager la joie et plus de conscience partout partout ! J'ai commencé mon activité de facilitatrice et coach en novembre et j'ai posé des questions : « que puis je créer qui n'existe pas et qui me contribuerait vraiment ainsi qu'à la conscience, la terre, Access consciousness ? Quelle grande contribution est ce que je peux être ? J'ai cheminé de prises de conscience en prises de conscience et cela a souvent été « chaotique » mais j'ai vu ma réalité commencer à vraiment se transformer..

J'ai demandé : « Et puis zut, si j'en avais rien a cirer de tout, qu'est ce que je ferai ? Et là, l'idée est venue.... J'adore conduire, j'adore être dans le mouvement, je suis énergie et ce qui me plaît c'est de faire émerger vos capacités, votre magie !

Cela fait dix ans que j'accompagne des personnes dans leur évolution mais j'avoue qu'avec ces outils, le changement peut être très rapide et au delà de tout ce qu'on peut imaginer !

J'adore aussi faire des vidéos, j'ai d'ailleurs ma chaîne YOUTUBE sur laquelle je témoigne de mon changement de réalité. J'aime aussi l'aventure et les défis ! Du coup, l'idée de prendre ma voiture, parcourir les routes à la rencontre de tous ces  magiciens et magiciennes  et j'ai perçu une telle énergie puissante de joie que je sais que ça va être un cadeau pour tous ! Quelle magie est ce que cela peut créer dans vos univers ?

J'ai vraiment perçu un réel besoin de créer du lien et des connexions entre les personnes et l'idée de me rendre sur place m'a paru très légère !

Du coup, je vais sillonner les routes de fin juin à mi août (Youpi, ça rime!) à la rencontre des praticiens et facilitateurs de la méthode. et je les inviterai à enregistrer avec moi une petite vidéo pour partager leur magie...une expérience magique avec les outils Access. J'ai posté une publication sur Facebook présentant le projet et j'ai reçu plus de 50 invitations dans toute la France de personnes prêtes à jouter le jeu et à m'accueillir sur ma route ! Comment ça devient encore mieux que ça ? Ça c'est RECEVOIR !!

Le fruit de ce projet sera retranscrit sur mon futur site internet  qui contribuera à tous puisqu'il permettra de les faire connaître ! Le concept s'appelle « PAYE TA MAGIE AVEC ELODIE  ». Pourquoi me direz vous ? Je me suis rendue compte que j'utilisais beaucoup le terme « partager » et j'ai voulu inviter également l'énergie de l'argent dans ce voyage, le mot « payer » et donc arriver;) c'est un petit clin d’œil à mes récentes prises de conscience sur l'argent grâce aux outils Access Consciousness.  Je me suis rendue compte que j'ai souvent exclu cette énergie dans mes créations car je pouvais me satisfaire de pas grand chose...mais avec les outils Access, j'ai fait le choix que cela change. et je demande à transformer tout ça pendant ce voyage. Et si l'argent allait me permettre de créer encore plus ? 

Aussi pour préparer ce voyage de plus de 4000 Kilomètres, j'ai posé des questions (qu'est ce qu'il faudrait pour que je puisse réaliser ce voyage dans l'aisance, la joie et la gloire ? Qu'est ce qui créerait plus ? Et l'idée du sponsoring puis du Crowdfunding est arrivée ! J'ai même fait une vidéo pour Dain et Gary en anglais (vous la trouverez sur ma chaîne YOUTUBE!!!) ! Fallait le faire !!! J'ai pris conscience que je pourrai aller plus loin avec plus de moyen. Concrètement, j'ai estimé un investissement d'environ 1500 euros pour les trajets (péage, essence, entretien voiture et réparation d'avant départ), j'ai choisi aussi de m'attribuer un montant de 1500 euros pour l'investissement personnel (le truc que j'aurai complètement oublié avant !!!) et bien sûr 500 euros d'imprévus, plus encore un montant de 1000 euros supplémentaire pour le budget communication et mise en place du site internet. Ce n'est pas une démarche facile pour moi mais je me lance et je veux montrer aussi qu'on peut tout demander, qu'on peut se lancer surtout quand on est passionnée et quand on croit à ses idées.


 

Je suis aussi convaincue de l'envergure de ce projet et de ce que cela va créer ! Ça va être PUISSANT !! Je vais même le partager sur le réseau Access Consciousness worldwide ! qu'est ce que ça peut créer ? Ce qui m'amuse c'est vraiment de faire des trucs improbables et que personne n'oserait faire ! Aussi je reconnais que je sais que je suis un excellent « connecteur » (cf. la joie du business de Simone Milasas pour ceux ou celles qui ne connaissent pas) et ce projet va permettre de créer de très nombreuses connexions qui contribueront à tous !


 

Ma démarche peut sembler complètement folle pour certains...et je n'ai jamais dit que je ne l'étais pas (ahahah) et c'est ça qui est drôle ! ! C'est ça qui change le monde !Si vous choisissez de contribuer à ce projet, quelle magie est ce que ça va créer dans vos vies ? Alors d'avance, je vous remercie pour vos contributions ! Aussi  pour ceux qui ne m'accueillent pas pendant la tournée mais qui veulent contribuer à partir de 30 euros, vous pourrez bénéficier d'une mini facilitation en ligne avec moi sur le thème de votre choix ! et si votre contribution est égale ou supérieure à 70 euros, alors là vous aurez droit à une heure de facilitation en ligne ou à un processus corporel énergétique si nous pouvons nous rencontrer :) Merci aussi pour vos nombreuses invitations. Gratitude !! On va bien se marrer ! C'est garanti !!!!! Quelle magie et quelle joie est ce que je peux propager dans vos univers ?

Si ce n'est pas déjà fait, suivez moi sur ma page facebook « paye ta magie avec Elodie » !! Bel été à tous !

Merci à tous d'être.


 

A bientôt !!

Le concept s'appelle « PAYE TA MAGIE AVEC ELODIE  ». Pourquoi me direz vous ? Je me suis rendue compte que j'utilisais beaucoup le terme « partager » et j'ai voulu inviter également l'énergie de l'argent dans ce voyage, le mot « payer » et donc arriver;) c'est un petit clin d’œil à mes récentes prises de conscience sur l'argent grâce aux outils Access Consciousness.  Je me suis rendue compte que j'ai souvent exclu cette énergie dans mes créations car je pouvais me satisfaire de pas grand chose...mais avec les outils Access, j'ai fait le choix que cela change. et je demande à transformer tout ça pendant ce voyage. Et si l'argent allait me permettre de créer encore plus ? Aussi pour préparer ce voyage de plus de 4000 Kilomètres, j'ai posé des questions (qu'est ce qu'il faudrait pour que je puisse réaliser ce voyage dans l'aisance, la joie et la gloire ? Qu'est ce qui créerait plus ? Et l'idée du sponsoring puis du Crowdfunding est arrivée ! J'ai même fait une vidéo pour Dain et Gary en anglais (vous la trouverez sur ma chaîne YOUTUBE!!!) ! Fallait le faire !!! J'ai pris conscience que je pourrai aller plus loin avec plus de moyen. Concrètement, j'ai estimé un investissement d'environ 1500 euros pour les trajets (péage, essence, entretien voiture et réparation d'avant départ), j'ai choisi aussi de m'attribuer un montant de 1500 euros pour l'investissement personnel (le truc que j'aurai complètement oublié avant !!!) et bien sûr 500 euros d'imprévus, plus encore un montant de 1000 euros supplémentaire pour le budget communication et mise en place du site internet. Ce n'est pas une démarche facile pour moi mais je me lance et je veux montrer aussi qu'on peut tout demander, qu'on peut se lancer surtout quand on est passionnée et quand on croit à ses idées. Je suis aussi convaincue de l'envergure de ce projet et de ce que cela va créer ! Ça va être PUISSANT !! Je vais même le partager sur le réseau Access Consciousness worldwide ! qu'est ce que ça peut créer ? Ce qui m'amuse c'est vraiment de faire des trucs improbables et que personne n'oserait faire ! Aussi je reconnais que je sais que je suis un excellent « connecteur » (cf. la joie du business de Simone Milasas pour ceux ou celles qui ne connaissent pas) et ce projet va permettre de créer de très nombreuses connexions qui contribueront à tous ! Ma démarche peut sembler complètement folle pour certains...et je n'ai jamais dit que je ne l'étais pas (ahahah) et c'est ça qui est drôle ! ! C'est ça qui change le monde !Si vous choisissez de contribuer à ce projet, quelle magie est ce que ça va créer dans vos vies ? Alors d'avance, je vous remercie pour vos contributions ! Aussi  pour ceux qui ne m'accueillent pas pendant la tournée mais qui veulent contribuer à partir de 30 euros, vous pourrez bénéficier d'une mini facilitation en ligne avec moi sur le thème de votre choix ! et si votre contribution est égale ou supérieure à 70 euros, alors là vous aurez droit à une heure de facilitation en ligne ou à un processus corporel énergétique si nous pouvons nous rencontrer :) Merci aussi pour vos nombreuses invitations. Gratitude !! On va bien se marrer ! C'est garanti !!!!! Quelle magie et quelle joie est ce que je peux propager dans vos univers ?Si ce n'est pas déjà fait, suivez moi sur ma page facebook « paye ta magie avec Elodie » !! Bel été à tous !Merci à tous d'être. A bientôt !!

story:
When Raymond worked at Shuman Detention Center...

He was introduced to yoga by a local yogi named Joanne Spence. She brought yoga to the youth there and relied on Raymond to help garner interest. She believed in the power of yoga to help transform mental and physical habits, and overall well being. Raymond was a tad skeptical at first, but he kept an open mind, and eventually started to see the changes in himself, and the residents in his care. 

After talking about his experience with this program, and winning the annual JDCAP program of the year for juvenile detention, I jokingly suggested he start a movement and call it BIG GUY YOGA! We laughed about it at first, but then quickly realized that it was kind of a brilliant idea. 

We knew he'd have to practice yoga more regularly and seek certification to teach yoga, and he had every intention of doing so. But life, paying the bills, transitioning jobs, health issues etc put his vision on a temporary hold...until now! 

An opportunity has arisen for Raymond to take a 200 hour Yoga Instruction course  to become a certified yoga instructor with an organization called "Breathe for Change." Raymond will be taking the course this summer in Washington DC. We were hoping he could take the class sooner, but the summer class actually works much better with his schedule, and it gives us more time to raise/save the cost of tuition! 

What We Need & What You Get

Raymond needs a total of $2500 to make this vision a reality. 

  • $2000 covers the remaining tuition & fees. 
  • $500 covers a fraction of his travel and lodging while in Washington DC. 
  • Any funds raised over the goal amount will go toward travel expenses and lodging. 

We have provided "perks" for those who donate! $5 gets you a free yoga session, once Raymond is certified. $25 gets you 5 sessions, and $100 gets you 20 sessions that we encourage you to share with a friend! The sessions will be available after 1/18/17 at a location TBA. 

The Impact

We really believe this opportunity will jump start a movement that has great potential. To start, BIG GUY YOGA plans to partner with Northside organizations and start close to home! BIG GUY YOGA believes that yoga, as a practice, cultivates discernment, awareness, self-regulation and higher consciousness in the individual. According to Wikipedia, "Yoga achieves overall health and wellbeing (physical, emotional, mental and social) through the regular practice of a range of many different techniques, including postures and movement, breath awareness and breathing exercises, relaxation and concentration, self-inquiry and meditation." 

Facilitating more opportunities for mindfulness is the primary goal of BIG GUY YOGA, and we hope you can help Raymond achieve this vision. 

Breathing is very important. Change is very important. Breathing for Change just might be the healing balm that much of our interpersonal ills crave. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge we face is funding the required course work. Now that we are certain he will take the summer course, we can breathe a little easier, and are confident we'll meet our goal! 

Can we count on you to help make this vision a reality? 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes, you just can't contribute $$$, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • We need you to let us know that we are on to something! If you like what you hear, and you have a group that might benefit from BIG GUY YOGA, let us know!
  • Shares=$$$$! When you share the BIG GUY YOGA campaign on social media, email, etc, you help increase our visibility and that means dollars and cents! 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Capri's Apothecary -

Who I am and what it is.

 

Hello angels, my name is Caesar or as many call me Capri. I'm a 21 year old black lesbian creative based out the West Coast. Most of my life I have been vegetarian, plant-based and sustainable/holistic. Well, what is sustainable and holistic? Sustainability is the practice of small waste lifestyle. To do your best in making sure everything you have gets used and one doesn't create extra trash etc. Holistic is natural living, so many people who live holistically tend to make their own medicine, body care items, household cleaning items etc etc. (Yes, I do this too.)

I started being sustainable and holistic pretty much right out of high school at 17 years old. It was important to me to get back to my roots, to get back to earth and show all my gratitude toward her. However, what people don't know about the holistic community is that it's saturated in whiteness and can be exclusionary for lower income, younger, black and brown folk. That's another part of my mission, to make this accessible to kids like me. I didn't have a lot of money at all when I started this and growing my essential oil collection has been a years long project. I want sustainable switches to be affordable and to make holistic/organic product affordable for people like me too.

Which leads me to this, Capri's. Capri's was born out of years long debate and a very fortunate accident. After posting a picture of my essential oil collection and people deciding I was worth it, I fully decided to open my shop. Focusing (right now) primarily on body care. Butters, oils and soaps. Each item is prayed over, charged and blessed. Either with prayer, crystals, the sun or the moon. There is a heavy spiritual influence and attachment to my products. 

I'm making this indiegogo to ask for help and ask for a chance to grow. Funding this alone while also trying to make moves for my personal life can and has gotten difficult. I want to be able to expand. Into something even bigger than this, for the community. For my community, black lesbian girls and queer folk alike. 

I sincerely hope you all will give me a chance. 

Yours, Capri.

story:
NOTE: You can purchase multiple perks. 

Our Mission is to Brain Train the World for Joy and Transformation using "Neuro-Gamification"

(Combining Game Dynamics with Brain Science).

We make social-emotional intelligence games for children, parents, and leaders. Our last Indiegogo campaign was a success, raising over $35,000. We're doing it again for our next batch of games.

 

Game-D, our latest neuro-gamification product, is a fun way to train your brain for social-emotional intelligence. You will learn how to create joy, peace, and make courageous decisions for your life. If you enjoy tarot cards, then you'll love Game-D. You can play by yourself, or you can get coaching from a certified guide.

 

 

Help Print the First Batch of Games & Support Our Non-Profit Programs

We're raising a goal of $20,000 to pay for our first print run of Game-D decks and fund programs for our certified non-profit parters.

How we're using our funds:

  • $7,800 paid to the artists hired to illustrate the games
  • $7,600 to print the first set of games and free shipping to fulfill orders
  • $2,000 donation funding for our certified non-profit partner programs
  • $1,000 Indiegogo platform fees (5%)
  • $1,000 Reserve fees (Indiegogo makes us set aside 5% for refunds)
  • $600 for credit card processing fees (2.9% + a fee for every transaction)

 

Game-D Comes in 2 Different Versions

78 Tarot-Sized Cards + 2 Instruction Cards per Deck

 

You Can Make the Difference

At campaign launch, we have 55 certifying trainers and 48 school teachers using our games. More are joining every week. reaching children, parents, leaders, organizations and communities all around the world. Our games are translated into Chinese and Spanish as well.

When you purchase our games, you are supporting our trainers and non-profit programs. The more games we sell, the more trainers sign up, and the more people we reach.

Because our last campaign was successful, we're able to certify the following partners:

  • Every Child Whole - Grounded Learning Framework for Social-Emotional Learning
  • Network Connect - Community Impact & Future Culture Creators
  • Teen Suicide Prevention Society - Mental Health Advocacy Program
  • KEEN Education Foundation - Neurodiversity and Exceptional Needs

 

How to Play Game-D

Game-D can be played for multiple needs using different spreads to learn social-emotional intelligence. Each game comes with an online course and chat community. Click here to see the full instructions.

 

Strengths & Potential Risks

Again, because our last campaign was successful, we were able to secure strong manufacturing partnerships and set up fulfillment systems. Using the same infrastructure, the risks of supporting this campaign have decreased substantially. Here is an  analysis of our strengths and potential risks.

  • Strength: Game-D is already designed and ready for mass distribution - all prototypes have been successful and we're using the same manufacturer as our last campaign.
  • Strength : We already have a community of practice to support all new players.
  • Risk: Our artists are not done with their illustrations and might be delayed - we will ship what we can immediately and provide refunds if orders are delayed too long.

 

Sign up for notifications to see more demos of Game-D in action.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not interested in Game-D, there are other ways you can support and make a difference. Please check the different perks and feel free to ask us questions. Here is a summary of opportunities:

  • Consider becoming a certified trainer and learn to help others with all our other games
  • Donate to one of our programs and we'll send them games and training on your behalf
  • Join us on our free webinars and gameplay demos
  • Tell your friends and invite them to join in on the fun

 

Current Trainers get 10% Referral Credits to Games

If you are currently in our program, you can refer people to this campaign. You will receive 10% of any referred support in credit for products. Make sure you have an Indiegogo account and share the proper links as shown in this image. Unfortunately, we will not track this manually so if you forget to share the link, there is nothing we can do. Follow these instructions:

story:
We're inundated with all kinds of health information and yet somehow we're sicker than ever. Holistic Hilda, the host and producer of the Wise Traditions podcast, is convinced that the key to better health is found in the wisdom of our ancestors. The month-long ancestral health tour in Australia was prompted by a sense of urgency to share ancestral health principles, based on Dr. Weston A. Price's findings nearly 100 years ago, and to learn about traditional health habits that we can incorporate into our own lives wherever we live. 

Dr. Weston A. Price traveled all around the world in the 1930s and Hilda has begun following in his footsteps. She has traveled to Peru and Kenya. And she is continuing on this quest and is particularly excited about Australia since Dr. Price considered the indigenous people of Australia to represent the epitome of moral and physical perfection. 

Also, outside of the United States, Australia has the biggest listening audience of the Wise Traditions podcast. This indicates that there is great interest in ancestral health practices, which Hilda will promote throughout the country.

The big picture of the itinerary is listed below. 

Aug 31 Fitzroy, VIC Indigenous food feast at Charcoal Lane restaurant

Sept 1 Castlemaine Bee Sanctuary, VIC Honey beehive tour

Sept 3 Abbotsford, VIC Meat Matters: how farm animals can save our health and planet

Sept 4 Sydney, NSW Wesley Centre CBD Wise Traditions, Wellness & WAPF

Sept 5 Sydney, Woollahra Development of children through nutrient-dense foods

Sept 5 Sydney, Castle Hill A New Hope for Food Degradation & Modern Epidemics

Sept 7 Sydney, Redfern WAPF member discussion at CarriageWorks markets

Sept 12 Tweed Shire, Clunes Community, environment & healing. WAPF & Gather By

Sept 14 Toowoomba, QLD Interactive Education on WAPF principles

Sept 15 Sunshine Coast, QLD, Reesville Back to Traditional Farming

Sept 22-27 Darwin, Northern Territory Cultural exchange with aboriginal peoples

Sept 28, 29 Atherton Tablelands Inaugural Ooray Plum Festival at Rainforest Bounty

A trip of this magnitude requires significant resources. Three sponsors have stepped up $8000 more is needed to cover in-country food, lodging, and the hiring of a local videographer/photographer to capture content for future release. 

I will save money by staying with local chapter leaders and friends in Australia! I'm not opposed to couch surfing, either. I am hiring videographers in Australia, so I don't have to incur unnecessary additional travel costs.

Of course I'll cover plenty of expenses out of pocket. But I just can't pull off this project on my own! A friend in Australia actually was the one who came up with this idea to crowdfund the project. 

As you can imagine, gifts of any size are MUCH appreciated! This is a big undertaking and it truly cannot take place without significant support. 

Join hands with us to address the worldwide health crisis! We need a team of people determined to challenge the status quo of conventional approaches to health. Become a:

Supporter - gift of $25 - You believe in the mission and will lift up wise traditions Down Under. Your gift makes possible Hilda's trip to Australia and within the country, visiting a variety of regions and communities for maximum impact.

Advocate - gift of $50 - You are an activist for good health, creating opportunities for word to spread that food can be our medicine and that ancestral traditions are worth studying and incorporating into our lives today. Your gift makes possible a series of presentations across Australia.

Partner - gift of $100 - You are committed to reversing the trend of chronic health conditions for the next generation. You make possible the hiring of videographers for content to be captured and shared digitally and globally. This piece is critical for getting the message out beyond those who attend events in person in Australia. 

Sponsor - gift of $1000 - You are all in, a difference-maker in addressing the worldwide health crisis! Thanks to your generosity, indigenous health practices will get the recognition they deserve, not only in Australia but across the globe. Your gift makes possible the compilation and editing of footage recorded for dissemination on digital platforms.
