story:
Summary

Hello! My name is Kate Leist and I am the founder of Soulrise Movement. I have been practicing yoga for twelve years and teaching for four. When I started teaching I began diving into my own healing process/self-development journey. In the process of teaching and my own healing I had some unnerving realizations. A lot of my own suffering was self-induced from overdoing it, being too busy, and then at the end of the day feeding myself negative self-talk about how I didn't accomplish enough. When I was 11 I begged my dad to put in ad in the paper lying and saying that I was 12 so that I could start babysitting, thus started my babysitting career. When I was 14 I started working 4 days a week at a Chinese restaurant while attending high school. In college I worked full-time as a server/bartender while attending school full-time. My friends make fun of me for having "12" jobs. I currently teach 4 classes per week plus regular workshops, work part-time at a wine bar, part-time at the Ritz-Carlton, and part-time as a dog-sitter. All I have ever known is to be too busy and working as hard as I possibly can. I know many people who can relate to this. This started wearing on me the past few years. I lost my creative spark and stopped doing art. I rarely saw my friends and family. My relationships suffered. I kept getting sick. I experienced several wake-up calls including a potentially deadly car accident. The universe was trying to get me to wake up to the reality of my situation and help me see that this is not a sustainable way to live my life.  As I became aware of this I noticed it with my students as well and I saw how it trickled negatively into their work, relationships, and home life. I realized that things don't have to be this way and we have more control than we think. I wanted to know how to solve this within my own life and how to help others, so I attended several self-development/spiritual trainings that gave me some useful tools to remedy this issue. It was after a Sprit Junkie Masterclass training with Gabby Bernstein in NY that I gained clarity on how exactly I want to help people overcome this suffering. Most of us aren't able to drop everything and go on a month long yoga retreat in Bali or even have enough time to attend a yoga class...so I created Soulrise Movement; short guided audio and video of breathing exercises, meditations, and simply yoga for busy lifestyles. Starting your day with a few minutes of deep breathing, stillness, and quiet can impact your whole day (positively). Soulrise Movement was created to show people that there are simple tools we can incorporate into our lives to feel more grounded, less frantic and overwhelmed, less reactionary, and more intentional. When we are rooted and connected to our inner self we can begin saying 'no' more often, setting boundaries, and learning our own limitations and give ourselves permission to honor those limitations. 

When I started Soulrise Movement I actually thought to myself it would be simple and somewhat easy...it's just an online business, how hard could it be? (haha, very funny Kate). I thought I could do everything by myself and create all of my own videos by myself. It turns out I am not a big fan of technology, video editing, or computers in general. You might ask why I am starting an online business? I know, it sounds silly. I was resistant for years, but this is THE way to REACH people. If everyone is going to be staring into their phones all the time then I am going to put myself right in there where they can find me. I created this campaign because I have realized I need help. I need help creating content, creating an app, and using marketing strategies to reach a wider audience. I also need to eventually hire a team of people to help me; perhaps a partner that is savvy with the techy stuff, a videographer, and in my wildest dreams a personal assistant (: 

My entire life I have been the idea person, the girl who calls her best friend and tells her about the latest and greatest idea and that THIS is the one that is going to make me successful! I've had hundreds of business ideas that didn't go anywhere. Soulrise Movement is the one idea that has become a reality. I feel deeply compelled to share this offering with the world. I have seen firsthand how the tools I have learned have helped me to become the person I am now. These tools have helped me overcome fear and doubt, heal from past traumas that kept me stuck, find clarity of my purpose, and find the strength and courage to go after what I want. I want to share these tools and techniques so that many people can improve their quality of life and start living healthier, happier, more intentional lives. 

I hired an amazing team- Alpen Creative, to help me create a badass video (that is exactly what I said when I met them..."Ima need a badass video") This video shows what Soulrise Movement is, why I am doing it, and why I need your help. Your contribution will go towards creating more content, finding and funding the support I need to grow this business (techy people!), and will help me to fulfill my dream of creating a thriving business that supports me financially, personally, and spiritually so that I can travel and offer classes and workshops worldwide. This world needs healing, people need healing, communities need healing, and I want to be part of the solution. Your contribution will not only help me live my dreams, it will create a positive ripple effect on the people that are experiencing suffering and ready to make a change.  Selfishly, your contribution will help me expand my business so that I don't have to work as a server clearing dirty plates and dealing with "the public" and all their nastiness anymore and I will no longer have to have 12 jobs to stay afloat!  I also would like to share that the long-term plans for Soulrise Movement is to start a non-profit organization that offers classes, workshops, camps & retreats for young underprivileged women that empowers these young women to dream big and live their truth. 

Other offerings from Soulrise Movement;

1. FREE online guided audio/video of breathing exercises, meditation, and simple yoga for everyone.

2. Self-enrichment courses on breathing your way to better health, developing and sustaining a morning routine, awakening to your true creative potential, and more!

3. Morning Breath with Kate - a comedic and mildly inappopriate video series offering a variety of different breathing exercises to start your day with, a new special guest every episode. 

4. Weekly webinar class series

5. Weekly FB Live Self-Care session 

In conclusion;

Soulrise Movement was created because of the excessive amount of self-induced stress and suffering that is going in modern society. People are disconnected from their true nature and often don't have the tools to connect to themselves and their true purpose. With the many distractions and our busy lifestyles it can seem impossible to take time to do a yoga practice or meditate. In comes Soulrise Movement, offering short breathing exercises and meditation to help people re-connect with their true nature.

What We Need & What You Get

What I need:

  • I am asking for $15,000. A majority of this will be going to the development of an app. The rest of it will go to the videographers to helps me create and edit videos. Anything leftover will go to online business consulting, marketing, promotional materials, branding, web-development, etc. 

Perks:

  • Contributions of $150 and more will receive a 60-minute private yoga/breathwork/meditation session in-person or online and have one month access to all videos. 
  • Contributions of $50 or more will receive a customized 10-minute breathwork/meditation and two weeks access to all videos. ***North Lake Tahoe residents who contribute $50 or more may attend one of my local workshops.
  • Contributions of $25 or more will receive a PDF on "5 Steps to Greater Clarity & Focus" with a link to a meditation that goes along with it and receive one week free access to all videos. 
  • Contributions of $15 or more will receive one week free access to all videos.

The Impact

Your contribution will support me in building my dream and to help people live with less stress and suffering and with more joy, clarity, and purpose. I strive to empower people to give themselves permission to slow down, take time for stillness and silence, use their breath as a tool to quiet the mind chatter and develop awareness, gain clarity on areas of their lives that need attention, and set boundaries and make decisions that are in alignment with their purpose while building the courage and strength to achieve their dreams. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to make a financial contribution then there are other ways you can help!

  • Share my video on your social media. 
  • Try my breathing exercises and if you like them share them with your friends and family!
  • Like my FB Page, follow me in Instagram. Share any posts that resonate with you.
story_txt:
Summary
Hello! My name is Kate Leist and I am the founder of Soulrise Movement. I have been practicing yoga for twelve years and teaching for four. When I started teaching I began diving into my own healing process/self-development journey. In the process of teaching and my own healing I had some unnerving realizations. A lot of my own suffering was self-induced from overdoing it, being too busy, and then at the end of the day feeding myself negative self-talk about how I didn't accomplish enough. When I was 11 I begged my dad to put in ad in the paper lying and saying that I was 12 so that I could start babysitting, thus started my babysitting career. When I was 14 I started working 4 days a week at a Chinese restaurant while attending high school. In college I worked full-time as a server/bartender while attending school full-time. My friends make fun of me for having "12" jobs. I currently teach 4 classes per week plus regular workshops, work part-time at a wine bar, part-time at the Ritz-Carlton, and part-time as a dog-sitter. All I have ever known is to be too busy and working as hard as I possibly can. I know many people who can relate to this. This started wearing on me the past few years. I lost my creative spark and stopped doing art. I rarely saw my friends and family. My relationships suffered. I kept getting sick. I experienced several wake-up calls including a potentially deadly car accident. The universe was trying to get me to wake up to the reality of my situation and help me see that this is not a sustainable way to live my life.  As I became aware of this I noticed it with my students as well and I saw how it trickled negatively into their work, relationships, and home life. I realized that things don't have to be this way and we have more control than we think. I wanted to know how to solve this within my own life and how to help others, so I attended several self-development/spiritual trainings that gave me some useful tools to remedy this issue. It was after a Sprit Junkie Masterclass training with Gabby Bernstein in NY that I gained clarity on how exactly I want to help people overcome this suffering. Most of us aren't able to drop everything and go on a month long yoga retreat in Bali or even have enough time to attend a yoga class...so I created Soulrise Movement; short guided audio and video of breathing exercises, meditations, and simply yoga for busy lifestyles. Starting your day with a few minutes of deep breathing, stillness, and quiet can impact your whole day (positively). Soulrise Movement was created to show people that there are simple tools we can incorporate into our lives to feel more grounded, less frantic and overwhelmed, less reactionary, and more intentional. When we are rooted and connected to our inner self we can begin saying 'no' more often, setting boundaries, and learning our own limitations and give ourselves permission to honor those limitations. 
When I started Soulrise Movement I actually thought to myself it would be simple and somewhat easy...it's just an online business, how hard could it be? (haha, very funny Kate). I thought I could do everything by myself and create all of my own videos by myself. It turns out I am not a big fan of technology, video editing, or computers in general. You might ask why I am starting an online business? I know, it sounds silly. I was resistant for years, but this is THE way to REACH people. If everyone is going to be staring into their phones all the time then I am going to put myself right in there where they can find me. I created this campaign because I have realized I need help. I need help creating content, creating an app, and using marketing strategies to reach a wider audience. I also need to eventually hire a team of people to help me; perhaps a partner that is savvy with the techy stuff, a videographer, and in my wildest dreams a personal assistant (: 
My entire life I have been the idea person, the girl who calls her best friend and tells her about the latest and greatest idea and that THIS is the one that is going to make me successful! I've had hundreds of business ideas that didn't go anywhere. Soulrise Movement is the one idea that has become a reality. I feel deeply compelled to share this offering with the world. I have seen firsthand how the tools I have learned have helped me to become the person I am now. These tools have helped me overcome fear and doubt, heal from past traumas that kept me stuck, find clarity of my purpose, and find the strength and courage to go after what I want. I want to share these tools and techniques so that many people can improve their quality of life and start living healthier, happier, more intentional lives. 
I hired an amazing team- Alpen Creative, to help me create a badass video (that is exactly what I said when I met them..."Ima need a badass video") This video shows what Soulrise Movement is, why I am doing it, and why I need your help. Your contribution will go towards creating more content, finding and funding the support I need to grow this business (techy people!), and will help me to fulfill my dream of creating a thriving business that supports me financially, personally, and spiritually so that I can travel and offer classes and workshops worldwide. This world needs healing, people need healing, communities need healing, and I want to be part of the solution. Your contribution will not only help me live my dreams, it will create a positive ripple effect on the people that are experiencing suffering and ready to make a change.  Selfishly, your contribution will help me expand my business so that I don't have to work as a server clearing dirty plates and dealing with "the public" and all their nastiness anymore and I will no longer have to have 12 jobs to stay afloat!  I also would like to share that the long-term plans for Soulrise Movement is to start a non-profit organization that offers classes, workshops, camps & retreats for young underprivileged women that empowers these young women to dream big and live their truth. 
Other offerings from Soulrise Movement;
1. FREE online guided audio/video of breathing exercises, meditation, and simple yoga for everyone.
2. Self-enrichment courses on breathing your way to better health, developing and sustaining a morning routine, awakening to your true creative potential, and more!
3. Morning Breath with Kate - a comedic and mildly inappopriate video series offering a variety of different breathing exercises to start your day with, a new special guest every episode. 
4. Weekly webinar class series
5. Weekly FB Live Self-Care session 
In conclusion;
Soulrise Movement was created because of the excessive amount of self-induced stress and suffering that is going in modern society. People are disconnected from their true nature and often don't have the tools to connect to themselves and their true purpose. With the many distractions and our busy lifestyles it can seem impossible to take time to do a yoga practice or meditate. In comes Soulrise Movement, offering short breathing exercises and meditation to help people re-connect with their true nature.

What We Need & What You Get
What I need:
I am asking for $15,000. A majority of this will be going to the development of an app. The rest of it will go to the videographers to helps me create and edit videos. Anything leftover will go to online business consulting, marketing, promotional materials, branding, web-development, etc. 
Perks:

Contributions of $150 and more will receive a 60-minute private yoga/breathwork/meditation session in-person or online and have one month access to all videos. 
Contributions of $50 or more will receive a customized 10-minute breathwork/meditation and two weeks access to all videos. ***North Lake Tahoe residents who contribute $50 or more may attend one of my local workshops.
Contributions of $25 or more will receive a PDF on "5 Steps to Greater Clarity & Focus" with a link to a meditation that goes along with it and receive one week free access to all videos. 
Contributions of $15 or more will receive one week free access to all videos.


The Impact
Your contribution will support me in building my dream and to help people live with less stress and suffering and with more joy, clarity, and purpose. I strive to empower people to give themselves permission to slow down, take time for stillness and silence, use their breath as a tool to quiet the mind chatter and develop awareness, gain clarity on areas of their lives that need attention, and set boundaries and make decisions that are in alignment with their purpose while building the courage and strength to achieve their dreams. 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you aren't able to make a financial contribution then there are other ways you can help!

Share my video on your social media. 
Try my breathing exercises and if you like them share them with your friends and family!
Like my FB Page, follow me in Instagram. Share any posts that resonate with you.

story:
Short Summary

I am the daughter of Railey and Esther Gompah.  Like my father, a former member of the media, I am a filmmaker and actress.  Like my mother, a former hospital staff member into nutrition, I am researched and experienced in methods of health and nutrition and am teaching others. 

About 11 years ago, on December 12, 2006, my mother, Esther suffered a debilitating stroke that left her in a wheelchair with limited speech. Through diet, my family has brought her back from several health challenges along the way and would like to see her and others facing challenges like hers have opportunities to participate in their potential recovery in affordable, proven and scientific ways.

Together, we can help to revolutionize the medical industry in this area of rehabilitation as well as save lives that would otherwise be cut short due to lack of information, accessibility and physical decline from atrophy. The brain has been shown to respond to repetition and muscles get stronger with regular use.

What does Moves look like?  It is an everyday gym like any you would see except this one has revolutionary equipment that supports the needs of those with physical challenges.

It provides:

  • Convenient hours of operation
  • State of the art equipment
  • Education to make gym usage effective and safe
  • Training on ways to supplement recovery through diet
  • Partnerships with likeminded businesses that can further supplement recovery
  • A community for individuals dedicated to furthering their recovery

Members/Staff/How Moves operates

  • Offers memberships to the general physically challenged populations
  • Offers rentals for people in a specialized case such as to those bedridden
  • Offers rental space for rehabilitation therapists such as PT, OT and exercise physiologists
  • Offers rental space for likeminded businesses on location
  • Sparsely staffed by dedicated employees with the help of interns and volunteers

What We Need & What You Get

With a goal to open the gym this winter in it's first Los Angeles location, Moves needs $260,000 to effectively begin serving the needs of the community.

This is how those funds will be used:

Equipment Costs              $196,000 Leased/purchased machines, benches, bands, weights

Immediate Staff Needs   $10,000   2 months of operations for 1 full and 1 part-time employee

Start Up/Legal Costs       $11,000    Legal, Computers, Furniture, Basic Facility Preparations

Location Rental                   $18,000   Rental as well as utilities for 4-6 months

Campaign Fees/Taxes      $21,000  Indiegogo processing fees and partial campaign taxes 

Perks include ways to commemorate and thank donors, company merchandise and free scholarships to use Moves.

If Moves doesn't reach it's goal, there is still so much we can do. With donations of $10,000 or less Moves will begin with basic start up (website/computers/programs),  legal,  administrative and contractor costs. With $25,000, Moves will open in a smaller facility with 10 of the least expensive leased machines and basic necessary equipment such as benches. With some additional funding as well as experience, Moves will be able to look for and apply for grants and loans to do more.

Why Give?

Moves will begin one way or the other.  Your donations reduce the stress on a start up that is there for the community so that more people can have access to enough machines. Moves will be able to offer necessary scholarships to those in need of them.  The organization can run smoothly with well trained staff and support that  is willing and fulfilled to be a part of it.

America has an epidemic of disability.  From those with brain injuries to those who have lost limbs and abilities through war, accidents or crimes.  This community will only become larger.  We can service the needs in the way we have been doing by offering the minimum or we can vigorously create change and equip as many people as possible in a way that encourages hope, provides a tool and can really lead to longer and more fulfilling, healthier lives

Risks & Challenges

Right now, Moves is just an idea in the mind's eye of one able bodied woman. I do not imagine that it will be easy. Along with an unknown future that America faces financially and in healthcare, I am not a healthcare professional and I have never run a company of this type and magnitude.  I expect to encounter many obstacles including legal ones.  I also have a fight to take this from just some small company to one that can be included in a list of companies that are setting a better example in this field. I want to see the industry change in a way that more insurance companies would start to be willing to pay for these types of gyms whether as part of a wellness benefit or in some other way. 

Inspite of these possibilities and a host of unforeseen ones, I am passionate about this cause.  I, also, feel that I am not a fish out of water in business. I have 10 years experience of running my own companies and worked as a coordinator and in finance in the medical and entertainment fields. In addition, I have years as a teacher, group leader and all around advocate for others.

To minimize and approach obstacles head on, I will have a support team of lawyers, accountants, marketers as well as it is my desire to eventually hire knowledgeable advocates to lead the change, approaching insurance companies, employers and the like to show how rehab gyms benefit their bottom line. 

What You Can Do

Moves needs you to do 3 things:

  • Give what you can.  There is no amount too small.
  • Tell others. Use Indiegogo's share tools to post this campaign directly to social media.
  • Consider who you can approach directly via phone, email or text.  They can follow these same steps.  Give. Share. Tell another person directly.

Thank you so much! Let's do something together!

story:
Our Story

We are a group of people dedicated to finding ways to live sustainably and share what we learn with others. We recognize that to heal our planet we must also first heal ourselves. So, we are thrilled to be able to offer a refuge where people can come to heal, learn and create. We encourage you to support our efforts, either through gifts or loans, to help us create an oasis for people to visit, intern, and/or live.

  • We are building our carbon neutral healing oasis in the forest on the Canadian Shield.
  • We are community minded people who have experience building consensus. 
  • Refuge in Algonquin acknowledges that we are on the traditional territory of many nations including the Algonquin. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need cash to buy materials, build tiny cabins for people to stay in and larger buildings to gather.

Participants are welcome to:

-visit our site

-participate in building

-support us financially contributing to our initial drive for money to purchase building supplies and in return enjoy a stay at the centre.

 -join us for the conversations focused on creating a truly egalitarian community run by consensus. 

How you can support us:

$250 – Prebook a week of glamping on the property, and participate in daily activities.

$600 – Prebook a week in a cabin, and participate in daily activities.

$1,200 – Prebook a week in a cabin, and participate in daily activities.
Includes organic meals.

$2,400 – Prebook a week in a cabin, and participate in daily activities.
Includes organic meals.
Includes a workshop.

In total we would love to raise $250,000!

The Impact

Your contribution will help us build cabins for retreat participants, meditators, and interns. We will make available opportunities for interns and visitors, to learn to build sustainable off grid tiny homes, and grow organic food. We will host diverse workshops and retreats for the body, mind and soul.

We've overcome our biggest challenge: securing land that can provide all of the things we envisioned including meadows, natural spring water, a lake, creeks, forests and hills.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are also seeking help from those with skills to collaborate within areas like feng shui, water wheels, natural home building, and other homesteading skills. We are also willing to do energy exchanges for those who want to visit and contribute. See our website for details!

story:
Camp Korey’s overall goal is to improve the quality of life for children, and to ensure that every child has access to camp programs in a setting that offers a respite and retreat from the difficulties and restrictions of life with a serious illness. We like to say “less poking and prodding, and more giggles and smiles.”

Fishing and boating is a favorite activity area for our campers, but last summer we had to shorten the length of time we’re on the water because our boats aren’t shaded and many kids with serious medical conditions can quickly overheat. Covers would allow us to keep the boats on the water longer, giving our campers more time to catch their first fish, sing songs, and enjoy the scenic beauty of Lake McMurray.

With your help, campers all summer long will keep cool as they tear up their "cool card" to catch a fish, give it a kiss, and release it back to the water!

Our Goal

Our goal is to raise $6,400, which would allow us to purchase and install shade covers for our two pontoon boats, and upkeep them through our 8 weeks of residential summer camp in 2019.

Choose from our listed perks to have your gift acknowledged in special ways! A $50 contribution has a perk of recognition on the social media channel of your choice; the $100 level perk is newsletter recognition; select the $250 contribution to receive a decorated Camp Korey picture frame; or choose and contribute at the $500 level to be invited to an exclusive pig roast dinner event at our camp in Mount Vernon on August 24th.

We have set a flexible goal, and if we do not meet that goal, all funds received will still go toward the boating shade covers. We know that with your support, these upgrades will keep campers safe and focused on fun for years to come!

story:
Fireside Art Therapy will operate from a small studio space, as part of a team of wellness practioners at the Kaslo Integrative Health Clinic.

I love to take creativity outside, and will offer programs and sessions in our beautiful Kootenay wilderness - because spending time in the natural world can be a powerful healing tool (and it feels good too!)

 

To get this project off the ground, I am asking for the funds to renovate/create a clean and warm studio space that will invite creativity, spontaneity and healthy relationships. This includes putting in a new door, insulating, laying flooring and installing shelving for art supplies.

I am offering a variety of services and handmade products to show my thanks and to give you a sense of what art therapy is. Some of my favourite art activities to offer are mapping exercises, creative lifelines, clay sculptures and black-out poetry...but the process is really up to the client, and the possibilities are endless and unique to each person. The process is usually as compelling as the product :)

I believe creativity is all around us, and art can be made by the clothes we wear, the food we cook, and the gardens we tend - as well as with paint, clay, glue and objects form the natural world.

I look forward to hearing from you! Thank you for sharing this fundraising campaign with others who you think may benefit or wish to support. 

And please take a moment to check out my website: www.tinyisland.ca

story:
Who we are

Flow Solutions is a for-profit alternative running water company founded by four students at Brown University. We are a team of listeners, designers, and engineers that creates simple, low-cost innovations that bring running water to those who lack access to it.

Billions of people have to get their water from an off-premise source, such as a well or a delivery truck. They then bring this water home, where it sits in buckets and containers. While water is available, there is no means for pressurizing it, meaning that people have trouble washing hands, dishes, and maintaining personal hygiene. It also means that use of water is inefficient.

As it stands, running water is viewed as a complex, expensive infrastructure problem and we want to change that. Running water is a human right, and we believe that our products will bring it to people anywhere in the world at a price they can afford. In our eyes, micro-running water systems are the perfect solution to this worldwide problem.

We’ve defined what we call “the safe water ecosystem”. This ecosystem includes Availability, Filtration, Delivery, Storage, Consumption, and Waste. Our solution specifically targets Storage and Consumption.

 

 

We want to help mend the broken safe water ecosystem.

Many help to bring water to those who don’t have access (Availability/Delivery) or clean water (Filtration), but forget about the later stages. The water may be available, but it’s stagnant and hard to use. Water is wasted when families perform simple tasks such as washing hands or cleaning dishes.

 

We have brought the design of our our first prototype to India and have partnered with FORCE, a New Delhi-based non-profit that provides clean water to communities across the country.

 

 

When we gave the prototype to families in New Delhi, they made fully functioning showers and sinks from them. In general, they loved the product!

 

What we need

To produce our solution at scale, we need to buy a custom dye for a plastic mold. This costs about $10,000 and the software we need to design our final product, and any future products costs an additional $5,000. With this funding, our team can further improve the prototype design and sell the tank at a lower price through scaled production.

 

The road ahead

We know this is not the solution, rather this is a solution. We also know that some solutions are scalable and some are not. We can foster local feedback loops that help us support alternative running water solutions to match user specific needs. These solutions can provide families with the necessary water resources to improve hand washing and other forms of disease preventing sanitary practices. Further, we can allow users to more efficiently control the amount of water they use, ensuring they get the most out of every drop.

 

How you can help

If you can donate, we really appreciate it! However, we also understand that not everyone can. There are tons of other ways you can help us bring running water to communities around the world. We are just a few of many seeking to bring innovation to the global water crisis. Spread the word to friends and share this campaign so we can bring water solutions to communities that need them. Also check out our website at www.flowsolutions.co and like our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/flowsolutionsinc to stay updated on everything that we're doing at Flow.

story:
HEALED PEOPLE HEAL PEOPLE.

We operate a little like Public Radio. We are listener supported. We set a goal of $45,000 for our original campaign and we did not reach it, so we're doing an extension. Please share this. Crowdfunding is not only about the beautiful souls who have supported the music in the past. It is about expanding the listener audience to help us co-create and continue this mission. Send a private message, make a phone call, talk about this over lunch to some of your friends who you know would resonate with this offering. Together we can make this happen. The costs of doing this are high. We really really need you to SUPPORT THE MUSIC THAT SUPPORTS YOU! 

A PERSONAL MESSAGE FROM BOB

Over the past 6 months, I've questioned - more than ever - my ability to comfortably continue doing this musical work full-time. There are many unknowns and inconsistencies in being a "do-it-yourself" musician that make it almost impossible to plan budgets or professionally invest in anything truly necessary to help spread these messages to more than just the 2000 people on our mailing list. That can be very stressful and has caused quite a bit of turmoil in many areas of my life. Part of me can't imagine not doing this full-time; Part of me wants a break!

Every time I get into a downward spiral, ONE OF YOU makes me realize how important this music is to send into the airwaves of humanity. I always say that I write these songs for myself first, because each one is a life lesson or life message for whatever I am experiencing at the time - and often, the lyrics don't even make "sense" until I am faced with a future event that makes me recall lyrics that I've sung over and over again yet will carry different significance from that point forward. I don't "sit down to write a song". I sit down because the song is ready to speak to and through me. The messages are universal, which is why they touch hearts of so many on so many paths with so many "differences".

When we created the original campaign, we looked at so many examples of gadgets and concepts that received well over their intended fundraising goal (this one is mind-boggling because it amazes us that the world believes we need another cell phone to choose from: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/jelly-the-smallest-4g-smartphone-android/x/8798660#/). We looked at the expenses that are involved in all of our efforts and - for the first time ever - included promotion and marketing in our crowdfunding goal. We've done two crowdfunding campaigns in the past, and the financial support received covered the new album(s), perks, and all the expenses that went into the creation of products described in the campaign. But it stopped there. There was nothing beyond that to invest in any services that most full-time musicians are able to employ. Creating products is fantastic and fun and exciting, but we need an audience who wants the products in their lives and the lives of their friends and family. Anyone who has been following the music for some time knows that there is plenty of product (we really don't need an 8th album!), but we do have a distribution challenge. We are not reaching audiences without physically being in front of new people, and that keeps us on the road and moving so we aren't able to sink into creating even more expansive programs for you. So we continue to invest in new products to serve the dedicated and loyal fan base who get it and want more, more, more! And for that, there is overflowing gratitude for those sparks of inspiration that allow me to keep on keeping on. 

7 ALBUMS IN 10 YEARS!?

Over the 10 years that Bob has been "making music", he has transformed as a person. He made personal growth and transformation his passion and it goes hand in hand with the music. 

You might have noticed that the music has evolved - right along with Bob - over these past 10 years and 7 albums. The messages have been getting more potent, more healing, and more resonant with others on the path of transformation and growth. 

MORE THAN A MUSICIAN (CAN WE GO DEEPER?) 

The past 3 years Bob embarked on this as a full-time career with support and creative collaboration from Shannon. This is a full-time mission for both of them. Not just for healing themselves but to share their experiences to inspire expansion in others. Bob came to realize that making CDs and playing concerts just wasn’t enough. It wasn’t enough to fully support the mission, but it also wasn’t enough because he really wanted to go deeper with it. To fully explore the medicinal influence of this music. 

Bob and Shannon combined the power of the rich messages of this music with what they found to be impactful self healing and transformational practices that have made a difference in their lives: meditation, breathwork, and working with the energy body (chakras). Shannon integrates her coaching and shamanic practices beautifully into the programs. It resulted in some very powerful workshops and experiences that truly express the full medicinal potency of this music.

After a few years on the road delivering these workshops to thousands of people, the most common question was, “How do I get a recording of this workshop?” So the wheels started turning...We need to get this work out to the world. 

WHAT IN THE WORLD IS GOING ON?

The energies and vibrations in this world are AMPED UP! It is measurable (google Schumann Resonance if you're interested). People are taking sides, politics is becoming an overheated dinner conversation, personal truths are being challenged, buttons are being pushed. Everyone is just a little on edge. Many of us are hurting. It is a simple truth that, “hurt people, hurt people”. We hurt from our hurt...but conversely, we heal from our healed place. When we address our healing, it ripples into our relationships, workplace, friends, family, community. Healing begets healing. 

In response to this, we are embarking on a grand project here!!!! It is a fundraiser to gather the necessary financial resources to record, produce, and deliver a treasure trove of healing, empowering, and transformational music PLUS experiences and tools for a collective healing to happen during a time in human history where it is really being called forth. 

WHAT DOES THIS CAMPAIGN INCLUDE? 

We have so many perks to meet your needs. If you want...

  • ...the new album, we have digital and hard copy perks
  • ...to dive into some meditation practice or experience some of Shannon's shamanic journeying, we have 2 The Movers perks
  • ...all music options including Bob's previous albums, we have 2 The Shakers perks
  • ...to go deeply into experiential online workshop programs, we have 3 The Peacemakers perks
  • ...to host a private concert, consider the Private Concert perk
  • ...to become a Business Sponsor, Ambassador, or Benefactor, there are all kinds of goodies in these perks

1- A NEW ALBUM: THE MOVERS, THE SHAKERS & THE PEACEMAKERS

One major component of this campaign is the new album called The Movers, The Shakers & The Peacemakers. How about 12 songs that will touch all aspects of healing? It rocks, it sways, it vibes, and it dances right into your consciousness. This is about stepping up. Stepping into love and peace. Being it and coming forth with a strong sense of peaceful luminous warrior mentality that is so needed at this frenetic time in humanity’s existence.

(TENTATIVE) Songs on the New Album

  1. The Movers, The Shakers & The Peacemakers
  2. Be Humble Be Hungry Be Love
  3. If Your Hand Was in Mine
  4. Raise the Vibe
  5. The One and Only Song
  6. If You Could See Our Heart
  7. Insignificant Somethings
  8. They Hide It
  9. I’m Beginning to Like the Sound
  10. Healed People
  11. No Mud No Lotus
  12. Something’s Gotta Burn

2- MUSIC MEDITATIONS

Imagine combining a soft blanket of songs with meditation for a completely unique and enlightening experience. The songs set you off on a journey and when combined with space for silences and meditation practice, it is a powerful experience for anyone regardless of your expertise (or lack of expertise) in meditation. If you are a seasoned meditator, this series will be a joyful new experience. If you are averse to meditation, unfamiliar, or simply want to learn, this series will open up an entirely new world to you. 

3- FULL BODY MUSICAL EXPERIENCE: RELEASE THE AURORA BOREALIS WITHIN

This has been a very popular workshop and so many people have asked for a recording of it. We are so excited to bring this to you. The video below explains it better than words here. It is a life changing experience that will serve to uncover blocks in your ethereal energy body (chakras) and allow for you to experience the music, breath, light, sounds, and intentions in a way that is completely universal yet completely unique to each human being.

The online training program will include at least 3-hours of audio and video of both Bob and Shannon guiding you to support this individualized evolution through your energy body. The beauty of this program is that it is your own inner journey. You will find nuggets and feel shifts where you are in that particular moment, every time you sink into the guidance. So the experience - though guided by the same program - is completely different every time.

4- PRACTICAL BREATHWORK: SELF HEALING, SELF MASTERY, SELF DISCOVERY

A steady personal practice of breathwork will change your life for the better in just about every possible way. It will reverse the negative health effects of a lifetime of stress, reduce anxiety, stave off depression, strengthen your relationships, elevate your ability to deal with emotions, improve your ability to deal with challenging people, change your relationship with food (or other substances), enhance your sleep, and allow a deeper sense of spiritual connection. Beyond all of that, you will feel good every time you practice it. Inner peace is experienced within the breath. 

It is complex field and there are many different teachings, disciplines, and practices from around the world an throughout centuries. All of them are effective in their own way. After immersing in many of these methods, we extracted the most potent and most practical of them all, developed our own twist, and created this program. 

We deliver our version in 4-hour workshops around the country. It is called “Practical Breathwork: Self Healing, Self Mastery, and Self Discovery”. As part of this campaign, you can receive the 4-hour online training program that includes audio and video of Bob and Shannon delivering modalities on how to self heal, master, and discover your way to awesomeness. It is a truly life changing class and is the central component of our lives and of this campaign.

IF YOU ONLY READ THIS (THIS IS THE BOTTOM LINE)

Wherever you are on your path, there is some medicine for you here. The project entails delivering all of these workshops AND a new CD. If it’s just the new CD that grabs your attention, so be it. But…

We hope that you are willing to take the plunge to go all in and delve into a new practice. Immerse yourself in practices and experiences that will enhance and change your life. Immerse in some deeply healing and transformational meditations. Experience the power of getting the energy body open and flowing and most importantly optimal and proper breathing, all while enjoying your new CD. 

This is the ONE

ARE ...YOU... IN... ?????

$150 All In Package 
1-  Signed copy of The Movers, The Shakers & The Peacemakers CD
2- The Movers, The Shakers & The Peacemakers decal sticker
3- The Movers, The Shakers & The Peacemakers T-Shirt
4- Your name highlighted in the CD liner notes
5- Music Meditation Level 2
6- Full Body Musical Experience Online Program
7- Practical Breathwork Online Master Class

story:
What is Orgasmic Meditation?

Orgasmic Meditation (OM) is a consciousness practice that is designed for singles and couples to experience more connection, vitality, pleasure, and meaning in every aspect of their lives. A partner strokes a woman’s clitoris for 15 minutes with no goal other than to feel, connect, and be present. With practice, you develop a larger state of consciousness, have better intimacy, and stronger connections.

Do you ever feel like you are alone in a crowd? Do you feel like you go through your day in a daze, doing all the right things, but never feeling satisfied?  Do you constantly interact with your spouse, co-workers, friends and community, but still feel disconnected?  Do you long for your relationships to be more intimate, more authentic, more fulfilling?   

Healing Sexuality and Relationships in Utah

What would happen if we rebuilt Orgasm from the ground up, but this time, included consciousness? The same way that we have been moving from processed to whole foods, from mere fitness to yoga, Orgasmic Meditation (OM) ushers Orgasm out of the dark, from the shameful and often consumptive places where it used to be, and into the light. To date, we have been squandering one of our most powerful resources. We have been using it haphazardly, recreationally, to blow off steam when, if channeled correctly, it could be used to light up the entire power grid of connection. Here we can have experiences that foster our growth and well-being.  This is what we call Orgasmic Living!

Currently, there are Orgasmic Meditation centers in California, Austin TX, London, New York City, Portland OR, but there is no OM community in Utah.... Yet.  The goal of having an OM center in Utah is to bring sexual healing, and authentic human connection to singles and couples in Utah.  

An OM center in Utah would give local residents access to OM classes, and coaches, in addition to lots of free events like weekly TurnOn groups, OM circles, OM Day retreat and OM Practice Club.  It would be a resource for all of us in Utah to learn how to fill up, turn on, and love out.  

Building an OM Community in Utah starts here, with you.  You can help bring OM to Utah simply by learning how to OM.  By enrolling into the Intro to OM class or hiring us to teach you OM privately, you are funding this community AND getting all the benefits of regular an OM practice.  

How The Funds Are Used

The first thing needed in order to bring OM to Utah is a certified instructor/coach who can lead events, teach the practice of OM and run the OM community.  A portion of the funds raised will pay for the certification process.  While we are getting certified, we will be bringing in outside instructors from Los Angeles, Las Vegas and San Francisco to teach the Intro to OM classes.   The funds raised will be used to rent the venue, pay the instructors, and advertise the classes. 

Like all start up businesses and communities, growth will start out slow, but Utah wants OM, Utah needs OM, and we project that the community will grow quickly.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in the bringing OM to Utah, but are not in a position to register for the class or private coaching, please share this campaign through email, Facebook, twitter etc.  If you join our Facebook page, you'll be notified when we hold free TurnOn games, OM circles, OM Practice Club, and OM Days retreat.   https://www.facebook.com/OMUtah/

Healing Sexuality and Relationships in Utah
What would happen if we rebuilt Orgasm from the ground up, but this time, included consciousness? The same way that we have been moving from processed to whole foods, from mere fitness to yoga, Orgasmic Meditation (OM) ushers Orgasm out of the dark, from the shameful and often consumptive places where it used to be, and into the light. To date, we have been squandering one of our most powerful resources. We have been using it haphazardly, recreationally, to blow off steam when, if channeled correctly, it could be used to light up the entire power grid of connection. Here we can have experiences that foster our growth and well-being.  This is what we call Orgasmic Living!
Currently, there are Orgasmic Meditation centers in California, Austin TX, London, New York City, Portland OR, but there is no OM community in Utah.... Yet.  The goal of having an OM center in Utah is to bring sexual healing, and authentic human connection to singles and couples in Utah.  
An OM center in Utah would give local residents access to OM classes, and coaches, in addition to lots of free events like weekly TurnOn groups, OM circles, OM Day retreat and OM Practice Club.  It would be a resource for all of us in Utah to learn how to fill up, turn on, and love out.  
 Building an OM Community in Utah starts here, with you.  You can help bring OM to Utah simply by learning how to OM.  By enrolling into the Intro to OM class or hiring us to teach you OM privately, you are funding this community AND getting all the benefits of regular an OM practice.  
How The Funds Are Used
 The first thing needed in order to bring OM to Utah is a certified instructor/coach who can lead events, teach the practice of OM and run the OM community.  A portion of the funds raised will pay for the certification process.  While we are getting certified, we will be bringing in outside instructors from Los Angeles, Las Vegas and San Francisco to teach the Intro to OM classes.   The funds raised will be used to rent the venue, pay the instructors, and advertise the classes. 
Like all start up businesses and communities, growth will start out slow, but Utah wants OM, Utah needs OM, and we project that the community will grow quickly.     Other Ways You Can Help If you are interested in the bringing OM to Utah, but are not in a position to register for the class or private coaching, please share this campaign through email, Facebook, twitter etc.  If you join our Facebook page, you'll be notified when we hold free TurnOn games, OM circles, OM Practice Club, and OM Days retreat.   https://www.facebook.com/OMUtah/
campaign_city: Salt Lake City, UT, United States

story:
We Are Invincible City Farms - We Are The Community


Why our mission is critical:

Fast facts:

  • “Food deserts” are geographic areas where access to affordable, healthy food options (aka fresh fruits and veggies) is limited or nonexistent because grocery stores are too far away.
  • About 23.5 million people live in food deserts. Nearly half of them are also low-income.
  • Approximately 2.5 million people live in low-income, rural areas that are more than 10 miles from a supermarket.
  • Living in a food desert has been linked to increased heart risk and increased illness in infants and babies, including higher rates of asthma.

Who we are:

Invincible City Farms (ICF) - A sustainable solution in solving a health and economic crisis.
ICF is the brainchild of critically acclaimed chef and restaurateur, Fredric A. Byarm. Having grown up in Camden, NJ and being a well-traveled global citizen, Fredric sees the urban areas in the U.S. through the eyes of someone who has played football in the streets among the parked cars, playing stickball in open lots, and listening for the Mr. Softee, ice cream truck on hot summer days. Fredric attended The Restaurant School in Philadelphia where he received his Culinary degree and studied in France. After culinary school, his career took off with the opening of four restaurants and ten appearances on the Food Network.

Along with his years as a well-renowned chef and restaurateur, Fredric brings his Lean and Six Sigma Black Belt Certifications in manufacturing to the organization. In 2010, Fredric moved to Phoenix, AZ and began to volunteer at non-profit organizations that serve the homeless, low-income, at risk youth and struggling individuals and families. This experience, along with working within the hospital systems in Arizona and Colorado led Fredric to shift his focus on issues of food insecurity and how he can use his talents to help others.

Having decades of experience within the food system and understanding the flow from farmer to the dinner table, Fredric is perfectly positioned to challenge how the food system functions within America’s worst urban food deserts, such as Chicago, New York, Detroit, New Orleans, and his hometown of Camden, NJ. Developing a food system which delivers not only healthy food at an affordable cost but education about the benefits of nutritious foods and jobs for those who may be having trouble finding work.

This vision of bringing healthy food, jobs and respecting the community’s dignity is Fredric’s passion and the reason for opening Invincible City Farms LLC. Hyper focused on his mission, Fredric states, “ICF's mindset is 'by, with and through' the city. Development to elevate a community has to have this as its core this paradigm. No one embraces things being done to them and there is no dignity to having things done for them."


How can you help create the catalyst for change?:

  • Invincible City Farms is diligently advocating for economic and development partners to bring to life the flagship location but needs the community's support to continue these efforts so we can break ground and begin building out this critical food resource.
     
  • Our target goal to get this accomplished is $60,000. This will be used to help fund cultivating and development of the farm site, staffing, community outreach, and educational programming in our flagship market, Camden, NJ.
     
  • We're gaining more support with economic organizations: Beth Filla of the UCEDC, a New Jersey, not-for-profit economic development corporation states “In addition to creating an innovative, locally sourced solution to Camden’s food desert problem, Invincible City Farms will create job opportunities for city residents, including those who are traditionally the least hirable"
     
  • Even if we don't reach our goal, we never say never, your contribution will still keep Invincible City Farms moving full steam ahead and the project will continue through full development one brick and grain of soil at a time. Our founder, Fredric is a seasoned businessman and community advocate with a successful track record.

Health conscious perks for a healthy & happy you!

  • Mini-herb garden
  • Deluxe gardener bag
  • Earth-friendly designer tote bag and pillows
  • Fitness tracker bracelet
  • VIP Invite to the grand opening, dinner and more!

The impact your contribution can have:

Healthy food access projects have the following effects on the community:

  • Revitalizes the local economy
  • Creates jobs for those hard to hire.
  • Improved health outcomes in the community including heart health and nutrition for infants and babies.

Risks & Challenges:

  • Our efforts in locking in the right property and developer partner is solid. The only risk is not getting the 17-acre dream location and having to scale the farm and community center down to a smaller location based on funding and community partner outreach.

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand the challenges of wanting to help but struggling with your own personal resources. If you can't contribute, please spread the word about the health and economic impact of food deserts in your local area. You can help in the following ways:

  • Share our campaign with your community of friends and family.
  • Stay up to date with food desert issues in America and lobby your local political officials for solutions and resources.
  • Start your own community farm, garden or Healthy Food Access program in your area.
     

We thank you for taking the time to learn more about Invincible City Farms!!

We understand the challenges of wanting to help but struggling with your own personal resources. If you can't contribute, please spread the word about the health and economic impact of food deserts in your local area. You can help in the following ways:

story:
The Story of Lark

Nearly two years ago while on vacation in California the inspiration for Lark struck me out of the blue. I was turning 30 and feeling completely lost in my life and purpose. I was struggling with depression. A few months prior, my mom had been diagnosed terminal cancer. I sat down to meditate, and the idea for Lark - everything from the branding to the products - downloaded into me. It was the most intense experience I've ever had. A few years prior I had become obsessed with clean ingredients when I became pregnant with our son, so putting products I'd been working on for years out into the universe seemed only natural. After finishing my meditation I looked over to a tree and a flock of tiny birds flew out. I found out later they were Larks - which is where our name comes from. I went home feeling excited and inspired about something for the first time in years. I got to work right away launching the brand and developing the products. I channeled all my grief and my anger into my work, creating a line of products that are safe, multifunctional and effective. My mom was there cheering me on the in those early stages, and she was so excited to share in what I was doing. 

My mom passed away in October of 2016. For those of you who didn't get a chance to know her, she was the strongest woman I've ever known. She fought (and beat) 3 other forms of cancer before her relapse. She was a woman who refused to give up no matter what the odds were. I'm so proud to be her daughter. 

I created this company because I truly believe that safe skincare should be accessible to everyone, and that beauty and wellness go hand in hand. I believe in building a space for community and connection where we can offer natural alternatives to traditional beauty products. 

I carry my mothers legacy and spirit with me in everything I do, and I channel her strength when times get hard. She's the inspiration behind this space and the driving force behind the brand. I hope that you'll join me in this journey and help me in creating this space. Below you can find more information about our shop and some of the amazing product lines we'll carry in addition to Lark. Thank you so much for your support, and I can't wait to see you at Lark Shop! 

xoxo,

Lisa

story:
At the age of 24 I left home to make a dream come true – cycle the world on a bicycle. After 66 thousand kilometers, 5 continents and 42 countries, I was left with a feeling of great satisfaction. I accomplished my dream.

I reached the highest summits and crossed the widest deserts. I was robbed at gun point, swam with whales, grilled marshmallow in an active volcano and danced with the Masai warriors in Kenia. I was on the top of the world.

But even this didn’t prepare me for the greatest journey of my life.
2 and a half years ago I joined a climbing excavation in the Himalayan mountains of north India. A 500 meter, bone shattering, fall down the snow-covered mountain ridge, marked the beginning of a new journey – a journey back to life, back to being Jinji.

After spending 3 months in a coma, I woke up at the head rehabilitation center in Shiba Tel Hashomer Hospital to a new, unfamiliar reality. A challenging reality due to the damage caused to my brain.
In the past I used to measure my progress in KM. Today in cm. This change makes every cm count! Every step for me is a challenge.
I remained the same man, only the journey changed.

And from this journey I realized:
A man who has reached the lowest valley can truly appreciate the highest peak.
The journey doesn’t begin at a certain place. It begins at a certain moment. The moment you and I decide to take the first step to achieve it.
This coming February I am going back to India, to the place where I almost took my last breath, the place that changed my life.
I am planning to meet the Indian mountaineers who rescued me and saved my life.

My recovery from the fall will last a lifetime but this will be a significant step on the way.
I intend to meet disabled people and others who have suffered head injuries and are on the journey of their life. I want to meet them and show them that it's possible.
That they are capable of everything.
That with hope and faith it is possible.
Through my story I want to show them that there is light. You have to walk with determination.
There are obstacles on the way, but you can overcome them.
I am calling you to take part in this journey with me. I hope to fund this journey with your help so that every person disabled or recovering from head injury will know that in life you can also fall up!

I will be joined by 2 photographers who will document my closure, so that my message, my faith and my tools will reach and help as many people as possible.
This journey I do not want to do alone.
I'm on a mission.
For all my friends who have been rehabilitated all over the world.
So that the message will be clear:
There is no mountain too far or too big,
It’s all small steps of the journey of our lives.

All funds raised above our goal amount will be donated to the Head Trauma Rehabilitation Department at Sheba Tel Hashomer Hospital.

It would be a great honor to have the opportunity to give back to the place that gave me back my life.

Now backers can receive free bottles of WAVE 2.0 simply by referring friends and family! Once your referral link has been used 3 times by 3 separate people, you will receive an additional bottle of WAVE 2.0, on the house! Once it is used 5 times, you will receive 2 bottles, then 6 bottles of 10 uses and a whole 12 month supply if you refer 15 friends!

Once you back this campaign you will receive your individual link that you can share with your friends and track your referrals.

story:
Short Summary

Hello. My name is Louise Bowditch and I am the founder of The M Word and the creator of Fan Fatale and through my work as a Menopause Mentor, I help women with their mindset and fix their mid-life muddles.

Check out my website https://louisebowditch.com to find out a bit more about me and what I do.

Through this campaign, I want to revolutionise not only women’s experience of the menopause by giving us a cool, practical solution, but to transform the fundamental way in which society views it.

Did you know that 79% of us who go through the menopause, will experience hot flushes? I mean, that’s a whole lot hot mama’s out there grabbing the nearest thing, ANY thing, to furiously waft over our faces in a futile attempt to alleviate the heat.

If you’ve ever experienced the unbearable searing sensation of burning up and not being able to cool down, then you know what I mean when I say it feels like you are heating up from the inside out and you feel as though you on FIRE … 

Yet, even though practically half of the world’s ENTIRE population could potentially go through the menopause, in the Western World it is culturally still a taboo subject.  I’ve spoken to many women who are struggling with this perfectly natural yet potentially hellish hormonal journey.  At best they feel like they need to ‘just get on with it’ and at worst they feel like they need to hide their symptoms. And I have felt this way too.

But not anymore. I intend to embrace the mid-life transition my body is going through and inspire other women to do the same.  We need to own our own ‘too hot to handle’ selves before we can expect anyone else to.

Fan Fatale is a fierce and feisty hand fan that keeps you cool while looking cool. It’s out with the cutesy, sugary sweet designs of yester-year and in with the sass!  Empowering statements rule. 

The initial design will have the words 'HOT STUFF’ emblazoned across it in bold eye-catching white text across a plain black background. It's meant to be seen. To be noticed. And so are the women who use it. The design is all about embracing our ‘hotness’ while letting everyone know we are done with hiding.  

Fan Fatale is here to keep us cool … in a much cooler way than ever before. It’s about challenging outdated thinking, busting the myth that menopausal women are past their prime and helping us to be seen.  And sizzle in all our glory.

By supporting this campaign, you will be helping pave the way for women everywhere.

What I Need & What You Get

I am looking to raise a minimum of $750 so I can place an order of 100 Fan Fatale fans. Each Fan Fatale hand fan is made using 100% eco-friendly black cotton fabric and traditional Japanese folding techniques although it is anything BUT traditional. The words 'HOT STUFF' will adorn each fan in bold white type making them very noticeable. They are not only attention-grabbing, they’re rebelling against the status quo. 

Donations of $10 will be gratefully received and there are additional perks available depending on the level of contribution.  If you sign up to join my campaign mailing list I can keep you up to date and inform you of the campaign’s progress. 

Multiples of 1, 2, 3, 5 or 10 fans are available and as the number of fans ordered increases, so the cost of each fan decreases. 

If I don't reach my target of $750, then every penny raised will be used to bring the fans to market in another way.

The Impact

By supporting this campaign, you can say goodbye to the old school, uncool hand fans and say hello to feisty hand fans that look cool whilst keeping you cool. Not only will Fan Fatale alleviate ‘power surges’, it will help us take ownership of our hot bods and embrace all that we are (hot flushes and all), without shame or embarrassment. Just because we're on fire, doesn't mean the menopause should leave us in a hot mess!

As the fans 'go public' and get used in the real world, it brings with them an opportunity to start a conversation ... funny, serious, emotional or practical ... it will get us women and the people around us talking.  I see these conversations as the start of a movement.  A movement to embrace the changes to our body, and how we and society view the menopause. 

Together we can stop feeling the need to suffer in silence.  We can speak up and be seen.  Remember, age is just a number and even though our bodies are changing, it doesn't mean our femininity, our sassiness, and our joie de vivre has to change too.

If you have EVER wanted to be a part of something different, or wanted to support women's issues, then this is the campaign for you.  It may have been 100 years since women (in the UK) received the right to vote, but globally we still have a long way to go to ensure we feel comfortable with what it means to be a woman - whatever life stage we’re at.

Just think how your life and many other women's lives could be changed for the better by buying a Fan Fatale Hand Fan.  Think how many conversations you could start; how many friendships you could make; how many brilliant minds could be brought together to make a real difference. To coin an overused, but prefect phrase ... the possibilities are endless.

Risks & Challenges

I'm going to be honest.  I have NEVER done anything like this before.  I'm excited, hopeful, but I have to admit, I'm nervous as well. 

Think about it.  Me.  A 51 year old peri-menopausal woman who could potentially break out into a cold sweat and end up looking a hot mess in a micro second, who can’t even remember the names of her own children at times ... doing something she's never done before, involving the wonders of technology and Social Media.  I mean. What could possibly go wrong?

But I've done my research and I'm feeling positive.

Some may say I'm mad (harsh but fair); feisty (true); even a rebel without a clue (also true). But I'd say I'm passionate … and someone who really does want to make a difference.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can make a financial contribution or would like to buy a fan, but if anything resonates with you, whether you're a menopausal woman or not, male or female, young or old, please consider making some noise and sharing this campaign via word of mouth or your own social media channels.  It's as simple as using the Indiegogo share tools. So please.  Dig deep (or shout loud and proud) and take a leap of faith with me. because although the menopause may not affect you personally, it will affect someone you love at some point. And I want society to change for them. For YOU. For me. For every woman. For ever.

It’s about challenging outdated thinking, busting the myth that menopausal women are past their prime and helping us to be seen.  And sizzle in all our glory.By supporting this campaign, you will be helping pave the way for women everywhere.What I Need & What You GetI am looking to raise a minimum of $750 so I can place an order of 100 Fan Fatale fans. Each Fan Fatale hand fan is made using 100% eco-friendly black cotton fabric and traditional Japanese folding techniques although it is anything BUT traditional. The words 'HOT STUFF' will adorn each fan in bold white type making them very noticeable. They are not only attention-grabbing, they’re rebelling against the status quo. Donations of $10 will be gratefully received and there are additional perks available depending on the level of contribution.  If you sign up to join my campaign mailing list I can keep you up to date and inform you of the campaign’s progress. Multiples of 1, 2, 3, 5 or 10 fans are available and as the number of fans ordered increases, so the cost of each fan decreases. If I don't reach my target of $750, then every penny raised will be used to bring the fans to market in another way.The ImpactBy supporting this campaign, you can say goodbye to the old school, uncool hand fans and say hello to feisty hand fans that look cool whilst keeping you cool. Not only will Fan Fatale alleviate ‘power surges’, it will help us take ownership of our hot bods and embrace all that we are (hot flushes and all), without shame or embarrassment. Just because we're on fire, doesn't mean the menopause should leave us in a hot mess!As the fans 'go public' and get used in the real world, it brings with them an opportunity to start a conversation ... funny, serious, emotional or practical ... it will get us women and the people around us talking.  I see these conversations as the start of a movement.  A movement to embrace the changes to our body, and how we and society view the menopause. Together we can stop feeling the need to suffer in silence.  We can speak up and be seen.  Remember, age is just a number and even though our bodies are changing, it doesn't mean our femininity, our sassiness, and our joie de vivre has to change too.If you have EVER wanted to be a part of something different, or wanted to support women's issues, then this is the campaign for you.  It may have been 100 years since women (in the UK) received the right to vote, but globally we still have a long way to go to ensure we feel comfortable with what it means to be a woman - whatever life stage we’re at.Just think how your life and many other women's lives could be changed for the better by buying a Fan Fatale Hand Fan.  Think how many conversations you could start; how many friendships you could make; how many brilliant minds could be brought together to make a real difference. To coin an overused, but prefect phrase ... the possibilities are endless.Risks & ChallengesI'm going to be honest.  I have NEVER done anything like this before.  I'm excited, hopeful, but I have to admit, I'm nervous as well. Think about it.  Me.  A 51 year old peri-menopausal woman who could potentially break out into a cold sweat and end up looking a hot mess in a micro second, who can’t even remember the names of her own children at times ... doing something she's never done before, involving the wonders of technology and Social Media.  I mean. What could possibly go wrong?But I've done my research and I'm feeling positive.Some may say I'm mad (harsh but fair); feisty (true); even a rebel without a clue (also true). But I'd say I'm passionate … and someone who really does want to make a difference.Other Ways You Can HelpI know not everyone can make a financial contribution or would like to buy a fan, but if anything resonates with you, whether you're a menopausal woman or not, male or female, young or old, please consider making some noise and sharing this campaign via word of mouth or your own social media channels.  It's as simple as using the Indiegogo share tools. So please.  Dig deep (or shout loud and proud) and take a leap of faith with me. because although the menopause may not affect you personally, it will affect someone you love at some point. And I want society to change for them. For YOU. For me. For every woman. For ever.

story:
What works for 3b hair might not work for 4c hair.

Like our diaspora, afro-textured hair comes in a variety of curl patterns that each require a harmonious blend of products + care regimen in order to keep the hair healthy and thriving. Due to a major shift in the demand for afro-textured hair products and no real research & development done by standing hair care brands, each person is left to discover what works best through experimentation. This can be, not only, expensive but extremely discouraging.

 

Let’s solve this problem!

Grow.black will be the first online platform built for the natural hair community bringing the buyers, sellers, and students of the journey all into one App-mosphere. Each member will discover their hair texture and other properties to create their personal hair profile. The hair profile allows each member to find the right mix of natural hair products in our marketplace along with the right content in their personal content feed. The more community shared knowledge, the better the product and content recommendations curated for each profile.

Accepting & Exploring Self.

By creating a platform powered by the collective knowledge of the natural hair community, we can ensure that the global African family is able to explore and introduce their true self to the world.

 

Why do we need funding?

The symbolic reason is to build a platform funded by the community it’s meant to serve + the allies that believe we all should be capable of expressing our true selves.


The €60,000 will enable a fully functioning Progressive Web Application (mobile friendly website). There will be curated content (videos and blogs rated by community members) based on your hair profile PLUS a marketplace for the sale +  purchase of such items like natural hair care products and 100% human hair loc [dreadlock] extensions! The first of its kind! Good news to anyone from the client to the hair stylist. 

STRETCH GOAL €150,000 (*fingers and toes crossed *)

If we can beat the €60,000 goal by large margins to meet the stretch goal, the Android and iOS compatible apps can be developed to download in your App Store! No pressure.

No matter what amount, we’d greatly appreciate each and every contribution to help us get to work.  

 

Tune in!

Take a listen to Episode 1: Why GROW.BLACK? on our podcast The Sh!t They Don’t Tell You. Begin with the Grow.Black Series Edition and stay to soak up the conversations pertaining to the non-traditional approach to life coaching. We talk new age adulting— what “they” don’t tell you.

 

Sign up and Join the Tribe!

Go to our website to Join the Tribe and share the cause with your friends.

 

About the Co-Founders.

Qianna Pijeaux (@frickfrackandfran)
Received a degree in Neuroscience and continuously enriches her understanding of human behavior and the developmental effects of cultural influences. 

Andre Pijeaux (LinkedIn profile)
A professional Growth Strategist and Marketing Technologist with experience working with Fortune 500 companies and SMBs (Small and Medium Businesses), respectively.

Sources

1. Could African-American beauty products pose health risks?

2. Hair relaxer use and risk of uterine leiomyomata in African-American women.

3. Natural Hair Discrimination
Chased From School For Having Dreadlocks| Tuko TV
Court rules that firing people for having dreadlocks is legal
The History of Braids & Bans on Black Hair | MANE | NowThis

4. Black Is Beautiful, But Hair Is Still Political

story:
Short Summary

Centre Fanovozantsoa is a privately funded orphanage in Mahajanga, Madagascar, which provides a safe, nurturing place for street kids. Currently housing 21 children, due to space limitations, some of the boys are sleeping two to a bed. The Centre needs major upgrades to the plumbing and electrical, the refrigerator repaired, and lots of storage built for the kitchen. 

What We Need 

$2,000 will allow us to:

  • Install a new toilet (there is only one toilet for the whole facility)
  • Upgrade the one shower, and build needed storage in the bathroom for towels, toothbrushes, and toiletries
  • Repair the storage cubbies where the children store their clothes and personal items
  • Buy much needed kitchenware (flatware, dishes, cups, one huge aluminum pot, two huge stainless steel bowls for meal preparation, build pantry shelves and stock the pantry, replace the kitchen’s single sink with a double sink, and sooooo much more.

The Impact

Madagascar is one of the planet’s poorest nations, so things were already bad for many families, but with the borders having been closed for over a year due to Covid, many families have become overwhelmed, have lost their homes, and their children have become vulnerable. The Centre provides a safe, loving home for kids who had been living on the street, and their major emphasis is education. When a child achieves their Baccalaureate (high school diploma) and want to go to college, the Centre rents them an apartment while they are in University. 
 

in a word, they are changing lives in ways we cannot imagine.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word, share this video with your friends and family. Kind words and thoughts are always appreciated.
