story:
DeColonaise was founded by members of the African  National Women's Organization who desired to create all natural products that were beneficial for our hair, bodies and minds. It was important for us to create a brand that promotes images of  beautiful African People in all our diverse forms. Decolonaise is "A Revolution for your Hair and Body" because along with providing all natural organic products we seek to educate and empower colonized people by combating colonialism and its effects on African People globally.

DeColonaise is an economic development project that will help fund the work of the African National Women’s Organization (ANWO). ANWO was founded in 2015, by the African People’s Socialist Party, to  address the special oppression African Women face everyday. ANWO is dedicated to supporting and inspiring African women and to be leaders in the struggle against colonialism. To support us by purchasing DeColonaise please visit http://decolonaise.bigcartel.com/

Shea butter is a main ingredient in DeColonaise products, but we also include many other natural ingredients. Check out some of the ingredients below.

 

.

  DeColonaise is produced with all natural organic ingredients and is made in small batches to ensure the highest quality. We are raising $10,000 USD which will go toward  the following items :

  • Our own website
  • A years worth of raw materials and packaging 
  • High-quality Labels
  • New product  development 
  • Building inventory
  • Storage space
  • Marketing material
  • Commercial production and production equipment.

By donating to DeColonaise today you will be supporting an important economic development project of ANWO. As an organization we will use the funds to create much needed support systems for African women and communities.

 

 

 

  • Promoting images of diverse African beauty which are not often reflected in other mainstream beauty brands.
  • Combating anti-African beauty practices, capitalist exploitation, environmental anomalies  that contribute to how we view ourselves and how we treat beauty issues.
  • Producing natural products that destroy free-radicals, and eliminate toxins which come as a result of capitalist exploitation.

story:
The OHM Center

The OHM Center is a meditation, wellness and spirituality teaching center that will be located on the Upper East Side of Manhattan (First Avenue between 62nd and 63rd).  OHM will offer classes designed to support you in taking care of and evolving your physical, emotional and spiritual well-being.  We already have a signed lease, we just need help with renovation costs - soundproofing adds up!

Founder: OHM is founded by Suzanne M. Hill, who has been an acupuncturist and meditation teacher for 20 years.  Currently Suzanne is leading weekly classes and workshops in NYC and upstate New York, and is planning to bring the NYC classes to OHM.  Her students are waiting with eager anticipation for the opening!

Objective:  OHM is like a gym for physical, emotional and spiritual well-being. Classes offered at OHM will range from those that focus on personal health and wellness  (such as meditation, breath-work, vocal coaching, nutrition/healing, and wisdom training to name a few), to those that focus on children and families (such as self-esteem, emotional intelligence, and parenting classes). OHM wants to help you learn and grow as a person so you can feel happier in your life.

Name: Picking the name OHM focuses on cultivating an Open Heart and Mind through attendance of offered classes and workshops.

 

The Impact

As technology increases and the pace of the world moves faster and faster, people are experiencing more overwhelm and are questioning why they live like they do. 

The OHM Center will be a place to come to meditate, relax, clear your mind and help you physically feel better.  Additionally, the classes offered will help you understand your life, your psyche, and you will learn how to move through the world in a way that creates peace and harmony for yourself and for others.  What's the point of life if you don't feel good in the living of it?

OHM would like to help you learn how to cultivate your spiritual practice in a consistent manner, offering an environment free of the requirement to belong to a particular religious denomination.  

Not to mention you will be able to take classes here!!  As soon as we can, we will offer online classes, so if you live in another state or country, you will be able to participate virtually.  

 

Mission Statement

The OHM Center is committed to creating a safe, warm and inviting space where people can take care of themselves physically, emotionally, intellectually and spiritually.

 

Statement from Suzanne

From an early age, I've found the realms of healing and spirituality inherently fascinating, and so I worked hard to become an acupuncturist and meditation teacher. By nature, I am a giver and I like to give.  I give by healing, I give by teaching, and I give by helping people in whatever way I can.  

The OHM Center is a vehicle for me to give to a greater number of people, not only by expanding my teachings and bringing them to a wider audience, but also by bringing in other masters to teach.  I am privileged to have worked with some of the best healers and teachers across the country, and I am excited to invite them to join me to lecture and lead workshops at OHM.

If you want to know who you're contributing to, listen to my radio show, The Healing Power Hour, on VoiceAmerica: https://www.voiceamerica.com/show/2161/the-healing-power-hour

With that said, thank you in advance...by contributing to this campaign, please know that you are helping to create something truly magnificent in NYC.  

 

What We Need & What You Get

OHM is looking to raise $108,000 to renovate the 1250 sq ft space we have leased for the center.  We need HVAC, electrical, signage and soundproofing.

We have already put in $100,000 toward this project to secure the location, architect and permit fees, trademarks, website, and marketing.

We are offering a variety of services for you to try as a thank you for your contribution. Look through the perks to the right of this page and see what we are offering!

 

Risks & Challenges

There isn't much risk to this project.  Our lease is already signed and construction will start in March 2019.

The challenge will be let people know about the OHM Center. Suzanne already teaches meditation classes on a weekly basis that she will bring over to OHM once it opens.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute now, no worries, but please ask others if they can contribute....you can invite them to join OHM and support this campaign!

story:
About From Fear To Courage. 

From Fear To Courage is a documentary on the life of Simon Lee, a 30 year veteran as a mentor, healer and coach. It portrays how he went from feeling lost and broken as a child, to uncovering courage within himself and later encouraged and taught the same to countless men and boys in need of help, direction and purpose. He has dealt with extreme cases of serious addictions, graphic self harming and overcoming attempted suicides. He also helps issues such as restoring connections within families. He is highly experienced in applied practical philosophy, physical movement and nutrition. These three elements combined overcome depression, anxiety and stress. He has delivered a key note speech for a high profile mental health charity, presented to blue chip companies, conducts group and 121 coaching and is writing his book, on the subject of this film, to be published after the film release. 

The story follows Simons' difficult childhood and how being an observer to the abuse of his sister sent him into a spiral of self hatred, hopelessness and anxiety. It continues through to how he healed himself and formed a unique approach to healing the minds of others. 

This documentary will be controversial, powerful, thought provoking and heart wrenching. It is a study of a society that is becoming devoid of fathers and positive male role models and how this is resulting in all sexes and elements of society losing out. 

It is set to become one of the most powerful depictions of childhood stress and how this often defines our life as adults.

Why is this film being made now?

We feel this documentary is vital that it is seen and an absolute necessity in its timing. Mental health issues in adults and children have become an epidemic. Male suicide rates in particular are having a huge impact on families across America and the UK and having a catastrophic effect on society. We have normalised disconnection and it’s killing people. No one knows what to do and the approaches to this worrying issue are not working. The conversation needs to change. Responsibility needs to be taken by elements of society that are making the situation worse. The time has come to highlight an issue that many are too afraid to acknowledge. 

Our contributors can help us spread a message so powerful that it can literally change entire societies. Ultimately it’s a message of unconditional love and how uncovering this in ourselves can heal everyone around us. 
 

The Director 

Julian Grant is a British writer and director, actor and producer. Starting out late in life as an actor, he found his passion was behind the camera rather than in front of it. The idea of having other actors act out his quirky screen-plays seemed appealing to him. He was once quoted as saying." To Ponder over what could be is a sin, but to create something from thin air is a gift, so why not share it with others.” 
Julian has a particular interest in this project due to his own struggles as a child. 
 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Although we have people giving their time and work for free and the project will be partly self funded, we would like to raise £19,600. 
 

The funding will be used for: 

Travel and logistics                                                 £2,000

DP and Audio 4 k Camera                                    £5,600

Craft services                                                           £400

Post production:

Editor                                                                         £2,800 

Audio design                                                           £1,800

5% Transaction charges                                     £1,000

5% Escrow refund account                               £1,000

The additional £5,000 is to get this documentary premiered in LA and London and the entry into film festivals under the guidance of Julian Grant, so this message can reach as many people as possible. 

 

Your Perks! 
 

We have 6 levels of perks that we hope will offer our contributors a real sense of connection and belonging to this project and the vitally important message it contains. 


Other Ways You Can Help 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please spread the word out and share this project on social media. We appreciate all the help we can get! 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!
story_txt:
About From Fear To Courage. 
From Fear To Courage is a documentary on the life of Simon Lee, a 30 year veteran as a mentor, healer and coach. It portrays how he went from feeling lost and broken as a child, to uncovering courage within himself and later encouraged and taught the same to countless men and boys in need of help, direction and purpose. He has dealt with extreme cases of serious addictions, graphic self harming and overcoming attempted suicides. He also helps issues such as restoring connections within families. He is highly experienced in applied practical philosophy, physical movement and nutrition. These three elements combined overcome depression, anxiety and stress. He has delivered a key note speech for a high profile mental health charity, presented to blue chip companies, conducts group and 121 coaching and is writing his book, on the subject of this film, to be published after the film release. 

The story follows Simons' difficult childhood and how being an observer to the abuse of his sister sent him into a spiral of self hatred, hopelessness and anxiety. It continues through to how he healed himself and formed a unique approach to healing the minds of others. 
This documentary will be controversial, powerful, thought provoking and heart wrenching. It is a study of a society that is becoming devoid of fathers and positive male role models and how this is resulting in all sexes and elements of society losing out. 
It is set to become one of the most powerful depictions of childhood stress and how this often defines our life as adults.
Why is this film being made now?
We feel this documentary is vital that it is seen and an absolute necessity in its timing. Mental health issues in adults and children have become an epidemic. Male suicide rates in particular are having a huge impact on families across America and the UK and having a catastrophic effect on society. We have normalised disconnection and it’s killing people. No one knows what to do and the approaches to this worrying issue are not working. The conversation needs to change. Responsibility needs to be taken by elements of society that are making the situation worse. The time has come to highlight an issue that many are too afraid to acknowledge. 
Our contributors can help us spread a message so powerful that it can literally change entire societies. Ultimately it’s a message of unconditional love and how uncovering this in ourselves can heal everyone around us.  
The Director 
Julian Grant is a British writer and director, actor and producer. Starting out late in life as an actor, he found his passion was behind the camera rather than in front of it. The idea of having other actors act out his quirky screen-plays seemed appealing to him. He was once quoted as saying." To Ponder over what could be is a sin, but to create something from thin air is a gift, so why not share it with others.” Julian has a particular interest in this project due to his own struggles as a child.  

 
 

What We Need & What You Get
Although we have people giving their time and work for free and the project will be partly self funded, we would like to raise £19,600.  
The funding will be used for: 
Travel and logistics                                                 £2,000
DP and Audio 4 k Camera                                    £5,600
Craft services                                                           £400
Post production:
Editor                                                                         £2,800 
Audio design                                                           £1,800
5% Transaction charges                                     £1,000
5% Escrow refund account                               £1,000
The additional £5,000 is to get this documentary premiered in LA and London and the entry into film festivals under the guidance of Julian Grant, so this message can reach as many people as possible. 
 

Your Perks!  
We have 6 levels of perks that we hope will offer our contributors a real sense of connection and belonging to this project and the vitally important message it contains. 

Other Ways You Can Help 
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Please spread the word out and share this project on social media. We appreciate all the help we can get! 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!

story:
Overview

Welcome to the Furry Friends for Senior Citizens campaign! We are a group of students from the University of Tennessee and we teamed up with the Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation (ACARF) to raise money for For the Love of Pets Food Pantry. Based at the Senior Center in Clinton, Tennessee, this is a program that is raising money to provide low income seniors with pet food, supplies, and preventatives. Some senior citizens sacrifice their own needs to keep their pets while others are faced with giving up their pets because they are unable to provide for them. Because of this their beloved pet ends up at the shelter. This needs-based program helps keep people and their companion animals together. Therefore, we need YOUR help to help raise funds and generate campaign success! We greatly appreciate your contributions in changing the lives of many seniors and their pets!

The Goal

Over the next couple of months, we are attempting to raise $1,200 to support seniors who are unable to provide care for their pets. These funds will go directly to ACARF, specifically towards the For the Love of Pets Food Pantry program. This amount will insure that these pets have long and fulfilling lives, despite their owners’ financial struggles. With your help, we can reach our goal and create lifelong memories for both owners and pets.

About ACARF

ACARF is a registered non-profit animal rescue organization located in Anderson County TN. ACARF’s mission statement is, “Anderson County Animal Rescue Foundation will aspire to promote humane treatment of animals in Anderson County. We will Advocate responsible companion animal ownership through educational programs, and strive to increase public awareness of the need and value of community involvement and responsibility for public and animal welfare. We will provide a safe environment for unwanted, stray, abused or abandoned animals, with the goal of finding loving ‘forever’: homes for homeless animals”. They function solely with the help of dedicated animal loving volunteers. They believe that our companion animals for life, and just as no person should go hungry or homeless, neither should their pets go hungry or given up due to lack of food. For the Love of Pets Food Pantry is sustained solely by donations, and all donations go directly to seniors and their pets.

Why Should You Care?

For many senior citizens, a dog or cat is more than a pet. They are family members that provide companionship. Studies have shown that pets lower illness levels and mortality rates. Unfortunately, caring for a pet can be difficult when living on a fixed income at or under the poverty level. On average it takes roughly $1,500 annually to care for a pet’s basic food and medical expenses, completely ignoring any other miscellaneous costs that will come up. Approximately 6.5 million companion animals enter U.S. animal shelters nationwide every year because their owners were unable to financially support them. In addition, each year, approximately 1.5 million shelter animals are euthanized (670,000 dogs and 860,000 cats). The number of dogs and cats euthanized in U.S. shelters annually has declined from approximately 2.6 million in 2011. If owners had funds to care for their pets’ health needs, these numbers would drastically decrease. This campaign can go a long way in helping people and pets in need. Also, there are many perks available for varying levels of giving.

Impact

The Furry Friends for Senior Citizens and ACARF provides life changing support people and pets in need, offering them a chance to improve their situations. If you want to make a change in the Anderson County community, please consider donating to our campaign. Please spread the word about this campaign to your family and friends by sharing on all media platforms! With donors, supporters, and volunteers like you, we can make a difference! Also be sure to check out our blog that provides updates throughout the campaign: 

https://furryfriendforseniorcitizens.wordpress.com

Sources

https://www.acanimalrescuefoundation.org

http://www.anderson-county.com/anderson-county-...

https://www.aspca.org/animal-homelessness/shelt...

story:
Introduction/Biography

Hi everyone,

For those who don't know me, my name is Laith (they/she pronouns and formerly known as Ben/Benji). I'm currently a resident artist with an Atlanta- based dance company and an Emory alumna planning to apply for law school within the next few years. Recently I came out as transgender and since then, I've been actively taking steps towards affirming my gender. As a queer person of color from the rural south, the path I've taken to arrive at this understanding of myself has been long, complex, and filled with a lot of fear and anxiety; yet, I feel a huge sense of relief now as I come to know myself on this deeper level. I've been doing Hormone Replacement Therapy (HRT) for a little over 4 months now and I can happily say I've seen noticeable differences in my body. This along with other gender affirming care and acts of self expression have brought me a new found sense of gender euphoria, which has translated to a huge improvement in my overall wellbeing. However as I continue HRT, I am coming to terms with some things that cause me dysphoria, which will take more work to alter. For this reason, I have decided that I'll be seeking to go through 3 major gender affirming procedures/processes. The first and foremost being a permanent hair removal process known as Electrolysis. Being able to permanently remove my hair through this process would vastly improve my mental health and skin in the long run. 

 

What I Need

Electrolysis and the Cost:

  • Facial and body hair have been a huge source of dysphoria for me since puberty. Unfortunately to combat this, I typically have to shave every day or every other day. Shaving this often often results in razor burn and ingrown hairs which can be both frustrating and painful to deal with on a regular basis. The good news is that there is a hair removal technique know as electrolysis that will permanently remove my facial and neck hair after a series of treatments which will occur every 2 weeks for a time period period ranging from 12- 16 months. If you're interested in learning more about the specifics of this process, you can check out the link I provided in the above paragraph.
  • Unfortunately, electrolysis is a very expensive procedure. After multiple consultations with both laser hair removal and electrolysis specialist, I've received a estimated quote as to how much this procedure will cost me in total; however, how many sessions and how long they take cannot be determined until I'm further along in the process. The typical rate for electrolysis is $75-$100 per hour and during the beginning of my treatment I will have to undergo session lasting somewhere between 4- 6 hours. However, as I continue the the time the treatments take will significantly decrease until each session only last any hour. At this rate, for a year of treatment I'm looking at a projected cost of roughly $6000- $8000.
  • Obviously, this is a huge expense for a working artist to cover on their own. Which is why I'm asking for support. In order to help pay for my transition-related expenses, I've recently applied for a few grants and picked up a 3rd job at a restaurant. While this will be very helpful, I'm still asking for assistance. The plan is to raise at the very least half of this cost within the next 6 weeks, so that I can begin treatments. In the meanwhile, I will be working very hard to match that $4000 with my own funds. Keep in mind that this is only 1 of 3 major and costly procedures that I plan to undergo within the next two years; and so, I will need be continue working these 3 jobs while preparing for law school admissions simultaneously (aka grinding). 

 

The Impact

  • Receiving financial support and assistance for this procedure will undoubtedly remove a huge financial strain from my shoulders, while provide me the opportunity to start saving for future transition-related procedures and law school admissions (also a very expensive process as some of you might know).
  • Considering all of the physical, mental, and emotional energy that's involved in transitioning I have made the decision to postpone attending law school until I feel that I'm where I want to be in this process. While not putting an exact timeline or rushing any way, I would like to acknowledge that the sooner this happens, the sooner I can move forward pursuing my future career.
  • Contributing to this fundraiser would effectively support a working black transgender artist. When artist have the support they need to live a healthy and sustainable life, then they can do the thing they do - create their art. 

 

What if You Can't Donate?

Some people just can't contribute and I totally get that, but what you still can do is:

  • Share this fundraiser with friends, family, coworker, or people who might be looking to support.
  • Use any of your social platforms to continually boost this fundraiser and help it gain as much traction as possible.

 

Thanks in advance

I just wanted to take a moment here to acknowledge the continued support I have received throughout the years from all of the different communities and spaces I've occupied. Whether it be my folks from back home, my close friends, my colleagues from my undergraduate career, or the dance and artists community- I am extremely grateful. I appreciate each and everyone one of you and your support, regardless of how big or small truly means a lot to me. Thank you all.

  • If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to me via email at laithstevenson@gmail.com.

While not putting an exact timeline or rushing any way, I would like to acknowledge that the sooner this happens, the sooner I can move forward pursuing my future career.
Contributing to this fundraiser would effectively support a working black transgender artist. When artist have the support they need to live a healthy and sustainable life, then they can do the thing they do - create their art. 

 

What if You Can't Donate?
Some people just can't contribute and I totally get that, but what you still can do is:

Share this fundraiser with friends, family, coworker, or people who might be looking to support.
Use any of your social platforms to continually boost this fundraiser and help it gain as much traction as possible.

 
Thanks in advance
I just wanted to take a moment here to acknowledge the continued support I have received throughout the years from all of the different communities and spaces I've occupied. Whether it be my folks from back home, my close friends, my colleagues from my undergraduate career, or the dance and artists community- I am extremely grateful. I appreciate each and everyone one of you and your support, regardless of how big or small truly means a lot to me. Thank you all.
If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to me via email at laithstevenson@gmail.com.

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm Francesca Murray, founder of B.I.A.B.B.L. ( Brothers In Arms Building Better Lives) FREE program for men at: http://brothersinarmsbbl.com, And I am raising funds for an amazing cause for men to whom I am hoping to offer FREE program that would give them tools to change their lives.

  • We provide men with a space to come in and heal without judgment and labels to learn the art of being the best version of themselves. 

What We Need & What You Get?

  • We are seeking to raise: $23,980.00 for 7 full days.  Here is what you get:  

    The workshops are free so that every man has an opportunity. Funds raised will help cover the costs of running our programs which includes: Venue + equipment rentals, Videographer, printouts/materials, facilitators time, food/refreshments, advertisement. It is currently in its pilot phase because our market research shows that there are no other projects of its kind in Canada, therefore requiring thorough baseline assessments.  

    Our costs is for 7 full days, and 11 facilitators, some of whom facilitate for full days, and or multiple days, based on their content. 

  • Our programs, approach, and mission, gives us the opportunity to work with an audience (men), that has little to no support available in this capacity. Our plans also ensure that kids aren’t father deprived as a result of parents not working together, and can help restore relations that might have suffered. 

    LETS LOOK AT SOME DATA:

TRAUMA: Here is how it Impacts Men:  ANY amount of trauma experienced during upbringing, includes rape, molestation, physical abuse, psychological abuse combined with conditioning from limiting beliefs can impact one's ability to thrive.  The masculine energy has been conditioned to function substantially differently from the feminine, as a result, not having the appropriate support and resources can drastically impact a man's ability to thrive.

Here are some stats: Source: Statistics Canada

In Canada, in 2011, there were 3728 suicides. 2781 of these suicides were male (Statistics Canada, 2014).

Men aged 40-60 have the highest number of suicides (Statistics Canada, 2014).

Men die by suicide three times more often than women (Statistics Canada, 2014).

In Canada, men die most often by hanging. In the United States, men die most often by firearms.

Men die by suicide more than any other group and these realities must be addressed!

Instead of talking about stress or trying to seek help for their depression, men will often mask their stress and deal with their depression through harmful behaviors and actions. (Ogrodnickzuk, 2011). 

Signs of underlying Trauma:

Depression (often manifest through irritability, suicide, anger, hostility)

Risk-taking behaviors (violence, addiction)

Avoidance behaviors, Homelessness

90% of male prison inmates grew up in single mother families.

We ALL have underlying TRAUMA. Our program design addresses the underlying gap/root causes.  Its designed to END the era of BLAME CULTURE, and begin a new one that is built on: compassion, understanding, empathy, forgiveness and unity.

SOME RECENT DATA FROM ADDICTION RECOVERY CONFERENCE:

64.4% OF MEN STRUGGLE WITH ADDICTION

Ages 25-54 years old - 75.6%

Broken down BY ETHNICITY:

Ethnicity (where "n" equals there was no ethnicity declared) = 26

Caucasian - 46%, Indigenous - 31%, Involuntary - 100%,

Two or more medical co-morbidities = 46.6%

Schizophrenia spectrum, psychotic, and substance use disorders were only some of the mental health impact captured as a result of addiction: 

Nicotine use disorder -71 %, Stimulant use disorder - 66.7% and Opioid use disorder - 51.1 %

NOTE: There was no measurement to indicate: the number of men whom have turned to Fentanyl use as a measure to "off-set" some of the effects/symptoms of other opioid use for example: to stay awake. 

The above stats were taken from the Stats Canada report and a recent recovery conference I attended through hospital.

THE REASON FOR SHARING THESE STATS: So that everyone can see clearly the IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS TO OUR PROGRAM. And this is just a drop in the bucket when it comes to the magnitude of impact that a program such as ours can create.  What makes our program different from what's out there?  There is NOTHING available in this capacity to serve men.  Our methods combine science and spirituality to form a foundation that would support and address root cases of underlying Trauma. A proactive approach to healing.  

This is how it’s impacting you – 8 out of 10 people suffer from the silent epidemic of mental health crisis, if you are not one of them, I guarantee its someone you know: child, spouse, colleague, neighbor, think about how its impacting their productivity and imprint on life.

  • That's what B.I.A. FREE program is all about. This is the force behind my creating this company. Our program gives men hope and opportunity by offering them a wide range of tools and resources towards peace and love in their lives.  And, I have the right team to do it; and we have a proven track record of bringing innovative solutions and content to market. Because men, they ARE humans too, and weren't born this way, as the cultural,  gender-stereo-type, nerves of steel (unable to feel emotions).  Our program is the beginning to bridge a system wide gap .

QUALIFIED PROFESSIONALS:

  • Dirk Terpstra - is a HeartMath® Certified Trainer, Intuitive Speaker & Coach and former CEO with a Fortune 500 company. Dirk currently works with Veterans and First Responders in the Okanagan.
  • Kieron Sweeney - International Speaker, Business Coach, and Digital Entrepreneur. He is also the creator of a digital magazine in partnership with Shark Tank.  Kieron teaches and leads from the heart.  He believes the ego-centric mind has to be tempered so that men and women can step fully into their hearts and become true leaders, positively impacting their communities and the world.
  • John Solano - Family Counselor in addictions, trauma and employment to life skills, In 1993 John began pioneering work in the development of a trauma-informed theory and curriculum known as the Empowerment Philosophy and Integrity Approach.
  • Jane Courtney - RN/BSN, SEP, Somatic Trauma Therapist. Jane’s health career in the US and Canada, has spanned decades in a variety of clinical and mental health settings. She implements body based, evidence informed practices that address the root cause of stress and trauma.  
  • Jivi Saran - Soul Script Coach who ignites your soul script through blending ancient wisdom techniques with modern day lifestyles. Her coaching sessions help you gain freedom and liberation from the pseudo costume we often wear for society.
  • Jenna Card - Communication Specialist / Mediator, Leverage her years of Business Analyst experience and  teach teams how to be both collaborative and relational as well as highly efficient.  In personal relationships, She show individuals ways to create the emotional safety needed to be open-hearted, honest, and truly loving.
  • Larry Li - CBT and Spirituality Coach with formal education includes kinesiology, anatomy, psychology, philosophy, nutrition, autism specialization, and mindfulness training. Larry studied at The University of Victoria, Douglas College, The Institute of Holistic Nutrition, and The Ayurvedic Institute. 
  • Francesca Murray -  Founder, Speaker, and Intuitive Energy Guide Coach, I'm also a single mom with a mission to end the silent epidemic of issues relating to mental health that often results in the dis-empowerment of our ability to thrive.  One of my goals is to ensure that parents are equipped with the appropriate resources to work in the best interest of their children.  And kids aren't father deprived.
  • Relationship Coach - Interviews begin June 11th, 2018
  • Financial Coach/The next step after the program: Bringing your "purpose" to life - Interviews currently in progress.

MAGNITUDE OF WHAT YOU WILL HELP US ACHIEVE?

Our highly interactive, educational model helps to raise participants mental awareness, while providing them with the tools and resources that they need to be the best version of themselves, giving them the opportunity to prosper and thrive. 

OUR MISSION

  • Our mission is to end the silent epidemic of issues relating to mental health, that often results in decisions that dis-empowers their ability to thrive.
  • Our program connects men to the essence of who they truly are, by fostering deeper connection to self from the heart. 
  • Our program helps men  identify their stress levels and where they might need healing.
  • Our experiential model is designed to take men through a series of programs that stimulates connectivity in a way that many haven never felt before, giving them hope and opportunity for peace and love in their lives too.
  • Our program is a highly interactive, educational, component designed to raise mental awareness, while learning resilience building strategies, with emphasis on coping.
  • Through awareness, participants will learn skills on how to effectively manage and reduce symptoms  of : PTSD ( depression, anxiety, stress, anger ratio etc), improve performance, and restore family and social relations that might have suffered.​​
  • Our content unpacks what being a man of integrity is all about using our proprietary parental model solution. It also provides them with the necessary tools to participate in harmonious parenting plans. Harmonious parenting plans,  means the possibility of equal parenting opportunity for men. 

Our content provides men with  tools to:

  • Foster improved, family and social relations.
  • Foster maintenance of a healthy lifestyle,
  • Living a stress free life. 
  • Cultivate the divine expression of the masculine energy.
  • Looking at a whole new world of possibilities - a bright future.

To learn more, please go to our website at: http://brothersinarmsbbl.com where you'll find feedback written by the men from our 4 day pilot launched in April 2017. 

1 Week ago, this was written by one of the men who attended our launch: The impact on the men in the program will be a sense of calm and connectivity to life as it is in the moment. A sense of empowerment and ease with their challenges. Each facilitator will show a way to access this ease or state of balance. Through sharing their modality which draws out and openness and facilitate a creativity that inspires the person to see their lives newly, and embrace it from a beginner's mind.

Each facilitator brings in various ways to find balance in the various aspects of modern living like finances, parenting, artistic honoring our own hero inside by choosing within the activities. For example: of choosing which cards relate to the person's unique personality and what they're interested in. Therefore feelings were facilitated and  expressed through what the card represents for them.

You can read additional participant feedback on our website at: http://brothersinarmsbbl.com

FACTORS THAT OFFSET SOME OF OUR COSTS:

  • Facilitators normally charge more for their time which is worth well over what they're currently charging, however; they are donating a generous portion of their time to support the growth of our vision in an effort to give it the traction that it deserves.   ​

Where will the funds go if we don't reach our entire goal?

In the event our fundraising goals aren't met, all monies will be deposited to a bank account held by the company until we've reached our goal towards the next program offering.  

Why is our project valuable to the contributor and to the world?

B.I.A.  free program is designed to create a paradigm shift that will shift the way humanity experience each other, and healing. 

It is a first of its kind bridging a system wide gap that is limiting in its capacity to serve men. 

Our world has always been filled with great men, and you are one of them, and can help  another, whether its your child, colleague, parent, or neighbour, someone you know is suffering, and you can help give them that opportunity to have the knowledge/know how, for peace and love in their lives.

Our men's suicide rate is up 3 to 1. For ever 75 women, 250 men die by suicide per month, that's 3000 men per year in Canada. This number doesn't include those that are still suffering and living alone with depression, anxiety, loneliness, hurt from loosing their loved ones as a result of not know or having the knowledge to change their situation. This is a crises, and you can help change it by contributing to our campaign to help continue this projects beautiful vision. 

Risks & Challenges if our fundraiser does not meet its goal.

Risks # 1: Lack of funding could result in limiting to no offering of our program. We offer our program to men for FREE. 

Financial - Insufficient funds raised could impact the project. Our venue and equipment needs booking in advance, and all printouts and materials needs to be ready in advance.

This project is also in its pilot phase, being the first or its kind, thorough basework assessments will need to be completed, as a result, we also need to cover the cost of our videographer.

Mitigation:  We're Using Indigogo campaigns to help us raise funds. 

Risk #2 - Our project is the first of its kind in Canada, having nothing to compare it to automatically increases our risk, we are serving a customer base that is least likely to seek help as result of old conditioning from current system with gaps that have not have met their personal needs and their 'core', judgment, labels, etc.

Mitigation: we have come up with a select 'flow' of materials to help address/bridge these system wide gaps, offering a full spectrum of comprehensive materials to help address those gaps. Each of our facilitators are highly trained in their area of expertise. 

Our program is taking a "heart based" approach. Recognizing that men are humans too and weren't born this way, we can help break down those barriers to their healing from a place of unconditional compassion.

You can learn more about our facilitators on our website "About" section at - http://brothersinarmsbbl.com  

We plan to expand our program offering in the upcoming workshop. We're adding 2 additional programs with additional time.  One of the lessons learnt from our launch:  When men begin to open up for the first time, they require more time and space, and we plan to honor that opening in its full capacity. Therefore, we plan to expand our program from 4 to 7 days.

Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just cannot contribute financially at this time, however; it doesn't mean that you cannot help us. You can help support our campaign's initiative by making some noise about it and sharing it as many times as you can by using the Indiegogo share tools as well as Facebook, Twitter, Instagram.  Please share within your networks, with your colleagues,  friends, family, and anyone you think might be interested, or who might be interested in attending one of our programs. Registration do fill up quickly.
story_txt:
Short Summary

I'm Francesca Murray, founder of B.I.A.B.B.L. ( Brothers In Arms Building Better Lives) FREE program for men at: http://brothersinarmsbbl.com, And I am raising funds for an amazing cause for men to whom I am hoping to offer FREE program that would give them tools to change their lives.
We provide men with a space to come in and heal without judgment and labels to learn the art of being the best version of themselves. 

What We Need & What You Get?

We are seeking to raise: $23,980.00 for 7 full days.  Here is what you get:  
The workshops are free so that every man has an opportunity. Funds raised will help cover the costs of running our programs which includes: Venue + equipment rentals, Videographer, printouts/materials, facilitators time, food/refreshments, advertisement. It is currently in its pilot phase because our market research shows that there are no other projects of its kind in Canada, therefore requiring thorough baseline assessments.  
Our costs is for 7 full days, and 11 facilitators, some of whom facilitate for full days, and or multiple days, based on their content. 


Our programs, approach, and mission, gives us the opportunity to work with an audience (men), that has little to no support available in this capacity. Our plans also ensure that kids aren’t father deprived as a result of parents not working together, and can help restore relations that might have suffered. 
LETS LOOK AT SOME DATA:

TRAUMA: Here is how it Impacts Men:  ANY amount of trauma experienced during upbringing, includes rape, molestation, physical abuse, psychological abuse combined with conditioning from limiting beliefs can impact one's ability to thrive.  The masculine energy has been conditioned to function substantially differently from the feminine, as a result, not having the appropriate support and resources can drastically impact a man's ability to thrive.
Here are some stats: Source: Statistics Canada
In Canada, in 2011, there were 3728 suicides. 2781 of these suicides were male (Statistics Canada, 2014).
Men aged 40-60 have the highest number of suicides (Statistics Canada, 2014).
Men die by suicide three times more often than women (Statistics Canada, 2014).
In Canada, men die most often by hanging. In the United States, men die most often by firearms.
Men die by suicide more than any other group and these realities must be addressed!
Instead of talking about stress or trying to seek help for their depression, men will often mask their stress and deal with their depression through harmful behaviors and actions. (Ogrodnickzuk, 2011). 
Signs of underlying Trauma:
Depression (often manifest through irritability, suicide, anger, hostility)
Risk-taking behaviors (violence, addiction)
Avoidance behaviors, Homelessness
90% of male prison inmates grew up in single mother families.
We ALL have underlying TRAUMA. Our program design addresses the underlying gap/root causes.  Its designed to END the era of BLAME CULTURE, and begin a new one that is built on: compassion, understanding, empathy, forgiveness and unity.
SOME RECENT DATA FROM ADDICTION RECOVERY CONFERENCE:
64.4% OF MEN STRUGGLE WITH ADDICTION
Ages 25-54 years old - 75.6%
Broken down BY ETHNICITY:
Ethnicity (where "n" equals there was no ethnicity declared) = 26
Caucasian - 46%, Indigenous - 31%, Involuntary - 100%,
Two or more medical co-morbidities = 46.6%
Schizophrenia spectrum, psychotic, and substance use disorders were only some of the mental health impact captured as a result of addiction: 
Nicotine use disorder -71 %, Stimulant use disorder - 66.7% and Opioid use disorder - 51.1 %
NOTE: There was no measurement to indicate: the number of men whom have turned to Fentanyl use as a measure to "off-set" some of the effects/symptoms of other opioid use for example: to stay awake. 
The above stats were taken from the Stats Canada report and a recent recovery conference I attended through hospital.
THE REASON FOR SHARING THESE STATS: So that everyone can see clearly the IMPACT OF YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS TO OUR PROGRAM. And this is just a drop in the bucket when it comes to the magnitude of impact that a program such as ours can create.  What makes our program different from what's out there?  There is NOTHING available in this capacity to serve men.  Our methods combine science and spirituality to form a foundation that would support and address root cases of underlying Trauma. A proactive approach to healing.  
This is how it’s impacting you – 8 out of 10 people suffer from the silent epidemic of mental health crisis, if you are not one of them, I guarantee its someone you know: child, spouse, colleague, neighbor, think about how its impacting their productivity and imprint on life.
That's what B.I.A. FREE program is all about. This is the force behind my creating this company. Our program gives men hope and opportunity by offering them a wide range of tools and resources towards peace and love in their lives.  And, I have the right team to do it; and we have a proven track record of bringing innovative solutions and content to market. Because men, they ARE humans too, and weren't born this way, as the cultural,  gender-stereo-type, nerves of steel (unable to feel emotions).  Our program is the beginning to bridge a system wide gap .
QUALIFIED PROFESSIONALS:


Dirk Terpstra - is a HeartMath® Certified Trainer, Intuitive Speaker & Coach and former CEO with a Fortune 500 company. Dirk currently works with Veterans and First Responders in the Okanagan.

Kieron Sweeney - International Speaker, Business Coach, and Digital Entrepreneur. He is also the creator of a digital magazine in partnership with Shark Tank.  Kieron teaches and leads from the heart.  He believes the ego-centric mind has to be tempered so that men and women can step fully into their hearts and become true leaders, positively impacting their communities and the world.

John Solano - Family Counselor in addictions, trauma and employment to life skills, In 1993 John began pioneering work in the development of a trauma-informed theory and curriculum known as the Empowerment Philosophy and Integrity Approach.

Jane Courtney - RN/BSN, SEP, Somatic Trauma Therapist. Jane’s health career in the US and Canada, has spanned decades in a variety of clinical and mental health settings. She implements body based, evidence informed practices that address the root cause of stress and trauma.  

Jivi Saran - Soul Script Coach who ignites your soul script through blending ancient wisdom techniques with modern day lifestyles. Her coaching sessions help you gain freedom and liberation from the pseudo costume we often wear for society.

Jenna Card - Communication Specialist / Mediator, Leverage her years of Business Analyst experience and  teach teams how to be both collaborative and relational as well as highly efficient.  In personal relationships, She show individuals ways to create the emotional safety needed to be open-hearted, honest, and truly loving.

Larry Li - CBT and Spirituality Coach with formal education includes kinesiology, anatomy, psychology, philosophy, nutrition, autism specialization, and mindfulness training. Larry studied at The University of Victoria, Douglas College, The Institute of Holistic Nutrition, and The Ayurvedic Institute. 

Francesca Murray -  Founder, Speaker, and Intuitive Energy Guide Coach, I'm also a single mom with a mission to end the silent epidemic of issues relating to mental health that often results in the dis-empowerment of our ability to thrive.  One of my goals is to ensure that parents are equipped with the appropriate resources to work in the best interest of their children.  And kids aren't father deprived.
Relationship Coach - Interviews begin June 11th, 2018
Financial Coach/The next step after the program: Bringing your "purpose" to life - Interviews currently in progress.

MAGNITUDE OF WHAT YOU WILL HELP US ACHIEVE?
Our highly interactive, educational model helps to raise participants mental awareness, while providing them with the tools and resources that they need to be the best version of themselves, giving them the opportunity to prosper and thrive. 
OUR MISSION

Our mission is to end the silent epidemic of issues relating to mental health, that often results in decisions that dis-empowers their ability to thrive.
Our program connects men to the essence of who they truly are, by fostering deeper connection to self from the heart. 
Our program helps men  identify their stress levels and where they might need healing.
Our experiential model is designed to take men through a series of programs that stimulates connectivity in a way that many haven never felt before, giving them hope and opportunity for peace and love in their lives too.
Our program is a highly interactive, educational, component designed to raise mental awareness, while learning resilience building strategies, with emphasis on coping.
Through awareness, participants will learn skills on how to effectively manage and reduce symptoms  of : PTSD ( depression, anxiety, stress, anger ratio etc), improve performance, and restore family and social relations that might have suffered.​​
Our content unpacks what being a man of integrity is all about using our proprietary parental model solution. It also provides them with the necessary tools to participate in harmonious parenting plans. Harmonious parenting plans,  means the possibility of equal parenting opportunity for men. 

Our content provides men with  tools to:

Foster improved, family and social relations.
Foster maintenance of a healthy lifestyle,
Living a stress free life. 
Cultivate the divine expression of the masculine energy.
Looking at a whole new world of possibilities - a bright future.

To learn more, please go to our website at: http://brothersinarmsbbl.com where you'll find feedback written by the men from our 4 day pilot launched in April 2017. 
1 Week ago, this was written by one of the men who attended our launch: The impact on the men in the program will be a sense of calm and connectivity to life as it is in the moment. A sense of empowerment and ease with their challenges. Each facilitator will show a way to access this ease or state of balance. Through sharing their modality which draws out and openness and facilitate a creativity that inspires the person to see their lives newly, and embrace it from a beginner's mind.
Each facilitator brings in various ways to find balance in the various aspects of modern living like finances, parenting, artistic honoring our own hero inside by choosing within the activities. For example: of choosing which cards relate to the person's unique personality and what they're interested in. Therefore feelings were facilitated and  expressed through what the card represents for them.

story:
Who We Are

​Jesse is a Chinese medicine doctor specializing in esoteric acupuncture. Tala is a sound therapist and musician from Iraq. Nacir is a unique Colombian-Iraqi-American mix, and a continuous source of inspiration.Together, with a little help from our friends, we are cultivating Finca La Frecuencia as a place to unplug from the mundane and connect with the wondrous ways of nature. 

We Are Building It, So That You May Come

With sustainability and wellness-for-all in mind, we started building in August of 2017, creating structures of bamboo, cane, earth and wood. Today we have a creekside cafe, a bamboo house-in-the-sky, a hexagon healing hive close to completion and a lotus belle tent with its own outdoor bathroom. Currently we are creating a cacao food food forest like no other in the world.

This campaign is aimed at expanding our hosting possibilities. Our goal is building a movement mediation temple and a private bamboo cabana. With these completed, we will begin hosting high quality intimate retreats in all things consciousness-based (Zhong Xin Dao, Yoga, Permaculture, Meditation, Sound Therapy, Qi Gong, Tai Chi, Natural Building, etc.) 

Vision as a Movement

We are building a place with purpose so that you may come and explore your own path with ever more possibility and clarity. Living in a way that rejuvenates the earth and her creatures is what we will be doing and sharing for years to come. Through listening, honoring, understanding and loving, the technologies of living simply and sustainably are alive and well here at Finca La Frecuencia.

The Sierra Nevada Mountains of Santa Marta, Colombia

Finca La Frecuencia is in the Sierras, a quick one-hour drive from the Santa Marta airport and 3.5 km from the mountain town of Minca, which is a blend of expats from all around the world, local Colombians and the Indigenous Tayrona people who've lived here for countless years.

It truly is a magical place here. The indigenous Kogi who still live strong in these mountains refer to it as 'The Heartbeat of the World.' A point of geo-energetic power and mystique, it is home to a gorgeously diverse array of birds, butterflies and wildlife.

Colombian itself is an incredibly beautiful country and her people are some of the warmest and friendliest in the world. Contrary to popular stigma, it is now relatively safe and considered to be one of the top ten places in the world to live in, invest and retire - and for good reason.

Thank you so much for your interest and supporting our project. We would love  to hear from you or even better see you one day here at Finca La Frecuencia!

Love,

The Finca La Frecuencia Family

story:
Short Summary

  • Co-founders and experienced massage therapists Esther Bell and Tara Krupich have exhausted nearly all their personal funds to establish what BodyQuirks is today and now need community help.
  • This campaign will replenish reserves and cover marketing strategy costs to  grow to the next level.
  • Your contribution will not only impact this individual business, but also help will start a movement to disrupt today's ABLELISM-based fitness industry. BodyQuirks believes that WBV (whole body vibration) technology can make exercise accessible to far more people because it works for all body types as well as for individuals dealing with chronic illness.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise $50,000, triple our membership, and cover future marketing costs. 
  • You get UNIQUE one-time savings on various packages with minimal stipulations.
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the smartest way we can re-invest what we do raise will include funding more demo videos designed for Facebook, Instagram and Twitter. These marketing efforts will be able to reach people who don't already know about us. 

The Impact

How our campaign and business make a difference:

  • Not only will your contribution make our business stronger, but it will also help us disrupt how people view fitness as an ablelism- and ageism-based industry. The technology we use is safe enough to support people with a variety of limitations, as well as people of all generations.
  • Our business has a strong community reputation for empathy-based service. Let us handle the heavy emotional lifting to make your friends and family aware of what's possible with BodyQuirks membership. 
  • Our clients report a variety of consistent results, including minimizing depression, hastening healing, improving balance, minimizing joint pain and back pain, and better management of chronic illnesses such as Lyme disease. 

Risks & Challenges

Here's which kinds of risks and obstacles we currently face:

  • We have struggled to build up and maintain our membership at a sustainable level. We are currently have only one-third the number of members we need for BodyQuirks to thrive.
  • We are currently supporting the business through our massage therapy practice, but this is no longer sustainable as we get older and are less able to do such arduous work.

Other Ways You Can Help

We offer a generous two-tier referral and affiliate program to members:

  • Tier One: Refer a new member to us and you will gets $20 toward  the next monthly membership fee.
  • Tier Two: Refer someone to us who buys a machine from us and you will get a$50 Affiliate Gratitude Bonus
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word to anyone who may be interested in our work. Please note that we have BOTH local and non-local offers!!

story:
I am April Cheri, a plant witch and community builder. I am seeking support for launching the Crystal Springs Apothecary.

I've been harvesting 25+ medicinal & magical plants from an abandoned community garden on the land where I live. This abundant garden resides alongside Crystal Springs Creek, a protected watershed in the midst of Portland, Oregon. I began spending time in the garden and collecting flowers for my own healing, but soon realized the garden is producing more than enough plant medicine to share with my community through tinctures, teas, skin balms, burn bundles, incenses, candle magic, culinary blends, and more. I've collected and processed an abundance of medicine and I have a few simple needs to make medicinal products available to my community at accessible prices. 

The garden and its medicine have returned me to myself. On January 1st of this year I committed to following the song of my soul and this is one of the places it led me. I was an intuitive kitchen witch 20 years ago, providing effective remedies for friends and family. I studied and practiced for a few years before I had to enter the workforce, which somehow repressed that part of my spirit. Now I've been forced out of the workforce by disability (Fibromyalgia and chronic pain) and returning to plant medicine feels like coming home.

I desire to share this goodness and healing with my community. I combine learned knowledge with intuition to create blends that are both medicinal and magical. I strive to work with the plants to support all aspects of our humanity – body, mind, heart, and soul. We are under-nourished in all ways by the dominant culture. Part of my medicine is to support our emotional and spiritual evolution through relationship with our plant friends.

This is a simple one woman project. All aspects of production are done by me with a focus on sharing accessible magic and medicine with my community rather than fancy branding.  

What I Need 

Your support will allow me to purchase few pieces of equipment like more jars (!), a scale and strainer; supplies for producing various forms of plant medicine like candle making items, quality liquor (for tinctures), beeswax (for balms), and oils; as well as containers/packaging, labels, and a small printer so that I don't have to repeatedly travel to a copy shop and post office. 

What You Will Receive 

In return for your generosity you will receive some form of plant medicine from the garden, which may include a burn bundle, magically charged votive candle, incense blend w/charcoal, tea blend, culinary blend, tincture, skin balm, and/or a handmade magical talisman. All products are organic and hand crafted in tiny batches. 

The Impact

This project will impact my community by allowing me to produce large quantities of plant medicine to share.  The medicine this garden is offering is suited to the current cultural climate. Many of the plants are soothing, calming, anti-depressant, and support anxiety and/or trauma.

Personally, this project makes me feel like I am making a contribution again after disability wreaked havoc on my professional identity. Receiving this little boost to purchase supplies will allow me to make medicines for months to come and support the apothecary in becoming a self sustaining project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone who would like to support me can make a contribution. If you believe in what I'm doing please consider sharing my campaign on your favorite social networks for greater visibility. 

Thank you for your time, your consideration, and your support.

I began spending time in the garden and collecting flowers for my own healing, but soon realized the garden is producing more than enough plant medicine to share with my community through tinctures, teas, skin balms, burn bundles, incenses, candle magic, culinary blends, and more. I've collected and processed an abundance of medicine and I have a few simple needs to make medicinal products available to my community at accessible prices. 
The garden and its medicine have returned me to myself. On January 1st of this year I committed to following the song of my soul and this is one of the places it led me. I was an intuitive kitchen witch 20 years ago, providing effective remedies for friends and family. I studied and practiced for a few years before I had to enter the workforce, which somehow repressed that part of my spirit. Now I've been forced out of the workforce by disability (Fibromyalgia and chronic pain) and returning to plant medicine feels like coming home.
I desire to share this goodness and healing with my community. I combine learned knowledge with intuition to create blends that are both medicinal and magical. I strive to work with the plants to support all aspects of our humanity – body, mind, heart, and soul. We are under-nourished in all ways by the dominant culture. Part of my medicine is to support our emotional and spiritual evolution through relationship with our plant friends.
This is a simple one woman project. All aspects of production are done by me with a focus on sharing accessible magic and medicine with my community rather than fancy branding.  

What I Need 
Your support will allow me to purchase few pieces of equipment like more jars (!), a scale and strainer; supplies for producing various forms of plant medicine like candle making items, quality liquor (for tinctures), beeswax (for balms), and oils; as well as containers/packaging, labels, and a small printer so that I don't have to repeatedly travel to a copy shop and post office. 
What You Will Receive 
In return for your generosity you will receive some form of plant medicine from the garden, which may include a burn bundle, magically charged votive candle, incense blend w/charcoal, tea blend, culinary blend, tincture, skin balm, and/or a handmade magical talisman. All products are organic and hand crafted in tiny batches. 

The Impact
This project will impact my community by allowing me to produce large quantities of plant medicine to share.  The medicine this garden is offering is suited to the current cultural climate. Many of the plants are soothing, calming, anti-depressant, and support anxiety and/or trauma.
Personally, this project makes me feel like I am making a contribution again after disability wreaked havoc on my professional identity. Receiving this little boost to purchase supplies will allow me to make medicines for months to come and support the apothecary in becoming a self sustaining project. 

Other Ways You Can Help
I understand that not everyone who would like to support me can make a contribution. If you believe in what I'm doing please consider sharing my campaign on your favorite social networks for greater visibility. 
Thank you for your time, your consideration, and your support.

story:
Short Summary

Team chennaimemes have taken our next initiative Share for farmers following our previous campaign Share for chennai which has raised fund to help the flood affected victims in Chennai.

What We Need & What You Get

We thank everyone who is beinga part of this huge campaign , As we all know the current situation of farmers in tamil nadu and the politics behind the Drought funds.

The main aim of this campaign is to lift maximim number of poor farmlies out of bank debts.

we request you to share the cost of your one meal for our farmers who are suffering from Drought. So far more than 400 farmers have commmited suicide due to Bank loans.

We once again thank each and everyone who is gonna be a part of this campaign and shows support to protect farmers and their cattles.
You could be living in any part of the world but we recommend you to share your one meal with the one who is in need. Hope this turns to be a global campaign which is completely lead by youngsters. We also request you to tag your friends on this campaign and if you could not donate any money its alright at least show your support to our brothers and sisters by sharing this video with your loved ones, We thank every good Samaritan for being a part of this campaign, to know more about our campaign follow our face book pages Shareforfarmers and Chennai Memes.
Thanks in Advance
Kind Regards
Team shareforfarmers 

The Impact

If you can share one ticket for your movie If you can share The cost of your one day Fuel expenses.

If you can share the cost of one day outing. we shall lift many farmers families out of Debt. InTamil nadu we are 7.5 million People if atleast 500,000 People share , we can make a Difference in 5000 farmers Families

Risks & Challenges

We value our transparency : The collected money from the campaign will be audited and recorded with the help of our Auditor and we will provide the details of how many farmers families have been lifted out of Bank Debts.

Other Ways You Can Help

To know more about our campaign follow our face book pages Shareforfarmers and Chennai Memes.
