Most of all we want you to feel good about yourself while using our towels and throws. Comfort is one of our cornerstones, so we design pieces which flatter your body.How We Came Up With The Idea?Since 2018, we have been thinking about ways to replace polyester towels which are widely used in yoga, palates classes and in the gym. Our creator Anna heard many times from people in the classes she attended how unpleasant and irritating using polyester towels are. Such unnatural towels can significantly hinder the pleasantness from the practice. Keeping this in mind, we wanted to create something different – textiles that are practical, versatile, pleasant to touch, naturally breathable and eco-friendly. While discovering the extraordinary qualities of linen, we decided to expand our line to include towels for fitness, bath, face and hands as well as linen throws and beach sheets.From Picnic to Meditation and Everything in BetweenMultifunctional products for adults and children are very important to us. Each of our products are crafted with longevity and versatility in mind. Designed to take you effortlessly from day to night, from bathroom to gym, from your home to a picnic in the park or mediation practice.Our Products: Design Attributes and SizesOur towels have a special honeycomb weaving for better absorbency and for providing a light exfoliating effect.Our throws are made of unique double layered linen fabric which gives them a cashmere like touch and make them extra comfortable to cuddle with.Especially for the Indiegogo campaign, we created a limited addition beach sheet. They are our summertime "must-haves". Light, durable and  easy to take care of. Our ProductionAll our products are ethically made in Europe. After a long search for a production facility, we chose one situated in the European part of Russia which has been an industry leading specialist in linen production for more than 150 years. For a long time, it has been the linen supplier of Russian royalty and continues to be a world renowned linen producer. We are happy to support production that takes care of long-lasting textile traditions as well as provide thousands of working places for local people. Most of the employees are professionals with experience of 20-35 years.  They work 8 hour shifts with a lunch and tea breaks, have paid vacation and medical care as well as support of labor unions. As you can imagine, people are happy to work in a stable environment producing items which are highly appreciated around the world. We love visiting our production partner in order to foster a close working relationship with the individuals who are producing exceptional products for you. International Certifications of our Production Partner Include:
OEKO-TEX® Certification - you can be certain that every component of our products have been tested for harmful substances and that the products therefore is harmless in human ecological terms. 
BSCI Certification - every product is produced in a factory that strictly adheres to BSCI requirements that implements the principle international labor standards protecting workers’ rights. PackagingWe package our items in biodegradable bags and recyclable envelopes. No Scraps, No WasteWe have designed our products in a way that there is no production waste or leftover fabric.  Everything weaved is being fully utilized.Our Team We are a family run business operated by Anna and Lance. We invested our time, energy and savings in order to create an alternative to conventional textiles as well as inspire people to live more consciously and sustainably.Anna is a co-founder and the creator of Aprioria Textiles. She is a graduate of Central Saint Martin’s College of Art and Design in London and has been working with textiles since childhood. She formulated an idea and spent several months developing and testing prototypes before she would receive the right result. She is a creative professional with boundless enthusiasm for her work.Lance is a co-founder and the managing force behind Aprioria Textiles. Lance holds an MBA from IE Business School in Madrid, as well as an undergraduate degree in finance and management from Grand Valley State University. He has spent his career working for a number of international companies which has given him the ability to look at common things from a different perspective.Color of the product is subject to change.Why Do We Need Your Pledge?Creating sustainable textiles in a world of mass market, fast consumption and instant gratification takes a lot of courage that our team definitely possesses. In order to scale our efforts we need your support. We believe in the synergy of our boundless energy, enthusiasm, hard work, and support of people, who like us, believe that big changes can be achieved with little things, like towels and throws.Our conservative campaign goal is 15,000 euros. This target covers the initial order with the producer, fulfillment to our Indiegogo backers, and allows us to deploy a small quantity of products on the European market for proof of concept. However, our ideal goal is 45,000 euros.  This goal will allow us to accelerate scaling. The cost of research, prototype creation and testing, roadshow to visit production candidates, administrative, legal and marketing expenses prior this campaign has been fully funded by us.Our Fair PricesWe believe that fairly produced linen textiles cannot cost the same as mass market conventional products. Growing, harvesting, treating flax, weaving the fabric, sewing textile items and finishing by hand is a time-consuming process which requires many highly skilled professionals. Just imagine that to produce the fringe on our throws takes a skilled seamstress several hours to complete.We believe that all work during this process should be fairly compensated. We would like to inspire our clients to respect their items, take good care of them, and to create a connection with the products. It may sound strange for a textiles brand but we want you to buy less and buy better.Choose Consciously When You ShopA throw at a leading mass market retailer can cost 30 euros or more but it is made of polyester and will loose its initial look and feel in a couple of months, if not in weeks and create additional waste. We do not offer just another towel; we offer towels which will last. We do not offer a cover for this winter, we offer a throw that will keep you naturally comfortable and keeps its abundant qualities and look.Our PerksColor of the towels – beige.Appreciation Has No Levels...We appreciate your support and would like to reward you with very useful and high-quality items which were made just for our Indiegogo campaign.For every Perk up to 149 euros you will receive for free a beautiful modern kitchen towel to inspire you to try baking your own bread, the recipe of which will be provided as well. If you are not interested in baking, then you can treat yourself with a nice personal breakfast. We believe that little thoughtful details like this truly make a difference in life.For every Perk above 150 euros you will receive for free a beautiful modern kitchen towel to inspire you to try baking your own bread, the recipe of which will be provided as well. If you are not interested in baking, then you can treat yourself with a nice personal breakfast. Also, you will receive a linen bag to make your grocery shopping more sustainable. We believe that little thoughtful details like this truly make a difference in life.Our Big ThanksWe appreciate everyone who has helped us during the process: our incredible team at our production partner and our dear families and friends in Russia, the USA, and around the world. We also would like to give a special thanks to our friend Anna who flew from Paris to Madrid to make our Welcome Video for our Indiegogo campaign. And huge thanks to all of you for stopping by and reading this campaign. We appreciate your time and support enormously and truly believe that you will enjoy your Perks!Future PlansDuring our Indiegogo campaign we present our initial line of products. Looking towards the future we have more fine offerings in the R&D pipeline.  If you did not find something you love today and would like to support our work, please make a donation by clicking the "BACK IT" button at the top of this page.We will be happy to send you our family bread recipe which works every time and will inspire you to live more consciously and connect with yourself. Get Inspired and Receive News on Our Instagram Page:
Contact Us by Email or Subscribe to Our News Letter:
Risks and ChallengesAprioria Textiles has already produced various samples of our products and tested them rigorously. Every item has performed beyond our hopes and expectations. We developed a trustworthy relationship with our production partner, signed an engagement contract and they are ready to take our order. We are confident that we will meet our delivery commitment, however, we will communicate clearly in the unlikely event of force majeure. We commit to maintain transparent and honest communication with you throughout the whole process so you know where your products are and when they are going to be delivered to you. Please note that any customs charges outside the European Union will need to be satisfied by the backer.

story:
"We don't stop playing because we grow old, we grow old because we stop playing." 

- George Bernard Shaw -

OUR STORY

The Freebird Club idea was conceived in Glenbeigh, County Kerry (Ireland) when founder Peter Mangan started renting out his country cottage to visitors from around the world, using familiar accommodation websites such as Airbnb and Homeaway. While Peter was in Dublin working, his father Owen (a retired veterinarian and widower) was on hand to meet and greet the guests. This was a positive and enjoyable experience for him, meeting new people from different places. However when some older guests came to stay, the level of social interaction went to a whole other level. He would take them to the local pub or sightseeing, they might have dinner together or a game of golf. In essence, fun was being had and friendships were being formed that went way beyond the usual host/guest interaction. Indeed the reviews from these ‘senior’ guests were exceptional, saying this social aspect was a highlight of their trip. Seeing the enriching social benefits that his father was now enjoying prompted Peter to think how he could encapsulate and replicate this life-enhancing experience for the benefit of older adults everywhere. Fast forward 2 and a half years, and The Freebird Club is up and running as a global membership club for older adults, offering meaningful social engagement through travel and hosting opportunities. We now need funds to build a team and organisation that can truly deliver on our vision of an age-friendly and inclusive world. Your support will help us make the difference and improve the lives of older adults around the world.

 

Founder Peter Mangan with his father Owen at home in County Kerry, Ireland.

 

WHO WE ARE

The Freebird Club is a travel-based social club for older adults, enabling positive 'connected ageing’ through social travel and homestays between members. Our mission is to connect and enrich the lives of older adults, fostering an age-friendly and inclusive world. Operating as a global peer-to-peer members club, we enable older adults to travel and stay with each other as part of a trusted community of socially minded peers. In doing so we offer a whole new way of travelling for older adults, a means to unlock asset value in their homes and earn extra income, and a fun accessible way to meet new people and enjoy social and cultural interaction in later life.

 

PROBLEMS WE ARE TACKLING                                                    

  1. Loneliness and isolation - one of the biggest issues facing older adults today, carrying significant health risks such as coronary heart disease, stroke and dementia.
  2. Financial insecurity in later life - many seniors struggle with inadequate pensions
  3. Lack of travel options for older people - research indicates many seniors would like to travel more but either lack companionship or the confidence to do it alone.

The ageing of society is a global phenomenon due to increased human longevity and falling birth rates. Globally the number and % of older persons (60+) is growing dramatically - from 900m in 2015 to over 2 billion by 2050. Globally 40% of older persons live independently (alone or with spouse only); in more developed countries the figure is c.75% (UN Dept of Economic & Social Affairs Population Report). In the UK, recent studies indicate that almost 1 in 6 adults over age 65 are chronically lonely. Healthwise, chronic loneliness has been correlated to smoking over 15 cigarettes a day and presents a higher health risk than obesity.

 

OUR SOLUTION

The Freebird Club provides a customised ‘age-friendly’ platform to enable older adults engage in peer-to-peer homestays and vacations with each other through an online membership club. Using the host/guest model, 'hosts' can make their spare rooms available to fellow members to come and stay for a nightly rate. Visits always involve staying with the live-in host present, as the emphasis is as much on the company as the accommodation. By creatively combining a travel site and a companionship site (where members have personal profiles describing themselves and their interests), we facilitate people finding people, not just a place to stay.

 

INTERNATIONAL AWARDS

  • Winner - European Social Innovation Tournament (run by European Investment Bank)
  •  Winner - Smart Ageing Innovation Award 2017  (run by ISAX Ireland)
  • Winner - Aging2.0 Global Startup Search, London 2016 (run by Aging 2.0)
  • Winner - European Social Innovation Competition 2015 (run by European Commission)

 

OUR VISION & IMPACT

Our vision is to create a more age-friendly, inclusive and ‘connected’ world for older adults. In our rapidly ageing society, there are more and more older adults dealing with loneliness and isolation. There are also increasing numbers of people struggling on inadequate pensions. These are not just unfortunate situations on an individual or human level, they also carry significant costs for society, tax payers and the economy. We want to do something about that. We want to contribute to a world where people no longer find themselves lonely or isolated or disconnected by virtue of their age. We want to enable financial independence and economic sustainability for older adults. We want to create a real movement - empowering and inspiring older adults to enjoy the world around them regardless of age. We are using the ‘sharing economy’ to achieve this. However our vision goes beyond the sharing economy, we want to champion a new ‘caring economy’, where people are what matter most, and the social impact is as important as the economic return.

 

OUR TEAM

Our Dublin-based team has now expanded to seven people, with staff working across marketing, web development and customer service. We also have a group of senior volunteers providing their time and skills to advance the project, as well as an international Strategic Advisory Board providing expert advice and guidance on all things ageing, innovation and enterprise development. In line with our positive ageing ethos, we have established a “50 Over 50” employment plan, whereby at least 50% of Freebird Club staff will be aged over 50. Not only is this an overt anti-ageism strategy, it also provides the company with unique insights and a ‘window’ into the particular challenges of our user demographic, as well as a more empathetic customer support ethos.

 

OUR PROGRESS & PLANS

Following a successful pilot phase in 2016, we formally launched the Freebird Club in April 2017. Already we have over 1500 Freebird members in 38 countries worldwide, and membership is growing daily. While the original concept is based around individual members, we now want to build an ‘Organisational Portal’ to allow age organisations to join as affiliate members (eg. positive ageing organisations, charities, retirement clubs, societies, care homes, etc). Extending the Freebird Club to allow age organisations as members would enable us to have a much wider reach and impact. Through their association with such age organisations, we could engage the ‘harder to reach’ older adults who could benefit most from social interaction – i.e. those who might otherwise be excluded, due to extreme isolation, lack of tech skills, or health/mobility. Working with age organisations would also allow us to facilitate coordinated group trips for their clients/members, enabling them to stay collectively with friendly approved hosts in a particular community. This would result in a far more inclusive model, with potentially far greater social impact.

 

WHAT WE NEED

We have big plans and even bigger dreams to develop the Freebird Club to achieve the kind of impact that can really make a difference in people’s lives. We need to build a team and organisational infrastructure to do that. While we have been relatively successful in fundraising through grants and awards, we now need additional resources to get to the next stage - to fund our growth, and in particular the development of our new ‘Organisational Portal’. The funds will be used as follows:

  1. Technology Development: We need to build a professional in-house technology and web development team. The Freebird Club has significant plans for product development, which require upgrading the infrastructure of the website and adding considerable new features. The Organisational Portal is a key part of this.
  2. Marketing: Freebird is a global concept, and this is reflected both in the international press coverage and our awards/accolades to date. There are significant market opportunities that are ready to be capitalized on. Increase in marketing staff is essential if we are to scale up the business such that so we can target and service global markets.
  3. Customer Service: The Freebird Club has stipulated its intention to provide ‘best-in-class’ customer service tailored to its older adult customer demographic. A core trained support team is needed to deliver on this.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

We have come this far on belief, hard work and limited resources. We now need help to write the next chapter. By contributing to our campaign, you can help us change the narrative on ageing, help people enjoy their ‘golden years’ and reduce the risk of loneliness in old age.

If you are unable to contribute personally, please help us by sharing our campaign with your friends, family and community. Each share will be a building block for an age-inclusive world, and a better future for older adults everywhere.

 

INTERNATIONAL PRESS COVERAGE

story:
¿De qué trata la campaña?

 

La Revolución Emocional nace de mi propia necesidad de tener relaciones más sanas con mis amigos, mis familiares, mi pareja y, especialmente, conmigo mismo. También nace de descubrir que todas las enfermedades físicas no pueden atenderse solamente con tratamientos físicos (acupuntura y auriculoterapia), sino que tienen una contraparte emocional: es imposible sanar el cuerpo si la mente y el alma están enfermos. Desde entonces se han logrado cosas increíbles. Actualmente existen más de 200,000 seguidores, cerca de 30,000 pacientes con testimonios sorprendentes y un promedio de 3,000 mensajes cada día a través de Facebook. Hoy quiero llevar estas reflexiones, técnicas y consejos por todo el país para que tú, donde estés, puedas aprender a amar en libertad y construir relaciones sanas. La cantidad de ciudades que visite depende del presupuesto recaudado, y en cada una se realizarán conferencias, consultas privadas para atender problemas de salud físicos y emocionales, así como cenas privadas con los seguidores, para conocernos mejor.

En resumen, quiero ayudar a muchas más personas a ser felices, a través de la salud física y emocional.  

Sé que con tu apoyo será posible.    

 

Imagen: taller magistral en Acapulco con 5000 asistentes.

¿Cómo puedes apoyar?

 

  • Aporta lo que creas necesario (¡Pueden ser desde $20.00 pesos!) para que la Revolución llegue a miles de personas que, como tú, quieren tener mejores relaciones con los demás, partiendo del amor popio. Puedes hacerlo vía tarjeta de crédito, débito y también por OXXO (tarjeta 5206949025605790, Banamex). 
  • Comparte esta página en tus redes sociales, explicando por qué es importante para ti que te apoyen para llevar esto a tu ciudad. Sería de muchísima ayuda que tus amigos y familiares lo hicieran también. 

  • ¿Tienes dudas? Puedes escribirme por correo electrónico a contacto@revolucionemocional.com o directamente a mi Whatsapp en el 442 239 4854 

 

En esta guía tutorial podrás ver paso a paso cómo lograrlo.
 

 

 

 

Acerca de mí

 

Soy Julián Hernández, especialista en medicina oriental, acupuntor graduado de la universidad de Tian Jin en La República Popular de China. He participado en numerosos programas de radio y algunos de televisión en México, Puerto Rico, Estados Unidos y Sudamerica. 
He dictado numerosas conferencias sobre medicina oriental, educación emocional y desarrollo humano. 

Actualmente me dedico a dar consultas con herramientas de psicoterapia, acupuntura y auriculoterapia, así como al a la docencia en Medicina Tradicional China y educación emocional. También soy instructor certificado por AMAS AC, Franklyn Covey


 
 
  Imagen: he realizado varias entrevista para la televisión abierta.

 

 

Qué obtienes por tus aportaciones

﻿

Con tus aportaciones estás logrando que miles de personas puedan acceder a información y capacitación esencial para la vida, información sobre cómo lograr amarse y amar a los demás. Esto será posible gracias a que el acceso general al evento será gratuito, pues la idea no es hacer esto un negocio, sino un acto de compartir. Y aunque sé que mucha gente apoya esta causa sin esperar nada a cambio porque conoce de primera mano sus resultados, tenemos una serie de recompensas para agradecer tu apoyo, cada una mejor en función de tu aportación.

Las recompensas son las siguientes:  
 

$1.00 USD ($19.00 MXN aprox.): acceso a todos los eventos en vivo a través de internet. Ayúdame a ayudar ¡Podrás vivir el minuto a minuto en todas las ciudades que visitemos! A

$16.00 USD ($300.00 MXN aprox.):  Aunque el acceso al evento será gratuito, es muy probable que se llene rápidamente porque sólo habrá cupo para 500 personas. Esta recompensa te da el beneficio de la recompensa anterior más una reserva y registro preferente al evento en tu ciudad. ¡Por fin podremos conocernos! 

$26.00 USD ($500 MXN aprox): las recompensas anteriores más seis meses de membresía en la plataforma oficial de la Revolución Emocional, donde encontrarás tests, clases y reflexiones para mantener tu condición emocional en forma. 

$79.00 USD (1,500 MXN aprox.): las recompensas anteriores más una consulta privada conmigo, para tratar padecimientos tanto de salud  física como de salud emocional, que como ya sabemos, siempre están relacionadas. 

$263.00 USD ($5,000 MXN aprox.): las recompensas anteriores más una cena privada para conocernos mejor y convivir de manera más cercana.  Además aparecerás como patrocinador en los eventos.

 


 

¿Cómo voy a utilizar los recursos?

 

Para lograr nuestra meta y visitar varias ciudades requerimos de un presupuesto estimado de $30,000.00 USD ($550,000.00 MXN aproximadamente). El dinero se usará para cubrir principalmente los siguientes gastos:
 

  • Logística y viáticos (55%):
    • Transporte
    • Hospedaje.
    • Gastos de dos personas que me acompañarán en el recorrido para ayudar con cuestiones logísticas
    • Renta de los auditorios
    • Otros insumos, como anuales de trabajo y papelería para la impartición de los talleres.
  • Insumos necesarios para entregar las recompensas (35%):
    • La renta de los espacios para dar consulta.
    • Insumos de las consultas (agujas para acupuntura, esencialmente).
    • Renta de equipo de producción que hará posible transmitir en vivo cada evento por streaming (por internet).
    • Presupuesto para comunicación, que es lo que hace posible difundir esta campaña.
    • Reservaciones de las cenas privadas. 
  • Un poco de asesoría adicional para logar que todo salga bien (10%). 



﻿Imagen: las tres actividades que desarrollaremos en cada ciudad. 

 


¿Cuándo comienza la gira y se entregan las recompensas?

 

 

Una vez que termine la campaña (julio) organizaremos, según las aportaciones logradas, la ruta específica de la gira, misma que comenzará a finales de agosto. Visitaré una ciudad por semana indefinidamente hasta que se agoten los recursos. En cada visita se desarrollarán los talleres con duración de 4 a 5 horas, se llevarán a cabo las consultas especializadas y se organizarán las cenas privadas. 

 

¿Qué impacto buscamos tener?

 

  • Visitar mínimo 6 ciudades.
  • Beneficiar a 5000 personas con las conferencias-talleres de la revolución emocional, tanto de manera presencial como de manera virtual.
  • Realizar 100 consultas médicas con técnicas de acupuntura o auriculoterapia. 
  • Reunirme en cenas privadas con 100 seguidores para fortalecer nuestros vínculos, conocernos mejor y hacer este movimiento más sólido. 


Imagen: en conferencia con 3000 personas. 

 

 

"SI LO QUIERES TODO, 

TIENES QUE DARLO TODO"


 

Si llegas a tener problemas persistentes o dudas específicas sobre cómo aportar, no dudes en comunicarte para recibir apoyo. 

 

 

Mail: contacto@revolucionemocional.com

Whatsapp: 442 239 4854
story_txt:
¿De qué trata la campaña?
 
La Revolución Emocional nace de mi propia necesidad de tener relaciones más sanas con mis amigos, mis familiares, mi pareja y, especialmente, conmigo mismo. También nace de descubrir que todas las enfermedades físicas no pueden atenderse solamente con tratamientos físicos (acupuntura y auriculoterapia), sino que tienen una contraparte emocional: es imposible sanar el cuerpo si la mente y el alma están enfermos. Desde entonces se han logrado cosas increíbles. Actualmente existen más de 200,000 seguidores, cerca de 30,000 pacientes con testimonios sorprendentes y un promedio de 3,000 mensajes cada día a través de Facebook. Hoy quiero llevar estas reflexiones, técnicas y consejos por todo el país para que tú, donde estés, puedas aprender a amar en libertad y construir relaciones sanas. La cantidad de ciudades que visite depende del presupuesto recaudado, y en cada una se realizarán conferencias, consultas privadas para atender problemas de salud físicos y emocionales, así como cenas privadas con los seguidores, para conocernos mejor.En resumen, quiero ayudar a muchas más personas a ser felices, a través de la salud física y emocional.  
Sé que con tu apoyo será posible.    
 

Imagen: taller magistral en Acapulco con 5000 asistentes.
¿Cómo puedes apoyar?
 


Aporta lo que creas necesario (¡Pueden ser desde $20.00 pesos!) para que la Revolución llegue a miles de personas que, como tú, quieren tener mejores relaciones con los demás, partiendo del amor popio. Puedes hacerlo vía tarjeta de crédito, débito y también por OXXO (tarjeta 5206949025605790, Banamex). 

Comparte esta página en tus redes sociales, explicando por qué es importante para ti que te apoyen para llevar esto a tu ciudad. Sería de muchísima ayuda que tus amigos y familiares lo hicieran también. 
¿Tienes dudas? Puedes escribirme por correo electrónico a contacto@revolucionemocional.com o directamente a mi Whatsapp en el 442 239 4854 

 
En esta guía tutorial podrás ver paso a paso cómo lograrlo. 

 


 
 
Acerca de mí
 
Soy Julián Hernández, especialista en medicina oriental, acupuntor graduado de la universidad de Tian Jin en La República Popular de China. He participado en numerosos programas de radio y algunos de televisión en México, Puerto Rico, Estados Unidos y Sudamerica. He dictado numerosas conferencias sobre medicina oriental, educación emocional y desarrollo humano. 
Actualmente me dedico a dar consultas con herramientas de psicoterapia, acupuntura y auriculoterapia, así como al a la docencia en Medicina Tradicional China y educación emocional. También soy instructor certificado por AMAS AC, Franklyn Covey
    Imagen: he realizado varias entrevista para la televisión abierta.
 
 
Qué obtienes por tus aportaciones
﻿Con tus aportaciones estás logrando que miles de personas puedan acceder a información y capacitación esencial para la vida, información sobre cómo lograr amarse y amar a los demás. Esto será posible gracias a que el acceso general al evento será gratuito, pues la idea no es hacer esto un negocio, sino un acto de compartir. Y aunque sé que mucha gente apoya esta causa sin esperar nada a cambio porque conoce de primera mano sus resultados, tenemos una serie de recompensas para agradecer tu apoyo, cada una mejor en función de tu aportación.
Las recompensas son las siguientes:   
$1.00 USD ($19.00 MXN aprox.): acceso a todos los eventos en vivo a través de internet. Ayúdame a ayudar ¡Podrás vivir el minuto a minuto en todas las ciudades que visitemos! A
$16.00 USD ($300.00 MXN aprox.):  Aunque el acceso al evento será gratuito, es muy probable que se llene rápidamente porque sólo habrá cupo para 500 personas. Esta recompensa te da el beneficio de la recompensa anterior más una reserva y registro preferente al evento en tu ciudad. ¡Por fin podremos conocernos! 
$26.00 USD ($500 MXN aprox): las recompensas anteriores más seis meses de membresía en la plataforma oficial de la Revolución Emocional, donde encontrarás tests, clases y reflexiones para mantener tu condición emocional en forma. 
$79.00 USD (1,500 MXN aprox.): las recompensas anteriores más una consulta privada conmigo, para tratar padecimientos tanto de salud  física como de salud emocional, que como ya sabemos, siempre están relacionadas. 
$263.00 USD ($5,000 MXN aprox.): las recompensas anteriores más una cena privada para conocernos mejor y convivir de manera más cercana.  Además aparecerás como patrocinador en los eventos.
 
 
¿Cómo voy a utilizar los recursos?
 
Para lograr nuestra meta y visitar varias ciudades requerimos de un presupuesto estimado de $30,000.00 USD ($550,000.00 MXN aproximadamente). El dinero se usará para cubrir principalmente los siguientes gastos: 


Logística y viáticos (55%): 
Transporte
Hospedaje.
Gastos de dos personas que me acompañarán en el recorrido para ayudar con cuestiones logísticas
Renta de los auditorios
Otros insumos, como anuales de trabajo y papelería para la impartición de los talleres.



Insumos necesarios para entregar las recompensas (35%):
La renta de los espacios para dar consulta.
Insumos de las consultas (agujas para acupuntura, esencialmente).
Renta de equipo de producción que hará posible transmitir en vivo cada evento por streaming (por internet).
Presupuesto para comunicación, que es lo que hace posible difundir esta campaña.
Reservaciones de las cenas privadas. 


Un poco de asesoría adicional para logar que todo salga bien (10%). 

﻿Imagen: las tres actividades que desarrollaremos en cada ciudad. 
 

¿Cuándo comienza la gira y se entregan las recompensas?
 
 
Una vez que termine la campaña (julio) organizaremos, según las aportaciones logradas, la ruta específica de la gira, misma que comenzará a finales de agosto. Visitaré una ciudad por semana indefinidamente hasta que se agoten los recursos. En cada visita se desarrollarán los talleres con duración de 4 a 5 horas, se llevarán a cabo las consultas especializadas y se organizarán las cenas privadas. 
 
¿Qué impacto buscamos tener?
 

Visitar mínimo 6 ciudades.

Beneficiar a 5000 personas con las conferencias-talleres de la revolución emocional, tanto de manera presencial como de manera virtual.
Realizar 100 consultas médicas con técnicas de acupuntura o auriculoterapia. 
Reunirme en cenas privadas con 100 seguidores para fortalecer nuestros vínculos, conocernos mejor y hacer este movimiento más sólido. 


Imagen: en conferencia con 3000 personas. 
 
 
"SI LO QUIERES TODO, 
TIENES QUE DARLO TODO"

 
Si llegas a tener problemas persistentes o dudas específicas sobre cómo aportar, no dudes en comunicarte para recibir apoyo.

story: Our World
story_txt: Our World

story:
I'm Sam Houghton and I have spent 25 years of my life struggling with mental health issues including severe depression, severe anxiety, bulimia, OCD and other. I have been hospitalised a few times, my longest stay was for 16 months at aged 15 years. After all of these years of therapies and medications from professionals, I realised that most of my recovery had to come from within.

I embraced self help and personal development and moved forward in great strides in my life, to eventually setting up my own business.

Having experienced so much adversity for a long period of time, I have a deep desire to use my experiences to empower others in their recovery and to reduce feelings of isolation, guilt and shame. I know of this all too well.

I wrote my book "The Invisible Girl" in February 2017, the words that had been inside of me for so long, flooded out of my and onto the pages.

I am an ambassador for a mental health charity and also speak publicly about my journey and share on social media. I volunteer with disadvantaged young people which I love as that is when my problems began.

I am currently creating some online courses to compliment my book and help people as much as I can, sharing what helped me away from professional medical help.

At least 1 in 4 people in the UK alone will experience a mental health problem each year, with eating disorders causing the most fatality within mental illness.

To ensure that this book was not just about my personal story, the last chapter is a collection of the insights from my struggles that will raise hope for those struggling at this moment and to help see challenges from a different perspective. It can also help carers, family and friends with an insight into the mind of a person struggling to get through mental illness. There is a large section which focusses on the teenage years which would be beneficial to many young people and their families and professionals. This book explores the impacts of challenging life experiences including relationships, motherhood, personality, family genetics and the psychiatric system.

There are so many people struggling, even with professional help,  and I want to reach out to as many as I possibly can. I learnt how to overcome my worst struggles, and through my business and my desire to help I have built up a decent sized following on social media. I will be sharing this project avidly on these platforms to raise the target required.

By contributing to the publishing of this book it will potentially enable thousands of readers, of all ages to share my story of hope, and keeping the determination to overcome any adversity leading to a far happier, peaceful and fulfilling life.

If you are not able to contribute then please share my pledge on social media using the indiegogo share tools. You can also follow me here:

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/Theinvisiblegirlsamant...

Twitter: https://twitter.com/IridescenceSam

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/invisiblegirlsam/?hl=en

You can read an excerpt of my book here:  http://ow.ly/1zmW309Dvvs

I need £1000 to publish my book with a company that has a powerful ethos of empowering others in self development and self help.

This will go towards: Cover design, editing, isbn numbers, typesetting, printing and marketing.

To demonstrate my absolute gratitude I am including some rewards and the perks are:

 

£1 donation - A free chapter of my book and one poem

£5 donation - A free chapter of my book, 2 poems and a dedication in the book.

£15 donation - A free chapter of my book, a poem, a dedication in my book and a signed copy of the book.

£25 donation - A free chapter of my book, 4 poems, a dedication in my book and a signed copy of the book.

£50 donation - A free chapter of my book, a poem, a dedication in my book and two signed copies of the book.

 

Thank you

story:
How can we create healthier living environments?

Do you feel stressed after a 30 minutes metro ride, hours spent in front of a computer screen? Do you feel drained as you navigate your way through a noisy, polluted environment? While we don’t really pay attention, our body and brain are constantly analyzing dozens of stimuli from the physical space and activities around us. This sensory experience of space, that can sometimes be overwhelming, has a major influence on our body and brain, shapes the way we perceive a city.


Recent studies have shown that living in cities can emphasize or trigger the appearance of health issues such as anxiety disorder, diabetes, cardiovascular and immune diseases, etc.

So what are the impacts of modern architecture and urban activities on our bodies and psyche? How can we use architecture, design and new technologies to improve urban health?

 

Therapeutic spaces: when space can heal

When it comes to healthcare facilities, it is commonly admitted that the quality of the space can contribute or even accelerate patients’ recovery.  Medical institutions are dedicated spaces when the human body is being scrutinized and the quality of the physical is a complementary tool that facilitate the patient’s recovery. 

What if we could if we could use the benefit of therapeutic architecture to create healthier urban environments using colors, sound, sensors, materials, forms, thermal conditions etc. What if in your everyday life  (at your office, on your way to school, in your supermarket, at the bus stop nearby) you have access and spend some time in different types of 'healing spaces'?

 

Healing Places: a cross-disciplinary project

By connecting architecture with users’ experiences, medical sciences, art, design and new technologies, the project aims to develop several models of healing urban environments that could be tested and implemented in cities. Those small indoor and outdoor spaces will integrate design and new technologies to stimulate user’s senses and help them improving their physiological and mental health.

Used occasionally or on a daily basis, those space will help users reconnecting with their body, get more physically active, focused, relaxed, prevent the appearance of health problems.

What would these spaces look like, feel like? How could we adapt them to the complexity of human experience? How can we integrate them into the existing urban fabric? How do we get the scientific proof that they can improve certain health conditions?

 

Project objectives

  • Develop architectural forms that fully engage users’ body and senses
     
  • Raising awareness about the link between health issues/well-being and the characteristics of the built environment (among the population, architecture students and practitioners, local authorities
     
  • Integrate the population throughout the whole process. Users are considered as ‘local experts’ and play a key role in helping professionals developing healing environments
     
  • Creating new types of collaboration between dif­ferent fields that don’t necessarily work together nor use the same language and methods.

 

First phase: a series of 5 publications

We will publish a series of 5 publications entitled ‘The Body, the Mind and the City’ that will explore the relationship between the human body and physical spaces through various angles, from neurosciences to architecture, artistic projects. We will collect a research, projects, theories, interviews/experiences that can serve as a basis to create healing urban environments.

 

Second phase: an urban experiment

The experiment will start with a field research in Delfshaven (Rotterdam) to analyze the characteristic of the built environment and its im­pact on people’s perception of space and health. Diagnostic of the local population’s health issues, their sensory experience of urban spaces (indoor, outdoor), how they move and use space. The diagnostic will be summarized in a Report that will serve as a basis to develop the prototypes in the later phase.

In the summer of 2018, we will organize a prototyping workshop to actually conceptualize create different prototypes of healing urban spaces in Delfshaven neighborhood. We will invite a team of international experts, students and practitioners, the local population and actors to take part in this urban experiment. During 2 weeks, participants will build 5 prototypes of healing places in the neighborhood.

During the 2 weeks, 5 groups will:

  • Define a concept for each sensory and therapeutic prototype (module)
  • Articulate those 5 prototypes throughout a coherent route and narrative that engage future users
  • Discuss, share knowledge, experiences, methodologies, experimenting new approaches.
  • Take part in various workshops and activities focused on sensory perception and well-being to explore the area by listening to our senses and body reaction, translate objective and subjective data into design proposals.

 

 

We need your help to make it happen!

 

Credit photo banner: Richard Z. Hooker, "74708 - Queensbridge Road, Hackney"

Video editing: Lennox Schmidt

Video music by Epidemic Sound (http://www.epidemicsound.com)

 

About the founder:

Inès Péborde is a French urban designer and founder of Healing Places, a practice-led research that focuses on urban health, sensory experiences and spatial design. 

Together with users and a a multidisciplinary team of experts, Inès is exploring the relationship between the human body and physical space, influenced by scientific discoveries and societal changes. She works on different scales and uses a multilayered approach to create adaptive and therapeutic spaces in cities that can help improving people's physical and mental health.

story:
CHANGE THE WAY YOU AND OTHERS
CARE FOR YOUR DOG

FUNCTIONAL ASSESSMENT TRACKING™ FOR DOG OWNERS AND PROFESSIONALS

Introducing a dog’s best friend: Functional Assessment Tracking™ (FAT™). Created by professional trainer Suzanne Clothier, FAT™ helps you translate what you know about a dog into a powerfully informative profile.

Each profile is a reflection of your dog in that moment, in that setting, under those conditions. You may create as many profiles as you like, whether that’s every day or every now and then. Each profile can be emailed, printed out or shared via URLs, and all profiles become a part of that dog’s record.

Available as a subscription service, FAT™ will become the hallmark of knowledgeable and compassionate caretakers, whether dedicated owners or animal professionals.

 

  WHO NEEDS FAT™?

DOG OWNERS

You are the expert on your dog. How can you effectively share that knowledge with others caring for your pet? How can you gain knowledge and insight on your pet’s changing needs?

FAT™ makes sure what you know about your dog can go with your dog, so you know all caretakers have the information they need to provide the best possible care. The easy to use format guides you through 15 different aspects of your dog’s behavior, and then creates a comprehensive FAT™profile.

As someone with many animals, Suzanne knows all too well the worries about leaving a beloved companion in someone’s care. FAT™ addresses those worries.  Stop asking yourself “Did I remember to tell them…?” Use FAT™ to provide them with the information they need to know.

 

DOG CARE PROFESSIONALS

So much important information goes into caring for any dog. Will you remember to ask all the right questions? Will you or your staff remember all the details, or recognize changes? FAT™ makes sure that up-to-date, detailed information about the dog stays with the dog.

FAT™ was created to help professional caretakers, such as:

  • Veterinarians & Staff
  • Trainers & Behaviorists
  • Shelters, Rescues & Sanctuaries
  • Boarding & Daycare Facilities
  • Dog Sitters & Dog Walkers
  • Service & Guide Dog Organizations
  • Therapy & Service Dogs

Accurate, easily communicated information is vital to providing the best possible care. FAT™ profiles give you and your entire staff a world of current information about each dog. Avoid the confusion of interpretation and inexpert assessments. FAT™ provides clear, observation based information that keeps every one on the same page, and doing the best for the dog.

 

  WHAT'S IN A FAT™ Profile?

A FAT™ profile is created using a 15-point scale that assesses the dog's physiological, social and cognitive function. Each point is scored on a 0-10 scale, with specifics provided at every step. No guesswork or confusing interpretations, just clear objective information based in observation.

The easy to use website guides you through specifics of scoring behavior and responses. You do not need to be an expert in dog behavior to use FAT™ -- just able to recognize what a dog does or does not do.

SAMPLE PROFILE (Prototype - final design will vary)

                          

 

Color coding of each score point helps you quickly recognize the overall dog as well as critical details, and know, at a glance, any changes in the dog's condition/behavior.

 

 HOW IT WORKS

FAT™ is an online subscription service. The FAT™ interface is easy to use, requires no training and is available on multiple platforms and devices.

Each subscriber has their own web portal, which is private and secure. Professional subscriptions can be customized to include logos and other business related information.

Once a FAT™ profile has been created for that dog, it is stored in his cumulative online record. There is no limit to the number of FAT™ profiles that can be created for any dog in your subscription. Profiles may be shared via email or a link, or printed. Every account has many features that allow you to customize how your account and dog profiles may be used, shared or limited.

Subscriptions are priced according to the number of dogs for whom profiles will be created. Our lowest tier allows for 3 dog profiles, and on up to 2000+ profiles for professionals and organizations. At any time, you may choose to remove a dog from your plan, freeing up that space for another dog.

Subscriptions are designed to be very flexible in terms of users - multiple users are possible. Each subscriber can set permissions for their account so that FAT™ works for you and your needs.

 

 CASE HISTORY VIDEOS

Case History #1 RUNE

This case history shows how FAT tracks the changes in a young puppy over a 17 day period as she shifts from dealing with a mild problem to needing veterinary care and back to healthy puppy.

 

Case History #2 BOARDING KENNEL

Here's how a boarding kennel uses FAT™ for two dogs who have previously boarded with them. Changing needs are shared with FAT™'s effective at-a-glance team communication.

 
 

 FOR A LIFETIME

 

  HOW FAT™ HELPS PROFESSIONALS

Dog care professionals will appreciate what FAT™ can do for their business, their staff and for the level of care they can provide.

Assess Efficacy: Tracks changes +/- , pre-, mid- and post-treatment (behavioral, medical, physical therapy, exercise regimen, diet changes, etc.).

Screen Clients In/Out: Identifies dogs that match your resources & staff, guides referrals to other professionals better suited.

Maintain Consistency & Standardization: Allows clear communication across entire organization, departments & branches. Online and printed materials allow at-a-glance information for everyone handling the dog.

Promotes Understanding of Dogs In Your Care: Helps client appreciate their dog as individual.

Allocate Resources: Identify needs; make best use of your skills, facility, staff, and resources, particularly limited or specialized resources.

Track Progress in Program: Follow dog's progress through your program. Ideal for guide/service dog organizations, breeders, trainers,  behaviorists, physical therapy and veterinarians.

Pre-Placement: Clear picture of dog's needs & preferences; identify suitable homes (foster or permanent). Invaluable for breeders, shelters/rescues, sanctuary and guide/service dog organizations.

Post-Placement: Detailed follow-up online positions you to be pro-active and helpful after the dog is in a new home. Invaluable for breeders, shelters/rescues, sanctuary and guide/service dog organizations.

 

  FAQs

  • Do I have to score every single point, every single time? You may choose to score only certain aspects. For example, you may not be interested in scoring social behaviors, but keenly interested in tracking physiological changes. It's easy to customize each profile to suit your needs at that time. Unscored areas will be marked as "unscored" so it is clear that sections were not overlooked but selected to be left out.
  • Can I share my subscription? Yes, you may share your subscription. Let's say you have 2 dogs, and your friend has 1 dog. Your Family 3 subscription will cover all three dogs. As the subscriber, you have the option to make your friend an authorized user on your account. Our Friends & Family plan allows up to 15 dogs, ideal for a small group of friends (or a couple of serious dog lovers!) Choose the plan that best suits your needs.
  • What happens if my dog is no longer owned by me or dies? When you no longer need a dog to be active on your account, you may delete her. That dog space is now available again on your subscription.
  • If I delete a dog, what happens to his records? Before removing a dog from  your account, you will be able to export and download the entire cumulative record for that dog. In the case of veterinary practices or other professionals who are legally required to retain records, there is the option to designate a retention period for files in limbo.
  • What if I go over the limit of my pricing level? Not a problem! The pricing tiers reflects the max you will pay for that many dogs. Additional dogs are charged at a modest per dog price. There does come a point, however, where it is more economical for you to bump up to the next tier.
  • I want my portal to reflect my business. Can I customize the FAT™ portal? Yes! We know that professionals want to keep their brand in front of their clients. All Pro accounts include set-up and customization with logo, colors and more.
  • Can my clients complete the FAT™ or will my staff or me have to help them? One reason we hired the experts at Polycot is their track record on effective, intuitive design (that also looks great!). FAT™ is designed to be intuitive and clear. You have a choice of asking clients to login to your portal, or, if necessary, a staff member can guide less technologically savvy clients through the process.
  • What happens if I no longer use the services of a FAT™ professional? You will have the option to start your own personal FAT™ subscription and continue your dog's records without interruption.
  • Will all of my dog's caretakers send me a FAT™ profile when my dog is in their care? We intend for FAT™ to be a must-have service for serious professional caretakers. How each professional will utilize FAT™ is up to them. If your vet, boarding kennel, trainer, daycare or pet sitter doesn't subscribe to FAT™, you may choose to provide them with access to your FAT™ portal, and ask them to use it for your dogs.
  • Can I arrange for monthly payments? You may choose to pay by the month, or receive a discount for a yearly payment. Your choice!
  • Are there any guarantees? We always want happy customers who are completely satisfied. If at any time you wish to terminate your FAT™ subscription, we will gladly refund your pro-rated subscription fees, whether you were paying by the month or annually.

Do you have a question not answered here? Let us know! Email us at FAT@suzanneclothier.com

 

  PRICING

We offer multiple pricing levels so you can find the FAT™ subscription that fits your needs. Each level is set by the number of dogs. All levels include unlimited number of profiles you may create for each dog.

Save with your advance subscription, and save 30% or more over these retail prices: (USD)

  • Family                        3 Dogs           $14.95/month (just $4.98 per dog per month)
  • Friends & Family     15 Dogs          $29.95/month (just $2.00 per dog per month)
  • Dog Lover                 50 Dogs         $49.95/month (just $1.00 per dog per month)
  • Pro250                      250 Dogs       $200/month (just $.80 per dog per month)
  • Pro500                     500 Dogs       $375/month (just $.75 per dog per month)
  • Pro1000  1000 Dogs     $625/month (just $.63 per dog per month) Interested in this pre-order level? Contact us directly and we will create a perk for you!
  • Pro1500  1500 Dogs     $875/month (just $.58 per dog per month) Interested in this per-order level? Contact us directly and we will create a perk for you!
  • ProCustom  Talk to us for pricing for 2000+ dogs, multiple locations, etc. Interested in this pre-order level? Contact us directly and we will create a perk for you!

Shelters, Rescues & Sanctuaries  We will be offering heavily subsidized subscriptions for shelters, rescues and sanctuaries. We want FAT™ to make a difference in the lives of dogs seeking their forever homes. You must be a 501(C)3 organization (or equivalent for international groups.) Contact us for more information.

 

  WHO IS USING FAT™

RESEARCH PROJECT at Carroll College, Helena MT

Erica Feuerbacher, M.S., Ph.D., BCBA-D, CPDT-KA is an Assistant Professor of Anthrozoology at Carroll College in Helena, MT.  There she leads the canine program in which students train and foster dogs during the academic year. She has earned awards for her behavior analytic research on dog behavior. Her research interests center on dog-human social interactions, improving shelter dog welfare, and assessing training techniques.

The Project, start date Aug 2017:  "As part of our undergraduate program, students foster shelter dogs for a year. Being able to understand how the dog is functioning in its environment and how that changes as it transitions from shelter life into home life is really important. Not only can we make better decisions for the dog, we can help adopters better prepare for changes in their dog after adoption.

"To date, we have not had a good tool to track the dog's functioning and behavior and we do not know how dogs change after adoption. My hope is to help elucidate if and when we see changes in dogs that might be in line with the so-called post-adoption honeymoon period. FAT™ is a wonderful tool to allow us to track how dogs are functioning in their environment and changes that occur.

"I am incredibly excited to be using this tool in my college course to have students track their foster dogs' functioning and use it to answer our research questions about honeymoon periods. FAT™ could be a powerful tool for researchers and owners to better understand dog behavior and its interactions with the environment, and to make the best decisions for our dogs."

 

These businesses are putting FAT™ into practice, and are among those who will serve as our Beta testers.

                

                   

              

              

 

OUR STORY 

FAT™ is the natural outcome of Suzanne's lifelong experience living with and caring for many animals. Her work emphasizes seeing each dog as an individual. See the dog! is a familiar phrase to her students and participants at her seminars.

As a professional trainer, she wanted a way to help dog owners and other professionals understand dogs in a detailed way, and to identify and track changes. There were no options available.

On a more personal level, as an animal owner who travels frequently, she worries each time she leaves her own animals. She knows this question all too well: "Did I remember to tell them . . .?" She wanted a better way to communicate with others.

Suzanne began developing FAT™ in 2014, refining it with feedback from a wide range of professional caretakers and dog owners. Each time she presented a "road test" version of FAT, people got really excited about the power and potential of this tool. What they appreciated was that the whole dog was reflected in that FAT™ profile. Many expressed their weariness with overly simplified scales that weren't detailed enough to be truly useful.

What Suzanne kept hearing was, "Where do I sign up???" People wanted this tool, ASAP!

Making It Real

It took months to find the right team (thanks Susan & Bill!) who could make FAT™ a serious, robust application for widespread use. Suzanne has partnered with the experienced and talented Polycot Associates—web developers and fellow dog lovers—to bring FAT™ from an idea to reality.

 

  THE PERKS!

Here’s how you can help FAT become reality:

  1. PRE-ORDER A yearly subscription to FAT on Indiegogo, with substantial discounts and some nice perks as well. When you pre-order, save $$ and get great value. We are on track for an April 2018 subscription start.
  2. DONATE In exchange for your donation, we are offering some great perks which include: gift certificates you can use at SuzanneClothier.com, merchandise, even private coaching from Suzanne. his is ideal for those who wish to support Suzanne and this project. (You will have a chance later on to buy an advance subscription at a discount.) 
  3. CRAZY GOOD PERK BUNDLE Mix and match from the available perks and a pre-ordered subscription to create your own crazy good perk bundle. 
  4. SHARE Tell your friends, family, clients, followers, even strangers you meet at the vet's or in the pet store - spread the word! Be sure to let professional caretakers know: your vets, pet sitters, daycare, boarding kennel, anyone interested in providing great care to dogs.
  5. CHECK-IN We'll be offering some flash perks through the coming weeks. You might want to grab one - holiday gift giving season is coming!
  6. SPEAK!  However you want to speak up, please do! We can't wait to hear from you.

To show our appreciation for your support we have a number of perks and giving levels for you to choose from.

You may opt to back the project in more than one way. For example, select the advance subscription and  then another merchandise perk.

We're so appreciative of all support! Thank you in advance for helping us pull this project across the finish line.

WHAT ARE THE PERKS?

Thank You We'll give you a shout out on our website. Consider it a human tail wag of sorts. It's kind of fun seeing your name up there, and knowing, "Hey, I helped make that happen!" (You'll have a choice to be anonymous, of course!)

Gift Certificate Redeem your gift certificate for workshops, books, videos, leashes & more at https://suzanneclothier.com/shop/  Better still, tuck some gift certificates into a card, gift or stocking for other dogs lovers, or donate them to your local animal shelter.

Personal Coaching Session A 60 minute phone consultation with Suzanne ($175 value) on the subject of your choice - from puppy rearing to behavior issues, training challenges, shy/fearful dogs, reactive dogs, aggression, adolescents, the canine athlete, multiple dog households, and more. (Limited!)

Seminar Tickets  FREE ticket(s) to one of Suzanne's seminars ($350 per ticket value). Be sure to check Suzanne's website to see if there is a seminar near you.

FAT™ Subscription Be one of the first to experience FAT™ for yourself! Your pre-order of a one-year subscription includes the number of profiles best suited for your needs. There is a FAT™ subscription level for every need from the dog owner to professionals with 2000+ dogs.

BEST. PERK. EVER.  Giving dogs around the world a way to be understood, appreciated and cared for in a whole new way. (Value - priceless, with ripples that go on forever...) Delivery experienced in the thump of happy dog tails.

 

  Perk Fulfillment

We are on track to launch FAT™ in early April 2018! If you have chosen a perk that includes a FAT™ subscription, you will be able to access it then. All other perks will be fulfilled December 2017.

Please be sure to watch your inbox for campaign updates! Thank you!

 

  THE TEAM

About Suzanne Clothier

Suzanne Clothier has been working with animals professionally since 1977, with a deep, broadly varied background. She is well respected for her humane Relationship Centered Training (RCT™) approach to dogs and the people that love them.

She has taught in the US, Canada, Belgium, Holland, Italy, Japan, Australia, New Zealand and the UK forgroups as varied as Wolf Park, Association of Pet Dog Trainers, the University of MN’s Nature-Based Therapeutics conference, many national and international conferences, and training groups. She also serves as a consultant to guide dog schools and service dog organizations.

An innovative trainer, Suzanne’s work includes CARAT™, The Enriched Puppy Protocol™, RAT™ , FAT™, Really Real Relaxation™, Treat/Retreat, CCC™ (with Cindy Knowlton) and RCT™ techniques. Her work reflects the experience of a lifetime spent living with and caring for many animals. Her work has been presented in multiple international conferences, including most recently at the International Working Dog Breeder Association conference.

She is an award-winning author of videos, books, booklets and numerous articles. She served as a committee member for the AKC’s Agility Advisory Board, and as a committee member of the American Humane Association’s Task Force for the Development of Humane Standards in Dog Training.

When not traveling and teaching, Suzanne is at home with husband John Rice on their working farm in upstate New York, surrounded by dogs, cats, parrots, tortoises, horses, donkeys, pigs, chickens and Scottish Highland cattle. Suzanne is ably assisted by long-time colleague & friend Heather Leonard.

 

  About Heather Leonard

Heather Leonard has always had a great love for animals – surrounding herself with many different animals from a young age. Following her BS in Biopsychology with a focus on Animal Behavior, she worked as a veterinary technician for many years.  She co-founded Taming Anubis, specializing in private training at client’s homes. She currently runs The Bark & Call Inn, an in-home boarding/daycare on her farm.

Heather has been working with Suzanne since 2002. She had the privilege implementing Suzanne’s training program at Guiding Eyes for the Blind. She brings her lifelong animal experience and professional expertise to her work with Suzanne on FAT™ and other programs.

Heather lives on a New England farm with her husband, Andy, and a menagerie of animals – horses, goats, dogs, cats and chickens.  Heather is very excited about being part of the FAT™ team.

 

  About Sen Beever

Raised on a horse farm in nowhere Kansas, Sen started young caring for and training a menagerie of animals. His long experience as a veterinary technician includes an Emergency & Specialty practice where he was taught how to handle the most critical patients; triage & ER became his specialty.

After 15 years of management in every Board Certified veterinary specialty offered, he decided to follow his heart and live his dream in California. Sen owns Mister Beever's Paws & Claws and lives a happy, successful life in Oakland CA with his partner Alex. They are surrounded by 19 year old cat Monkey (aka Satan), 3 dogs - Bella (20 yrs old), Sophie (7 years old) and Moxie (2 years old). Sen continues to see veterinary and dog training clients. He also provides veterinary and small business consulting.  

Sen's passion for all things animals combines with his professional expertise to make him an invaluable member of the FAT™ team. He is also one of our early investors! who immediately recognized the power of this assessment tool.

 

  About Polycot Associates

Based in Austin, Texas, Polycot Associates is a worker-owned cooperative, providing strategic, comprehensive web consulting and development services, including web design and application development. See the Polycot website for more information.
story_txt:
CHANGE THE WAY YOU AND OTHERSCARE FOR YOUR DOGFUNCTIONAL ASSESSMENT TRACKING™ FOR DOG OWNERS AND PROFESSIONALSIntroducing a dog’s best friend: Functional Assessment Tracking™ (FAT™). Created by professional trainer Suzanne Clothier, FAT™ helps you translate what you know about a dog into a powerfully informative profile.Each profile is a reflection of your dog in that moment, in that setting, under those conditions. You may create as many profiles as you like, whether that’s every day or every now and then. Each profile can be emailed, printed out or shared via URLs, and all profiles become a part of that dog’s record.Available as a subscription service, FAT™ will become the hallmark of knowledgeable and compassionate caretakers, whether dedicated owners or animal professionals. 
  WHO NEEDS FAT™?DOG OWNERSYou are the expert on your dog. How can you effectively share that knowledge with others caring for your pet? How can you gain knowledge and insight on your pet’s changing needs?FAT™ makes sure what you know about your dog can go with your dog, so you know all caretakers have the information they need to provide the best possible care. The easy to use format guides you through 15 different aspects of your dog’s behavior, and then creates a comprehensive FAT™profile.As someone with many animals, Suzanne knows all too well the worries about leaving a beloved companion in someone’s care. FAT™ addresses those worries.  Stop asking yourself “Did I remember to tell them…?” Use FAT™ to provide them with the information they need to know. DOG CARE PROFESSIONALSSo much important information goes into caring for any dog. Will you remember to ask all the right questions? Will you or your staff remember all the details, or recognize changes? FAT™ makes sure that up-to-date, detailed information about the dog stays with the dog.FAT™ was created to help professional caretakers, such as:
Veterinarians & Staff
Trainers & Behaviorists
Shelters, Rescues & Sanctuaries
Boarding & Daycare Facilities
Dog Sitters & Dog Walkers
Service & Guide Dog Organizations
Therapy & Service Dogs
Accurate, easily communicated information is vital to providing the best possible care. FAT™ profiles give you and your entire staff a world of current information about each dog. Avoid the confusion of interpretation and inexpert assessments. FAT™ provides clear, observation based information that keeps every one on the same page, and doing the best for the dog. 
  WHAT'S IN A FAT™ Profile?A FAT™ profile is created using a 15-point scale that assesses the dog's physiological, social and cognitive function. Each point is scored on a 0-10 scale, with specifics provided at every step. No guesswork or confusing interpretations, just clear objective information based in observation.The easy to use website guides you through specifics of scoring behavior and responses. You do not need to be an expert in dog behavior to use FAT™ -- just able to recognize what a dog does or does not do.SAMPLE PROFILE (Prototype - final design will vary)                            Color coding of each score point helps you quickly recognize the overall dog as well as critical details, and know, at a glance, any changes in the dog's condition/behavior. 
 HOW IT WORKSFAT™ is an online subscription service. The FAT™ interface is easy to use, requires no training and is available on multiple platforms and devices.Each subscriber has their own web portal, which is private and secure. Professional subscriptions can be customized to include logos and other business related information.Once a FAT™ profile has been created for that dog, it is stored in his cumulative online record. There is no limit to the number of FAT™ profiles that can be created for any dog in your subscription. Profiles may be shared via email or a link, or printed. Every account has many features that allow you to customize how your account and dog profiles may be used, shared or limited.Subscriptions are priced according to the number of dogs for whom profiles will be created. Our lowest tier allows for 3 dog profiles, and on up to 2000+ profiles for professionals and organizations. At any time, you may choose to remove a dog from your plan, freeing up that space for another dog.Subscriptions are designed to be very flexible in terms of users - multiple users are possible. Each subscriber can set permissions for their account so that FAT™ works for you and your needs. 
 CASE HISTORY VIDEOS
Case History #1 RUNEThis case history shows how FAT tracks the changes in a young puppy over a 17 day period as she shifts from dealing with a mild problem to needing veterinary care and back to healthy puppy. Case History #2 BOARDING KENNELHere's how a boarding kennel uses FAT™ for two dogs who have previously boarded with them. Changing needs are shared with FAT™'s effective at-a-glance team communication.  
 FOR A LIFETIME 
  HOW FAT™ HELPS PROFESSIONALS
Dog care professionals will appreciate what FAT™ can do for their business, their staff and for the level of care they can provide.Assess Efficacy: Tracks changes +/- , pre-, mid- and post-treatment (behavioral, medical, physical therapy, exercise regimen, diet changes, etc.).Screen Clients In/Out: Identifies dogs that match your resources & staff, guides referrals to other professionals better suited.Maintain Consistency & Standardization: Allows clear communication across entire organization, departments & branches. Online and printed materials allow at-a-glance information for everyone handling the dog.Promotes Understanding of Dogs In Your Care: Helps client appreciate their dog as individual.Allocate Resources: Identify needs; make best use of your skills, facility, staff, and resources, particularly limited or specialized resources.Track Progress in Program: Follow dog's progress through your program. Ideal for guide/service dog organizations, breeders, trainers,  behaviorists, physical therapy and veterinarians.Pre-Placement: Clear picture of dog's needs & preferences; identify suitable homes (foster or permanent). Invaluable for breeders, shelters/rescues, sanctuary and guide/service dog organizations.Post-Placement: Detailed follow-up online positions you to be pro-active and helpful after the dog is in a new home. Invaluable for breeders, shelters/rescues, sanctuary and guide/service dog organizations.

  THE TEAMAbout Suzanne ClothierSuzanne Clothier has been working with animals professionally since 1977, with a deep, broadly varied background. She is well respected for her humane Relationship Centered Training (RCT™) approach to dogs and the people that love them.She has taught in the US, Canada, Belgium, Holland, Italy, Japan, Australia, New Zealand and the UK forgroups as varied as Wolf Park, Association of Pet Dog Trainers, the University of MN’s Nature-Based Therapeutics conference, many national and international conferences, and training groups. She also serves as a consultant to guide dog schools and service dog organizations.An innovative trainer, Suzanne’s work includes CARAT™, The Enriched Puppy Protocol™, RAT™ , FAT™, Really Real Relaxation™, Treat/Retreat, CCC™ (with Cindy Knowlton) and RCT™ techniques. Her work reflects the experience of a lifetime spent living with and caring for many animals. Her work has been presented in multiple international conferences, including most recently at the International Working Dog Breeder Association conference.She is an award-winning author of videos, books, booklets and numerous articles. She served as a committee member for the AKC’s Agility Advisory Board, and as a committee member of the American Humane Association’s Task Force for the Development of Humane Standards in Dog Training.When not traveling and teaching, Suzanne is at home with husband John Rice on their working farm in upstate New York, surrounded by dogs, cats, parrots, tortoises, horses, donkeys, pigs, chickens and Scottish Highland cattle. Suzanne is ably assisted by long-time colleague & friend Heather Leonard.   About Heather LeonardHeather Leonard has always had a great love for animals – surrounding herself with many different animals from a young age. Following her BS in Biopsychology with a focus on Animal Behavior, she worked as a veterinary technician for many years.  She co-founded Taming Anubis, specializing in private training at client’s homes. She currently runs The Bark & Call Inn, an in-home boarding/daycare on her farm.Heather has been working with Suzanne since 2002. She had the privilege implementing Suzanne’s training program at Guiding Eyes for the Blind. She brings her lifelong animal experience and professional expertise to her work with Suzanne on FAT™ and other programs.Heather lives on a New England farm with her husband, Andy, and a menagerie of animals – horses, goats, dogs, cats and chickens.  Heather is very excited about being part of the FAT™ team.   About Sen BeeverRaised on a horse farm in nowhere Kansas, Sen started young caring for and training a menagerie of animals. His long experience as a veterinary technician includes an Emergency & Specialty practice where he was taught how to handle the most critical patients; triage & ER became his specialty.After 15 years of management in every Board Certified veterinary specialty offered, he decided to follow his heart and live his dream in California. Sen owns Mister Beever's Paws & Claws and lives a happy, successful life in Oakland CA with his partner Alex. They are surrounded by 19 year old cat Monkey (aka Satan), 3 dogs - Bella (20 yrs old), Sophie (7 years old) and Moxie (2 years old). Sen continues to see veterinary and dog training clients. He also provides veterinary and small business consulting.  Sen's passion for all things animals combines with his professional expertise to make him an invaluable member of the FAT™ team. He is also one of our early investors! who immediately recognized the power of this assessment tool.   About Polycot AssociatesBased in Austin, Texas, Polycot Associates is a worker-owned cooperative, providing strategic, comprehensive web consulting and development services, including web design and application development.
